Reviews.Title: “Barocco Hotel. A true gem of Roman hotels.”
Reviews.Author: OLYA G
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Barocco Hotel with my family for this Easter vacation and can say nothing but great things about the place. Amazing staff (everyone was very nice and considerate, it's especially important when you travel with a 1-year-old as we did :-). Great location - 5-7 minute walk to Trevi Fountain, 1 minute walk to Piazza Barberini metro station. Extremely nice and stylish rooms, everything is in a great condition. Very generous, healthy and divers breakfasts. I hope the hotel managers will keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LLL4ENE
Reviews.Content: Hi me and my friends just came back from our 4 night stay in Barocco Hotel in Rome. The hotel is near to a lot of point of interest it is within walking distance. The service of the hotel is wonderful. The rooms are very clean and updated. They really make your stay comfortable, we had to leave our luggage there because we were going to Nice and come back so they helped with the luggage and when we came back all of our things were back in the room we were assigned they even upgraded our room for the same price. I really recommend this hotel to anyone, for their service, cleanliness, food, and friendly staff. They also speak well English. They are a perfect hotel. I will diffidently stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: mjdr1640
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for a week and had a very enjoyable stay. All of the staff was very friendly and courteous. The hotel is very clean and our rooms had been recently renovated and were nicely decorated. Our family had two rooms: the Suite and one of the "classic rooms". Both rooms had the same quality of furnishings and fixtures, so the main difference was size (and travertine floors in the suite vs. carpet in the classic room). Often the less expensive rooms at hotels tend to be of inferior quality. Beds are very comfortable. The rooms are small by American hotel standards, but the website accurately states the measurements of the rooms--so it was what we expected. Americans would refer to the Suite as a 1 1/2 bath (so the extra half bath was a nice surprise). Breakfast in the morning is also excellent. Location to the Metro is fabulous--we bought a week pass and took the metro/buses everywhere. Hotel arranged for a van to pick us up from the airport and drop us off for 70 Euros each way.

Reviews.Title: “A beutiful hotel cleaning and well kept”
Reviews.Author: Damarisrivera
Reviews.Content: Are stay was very relaxing they help us In all are needs we need it special lunch and they where kind to prepared it for us they even hold are lugged for 3days that made are trip very smooth We had a great time in this hotel it's small but big in service thanks

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem at Piazza Barberini”
Reviews.Author: CardioM
Reviews.Content: You would never know there was a recently refurbished hotel in this building. The rooms are in very good shape. It is in a great location just off the piazza, only a few steps from the Metro. There is also a taxi stand at the piazza, so transportation is not a problem. A very generous breakfast is provided (optional eggs cooked to order), and the staff are very pleasant and professional. There is a nice (small) bar on the premises. A good size market is within walking distance. All the recommendations made by the front desk for restaurants, etc. were excellent. They were very responsive to any requests we made. Several nice restaurants are nearby (nearby Osteria Barberini is good for lunch or dinner - most tables downstairs).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenC888
Reviews.Content: Hi, I just came back from a 5 night stay at the Barocco Hotel. The superior double room we stayed in is quite a ok size for us though there are other guests who said it's quite small. Location of hotel is excellent as you can practically walk to all the places of interest or take a bus or the metro which is very near the hotel. Service of staff is excellent 2, they are all very willing to help especially the front desk staff and nothing is too much for them. the only draw back is there is no tea/coffee facilities in the room. Other than that, this is an excellent hotel to stay. Breakfast is not 2 bad 2, choices are quite limited but ok for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect service, perfect facilities, want to keep this secret”
Reviews.Author: TandCfromHawaii
Reviews.Content: Ever since my husband booked us here 2 years ago, I've been hard pressed to find another hotel in Rome as good as this one. This hotel has lived up to its quality time and again, and this time was no different. Unfortunately we could only stay for 2 nights, but each was perfect. Location is great, near everything (sites, dining, shopping, metro, taxi stand), you really don't need a car, but if you brought one, there is a parking garage about 3-4 blocks away (covered, secured) for 18euro per day. The room we got was near the elevator and I was a little wary, but the walls are so thick we couldn't hear the elevator at all! The room lived up to my expectations with the most comfortable bed, soft sheets/blankets, ample variety of pillows. The shower with its variety of light colors provided a relaxing rain-shower like feel, perfect after a day of sightseeing and exploring. We were there for my birthday and the staff left me a lovely note with small dainties with our turn-down service. Breakfast was extravagant as usual, with the wide selection of juices, yogurts, meats, cheeses, breads, veggies, fruits, pastries, breakfast cakes, AND cooked to order eggs/omelettes and bacon. Delightful staff, ever attentive and polite. LOVE this hotel and would really want to keep it a secret so I can always be sure to have a room available when I'm in town! Thank you again, Hotel Barocco, for making my birthday stay perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LJNY603
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights there recently, had excellent experience. The location just couldn't be better, metro is right at the corner, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountains, Pantheon, etc. are all withing walking distance. Room was a bit small, even with a junior suite, to us Americans, there was barely nowhere to sit in the room. Also noise level is quite high, especially late at night and early in the morning. Breakfast was really good, coffee was excellent, good food selection too, just not many fruits. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Booked For A Gift - Great Results!”
Reviews.Author: BHill75
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a 5 night stay at the Barocco Hotel as a gift for my father (who is over 60). While I cannot directly review the property particulars, I can provide feedback on the booking process, customer service and attention to detail. The staff at Barocco Hotel were EXTREMELY responsive. Living in the US and trying to book a hotel for someone else can be intimidating enough, but the email responsiveness and assurances that were provided exceeded expectations and made me feel comfortable with the process. I cannot understate how important this was to me and they definitely understood the importance as well as delivered 100%. The trip involved my father traveling solo, so access to public transportation was the key factor in making the final decision (in addition to the positive feedback on Trip Advisor). I was concerned with the safety of the Termini metro stop (crowds, touristy, etc.), so choose this location. My father's feedback from the trip was that the hotel was extremely close to the metro stop (right across the street), the staff was attentive/helpful/responsive and the breakfast was very good. He would recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlesMAshburn_VA
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. The best hotel for the money in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: WendyChagrinFalls
Reviews.Content: Amazing place! We loved the location and everything about this charming hotel. One block from metro, wonderful and friendly staff, beautiful, clean rooms with very comfortable beds. Fabulous breakfast included in price. Walk to Spanish Steps, great shopping and many restaurants. I would positively stay here on my return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Steven L
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, wonderful service, tasty breakfast, perfect location right in the middle of the city and right by the metro to make transportation easy, or just walk a short distance to many sights such as the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, etc. We could not have asked for a better location or a friendlier staff. And did I mention that the breakfast was fantastic? I highly recommend this location!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome. Super Location.”
Reviews.Author: ZallyZally
Reviews.Content: Nice room.. good bed and linens. Everything spotless. Decent breakfast was included. Staff were attentive and met our needs fully. The strength of this hotel however is the location. Perfectly placed in Rome to visit all the sites you'd want to see on a city break. It was walking distance (for my wife and I, obviously people have different ideas of what's walkable), but the Trevi Fountain, and the Spanish Steps were within minutes. And for my wife and I, the Vatican and Colosseum were comfortably walkable (there and back in both cases), so we didn't need any public transport during our stay. All in all.. Barrocco has everything you could want in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Three perfect days and nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dmonkey_45
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome 6 or 7 times so far and my recent stay at the Hotel Barocco was my best hotel experience yet. I stayed in a double room for single use and while the room was very small, it was exactly as described, so there were no surprises. The bed was big and comfortable. The bathroom was modern and clean. In fact, the whole room was very, very clean. The staff at the front desk, especially Cristiano, were always friendly and extremely helpful in making dinner reservations and plans. The location on the Piazza Barberini is very central and just minutes from the Trevi Fountain. It's the first hotel in Rome I will recommend to friends and return to myself.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find better staff in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RetiredWazza
Reviews.Content: There may be better structural hotels but I doubt there is a better team of staff. From reception staff to the bar staff to Elizabeta at breakfast or Maximo in management, they all try to ensure guests are satisfied. We needed to change to a larger better room - no problem. We liked our breakfast eggs done a certain way - no problem. We asked for rubber pillows - no problem.problem And we arrived back in our final night to find a complimentary Prosecca bottle awaiting us. Alas we were too tired to drink it but really appreciated the kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicola P
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have just returned from spending four nights at this hotel. The location is brilliant - 5 mins walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps and the Metro is 2mins from the hotel and will transport you quickly and cheaply (1 Euro) to the Vatican and Colessum (we booked tours for these two sights through "Dark Rome", and they were very good). Our room was compact but comfortable. Sky and wi-fi were in the room. Our room faced a side street, and although a little noisy, this is too be expected in a city location Breakfast was nice, cereals, toast; fruit; yogurts; pasteries etc and they will also cook you fresh eggs on toast or an omlete on request. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. I would recommend ths hotel and if we are lucky enough to return to Rome we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: BonnieJRL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Barocco and enjoyed it very much. The location is perfect - an easy walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, plus a taxi stop is nearby. The staff at the hotel was professional and helpful. Our room was very comfortable and looked right out onto the piazza and the Bernini fountain. The breakfast was amazing! Lots of choices and delicious food. We especially loved that the hotel is 100% non-smoking. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Rome was made even more enjoyable by staying at this hotel. We arrived and were greeted by friendly staff. The staff was always eager to accomodate and assist with directions or dinner suggestions. As with many hotels in Rome, this hotel is fairly compact. The entry lobby is small, but a nice bar and dining area is located a short distance away. Our room was nicely furnished, and had a nice bathroom. The room was rather small, but again this is not unusual for Rome. There was enough room for two large suitcases and ability to get around the room without feeling cramped. The hotel is in a great location, close to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, and the Metro. We were able to walk everywhere from this location, and it was nice to step outside and find a great restaurant nearby. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: NR12345678910
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights stay in March at Barocco hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. I had made a special request prior to my travel and found that they were most accomodating and my request was followed through to perfection. Breakfast was very good, would definitely recommend the omelet with cheese (they even had soy milk which I did not expect in a 4 star hotel!). The location of the hotel is amazing, walking distance to most of the main attractions. Rooms were very clean with a turn down service and OMG the bed was the best I have ever slept in! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and already cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Allan P
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barroco is an excellent hotel that has wonderful bed, big bathroom, great free breakfast, good services, courteous and helpful staffs, free WIFI works in room, and located very near metro station. Although the room looks elegant, but it is very compact in size, that it limits to at most 2 big luggage bags. The hotel hides in a side street with a very small lobby. The location is not as crowded as Spanish Steps or Station Termini. Mini bar is not free, and there is no kettle in room. You can buy water at a supermacato 400m down the road Via Del Tritone, at the junction of Via del Traforo and Via in Arcione, where you can find a nice little restaurant named That's Amore, and behind there is another good restaurant Trattoria Tritone. If you walk further down Via Del Tritone, you can find Trevi fountain, where there are many eating places. You will do a lot of walking in Rome. If you need to find toilet, go to a nice cafe with wash room and buy a cup of coffee, and then you can use the washroom after your drink. There will be long queue at the mall or McDonald for washroom, and its not cheap to go to washroom at Station Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further...”
Reviews.Author: Christian G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a nice room(43) with a terasse and the room was very nice and clean. Breakfast was not huge but very well prepared and the complimentary warm offering was great - I can for sure recommend the omelet .. Very good and friendly service by the staff.. always smiling and ready to help. The location is great and well positioned for restaurants and sigths.. Try it....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location; good value too!”
Reviews.Author: skippy-rates
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at this hotel. Good, sensibly priced hotels can be hard to find in Rome in my experience. Stayed here on the basis of previous reviews and was not disappointed. Stayed in the annex: room was smallish, but well appointed and very clean. Very comfy beds! There were a small number of minor issues during our stay, but these were dealt with very efficiently by the friendly staff. Excellent, complimentary breakfast. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing few days at a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: candor74
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. I booked on the basis of the reviews on here and we weren't disappointed. This is a fantastic hotel. The staff were all very friendly and willing to give help wherever needed. They were a pleasure to deal with. The breakfast was lovely as well. Freshly cooked eggs are available alongside a number of different meats, breads and cheeses. There was also a selection of cereals and done yoghurt. Lovely. Where this hotel really came into its own was with the little touches you often don't get with a large chain. They really take advantage of being a smallish hotel. The bedroom was set up really well with a complimentary plate of fruit as well as a fresh flower being used to decorated the bed. Maids were in twice a day to make sure everything was great. We were also particularly impressed with having some complimentary pastries/biscuits on our last night when we returned to our room along with a handwritten note from the manager thanking us for staying with them. A great hotel. If we're in Rome again we'll be making the Barocco Hotel our first port of call.

Reviews.Title: “Let me save you”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover55
Reviews.Content: I just don't get it. I read all these wonderful reviews, and this is the first time that Trip Advisor has let me down. First of all, there is no lobby. It's like checking into a motel. The people behind the desk are so unhelpful. At best they have 2 recommendations for dinner. Impossible to converse with them and it wasn't a language barrier. The room was so HOT, and the street so noisy, that you cannot open the windows. There is no air circulation, and sleep was impossible. Yes, there is a nice breakfast, in rooms with no windows. Yes, it was clean, and the bathroom was modern. At this time of year Rome is quite empty, as was this hotel. Do yourself a favor, and find an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: marionjane59
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a three day trip to Rome and stayed at the Barocco. The service and accommodation was top notch. In particular the breakfast buffet was exceptional and kept us going all day. Thoroughly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Met My High Expectations;Lovely Property,Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MichelefromNY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Rome, enjoying 7 wonderful nights at the Hotel Barocco. Thank you to all of the previous posters who spoke highly of this property. It is very well run, spotlessly clean, and ideally located. The entrance is off of a small side street, a few steps off of the Piazza Barberini. The "Barberini" Metro stop on the Red line, is a 2 minute walk away. (We saved a ton of $ using the Metro vs. taxis, unlike our last trip to Rome when we didn't know any better. Definitely use the Metro; it's clean, safe, and easy). The entrance is nothing special; in fact, my first impression was "uh oh, I hope I didn't make a mistake". Our superior room was lovely, but a little small. When I inquired as to whether it was a superior or standard room, the woman who showed us to the room took my question as dissatisfaction and called the front desk. A few minutes later, we were shown a deluxe room and were told it was ours for the same rate. Excellent customer service and gorgeous room! Spacious room, beautiful furnishings, clean carpet (I walked around barefoot- big deal for me), king sized bed, large marble bath, quiet location. Also appreciated the plate of fresh fruit that welcomed us. Breakfast was wonderful. Set up down one flight from the "lobby", you could help yourself to: fresh cheese and breads, jams and nutella, pastries, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cereals, juices, charcuterie and then sit down in one of several rooms, each set up with several clothed tables. A server would bring your coffee, etc.. and ask if you wanted anything off their "hot" menu - eggs, omelets, bacon. Really, really, nice. With the exception of one concierge, who we referred to as "Mr. Happy", the staff was friendly and helpful in making and canceling dinner reservations, checking our flight, and arranging our transportation to and from the airport (we used their private airport transportation service both ways and were happy - driver was punctual, friendly, safe). It turned out that our flight home was canceled due to a strike, and we needed to stay another night. They were fully booked, but assured us they would help us find another room. The next morning, they received a cancellation and allowed us to stay another night in our beautiful room. Highly recommend and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lindaisin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 4 nights our first time in Rome this February. We were very happy with the staff and the facilities. Loved the bed, the bathroom and the atmosphere of the whole place. Breakfast was perfect...both a continental selection of fruit, meats, cereals, yogurts and breads PLUS you can order toast, eggs, omelets. All complimentary and offered for a decent period of time. Excellent service in the breakfast room as well. The only drawback of the breakfast for us was it didn't start until 7 and as we are both early risers, we were unable to find a cup of coffee anywhere close to the hotel! Would be very desirable to even have a kettle and a few packets of instant for those of us seeking coffee outside of the set times placed in the lobby somewhere. We also found the room quite warm and were unable to modify the heat/air ourselves. We had to open a window for relief during the night which let in the noise of the busy city around us. The windows were, however, when closed, pretty good at keeping the noise out. Overall, I would say this hotel was a great place, we walked everywhere except once we took the metro home. I think the temperature issue in the room was due to timing, not needing a/c so it's not on but too warm for closed windows. I'd stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Fantastic staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2/12 and loved the place. It is impecably clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. Location can't be beat as you can walk to almost every major attraction in Rome. The complimentary breakfast was in a word incredible!! Again the staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful, highly reccomend!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: au7504
Reviews.Content: I rarely keep information on hotels but this one is an exception. I made sure I brought a card from the front desk home with me. Some of my family may be visiting Rome in the future and I wanted them to stay at The Hotel Barocco. It is just a little off the main street which was great. The staff was absolutely fantastic, from the front desk to the wait staff for breakfast. Our room was very quiet and cozy. The hotel is within walking distance of many of the attractions. You will not be disappointed with your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: snydes
Reviews.Content: A little late with the review, but that is not at all because the Hotel Barocco doesn't merit to be mentioned. A classy little hotel just off a main street - easily walkable to many attractions ... Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. The hop on/off tour buses also stop close by and we were able to buy our tickets at the hotel (a good choice to cover off a few last stops for our last day in Rome). No bathtub, but lovely clean bathroom. A super comfy bed, free wifi, and satellite T.V. made for very relaxing pit stops. An 'added touch' was the turn down service complete with a 'good night' floor mat on each side of the bed. The breakfast (included) was our best of the trip! A huge selection of meats, cheeses, pastries, fresh fruits and juices was available buffet style, or you can order off the menu - eggs, omelettes, etc. Just don't forget the cappucino :) n.b. if you stay here be sure to check out the Crypt of the Capuchin Monks just around the corner in the Church of Santa Maria della Concezione dei Cappuccini. A remarkable, and eerie display of the skeletal remains of bodies believed to be Capuchin friars. (Be sure to wear long sleeves and pants).

Reviews.Title: “Three Coins in the Fountain”
Reviews.Author: freedom2go19
Reviews.Content: A short break in Rome starting on St. Valentine's day required a quiet hotel close to the major attractions. The Hotel Barocco did not disappoint. We chose a room in the annex which was indeed extremely quiet and comfortable. The room was warm despite the very low temperatures Rome was experiencing at the time of our visit. The breakfast provided was more than adequate for setting us up for a full day of city exploration. The hotel's location was ideal for getting to most of the city's attractions on foot although we did also use the buses (better than the metro) and included in our 'Roma Pass'. The comments others have made regarding the warm of the welcome and friendliness of the staff are not exaggerated. We could not have expected more.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a perfect break in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: j04nn3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came back from Rome last night, after spending four days and three nights in Hotel Barocco. It took a while to choose which hotel to stay in for our mini getaway in the half term holidays, but we are SO glad we chose Barocco! We were made welcome straight away, and shown to our gorgeous room (husband very happy to see the words SKY next to the bed!!) The bed was extremely comfortable and we loved the shower! Mood lighting is a great little touch! Breakfast was excellent, served with amazing coffee and a smile with the service, which was always lovely to at 8am!! We really could not fault this hotel; it really is in the perfect location for seeing everything in Rome. We walked miles and miles every day, but knew it was never far back to our hotel. The Trevi Fountain is only a few minutes walk away, and we were surprised with how close the Colosseum was too! If we were to return to Rome in the future, we would certainly stay here. Coming to Rome in February was also great, as the weather was sunny and crisp. Thank you to all at Hotel Borocco for making our trip to the fabulous Rome, truly unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Rome in the snow”
Reviews.Author: Pauline B
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a snowy Rome, staying at the Hotel Barocco. My daught found the Hotel Barocco quite by accident, it is perfectly situated for finding your way around, equidistant to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. Everything is within walking distance - just bring a pair of comfy shoes! The hotel was so cosy and warm and as it had snowed when we arrived we were delighted, everything was spotless (we stayed in room 35). Breakfast as everyone else said was great. Would have loved a bath in the room but it wasn't really a problem and there wasn't much atmosphere around the small bar area, but apart from these small things, I would recommend this as a place to stay. Lovely restaurants around the corner in the Via Veneto. The bed was really comfy as were the pillows so a good night's sleep was had by all. The taxi service from the hotel to the airport was good value - 50 euros; the cost of 2 train tickets would have been 18 euros each and then trailing the suitcases to/from the hotel, not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barocco - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Vasilache
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked through Internet (after seeing many hotels reviews) Hotel Barocco and stayed there three nights, 26-29 January, 2012, at sixth floor. To sum it up from the beginning - an excellent hotel. Excellent breakfast - elegance and multitude, you can even order fresh omlette. The location is also excellent - within walking distance from many, if not most, tourist attractions, especially the ancient part of Rome. The room was clean, spacious, with many windows, and large beds. Nice service too. Definitely a place to stay in a vacation. Dr.ing. Dan and Arh. Ana Vasilache, Romania

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely decorated and is very close to Metro and bus station. Some sight-seeing places are within walking distance. Also with great choices of nice restaurants around. We were in Roma during the heavy snow and we were able to still tour around. Breakfast was yummy. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Hotel Barocco”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine T
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our decision to stay at the Hotel Barocco during our visit to Rome. The staff was warm, welcoming, very helpful, and eager to make our stay a special one. Our room was beautifully appointed and the bed was extremely comfortable. The location was one of the reasons we had decided to stay here and it was perfect for visiting numerous sites. With the metro/subway stop just around the corner, thanks to Cristiano’s suggestion, we were even able to get around despite the unusual snow storm. We also enjoyed the delicious breakfast selections set out each morning and the special touches (such as the chilled Prosecco) throughout our stay. The front desk also arranged for a car service to the airport that was basically the same cost as a taxi…although we were quite reluctant to leave this wonderful hotel. We will highly recommend the Hotel Barocco to any family and friends visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: solu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early November 2011. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain nearby, lots of nice little restaurants just around the corner. Hard Rock Cafe just up the road as well. My husband and I walked everywhere including to the Vatican and the Colosseum. Breakfast was excellent, a very good selection of pastries, cereal, fruit and you could order a hot meal if you wished and excellent cappacinos. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Hotel in Rome, excellent location"”
Reviews.Author: Tracy N
Reviews.Content: My sweetheart and I went to Italy for Christmas and New Years. First stop Hotel Barocco, Rome. What a fantastic choice!! Boutique Hotel with wonderful service. We opted for their car service which left out trying to find our hotel after the long flight over. Walked out of customs and there was the driver waiting with our name on a small sign. Nice touch and definitely worth the extra $$. Our room was small but beautifully decorated. My husband fell in love with the shower:-) (so did I and I don't even like showers) Intimate and romantic. Breakfast was not only buffet but also you could have it made to order which was a nice change. Staff was awesome and so helpful in directing us to all the must see attractions that were all within walking distance. We decided our next trip to Rome, next year, we will definitely be returning to Hotel Barocco!! Ciao, Fabrizio! PS. The only reason I didn't give sleep quality 5 stars, well...it being such a romantic hotel you may hear someone else enjoying themselves:-) No worries we did, too!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Audrey W
Reviews.Content: Rooms very confortable (especially confortable mattress and bathroom) Delicious and generous breakfast included Very warm and helpful concierges Nice location Great place for a decent price. I recommend

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant base for visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: dave h
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Rome to stay for 4 nights for a sight seeing break. We chose the Barocco Hotel for its location and reviews on Trip Advisor. In our opinion it exceeded all expectations. We stayed in the annex building next door. Staff were friendly and incredibly helpful; from the bell boy to the bar staff to the reception, nothing was too much trouble and they always went the extra mile with finding restaurants, serving snacks in the bar and assisting with travel arrangements. I would not hesitate to stay at the Barocco Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Anabel C
Reviews.Content: Great location in Rome, close to everything and great bars and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel staff were exceptional. When we arrived, we had a problem with our room and within 15 minutes, they had resolved the problem and changed our room for us. Great service! Breakfast was delicious, good variety and the bar service was excellent - we asked for drinks and they kept bringing little nibbles to compliment our drinks. Again, the staff were helpful with suggestions for good restaurants and how to get tickets for different sites. I would definitely recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Rome Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: Jed D
Reviews.Content: Great hotel near the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Also, just down the street from a Metro stop which is very nice. We stayed in the annex part of the building and our room was fairly large and had a very nice bathroom. The front desk was very helpful recommending places to have dinner. A very nice breakfast is included.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MrsWadd1231
Reviews.Content: I had read over and over the Italian room hotels were tiny, my room was HUGE along with the bathroom. King size, soft, comfortable bed, bathtub with changing colorful lights, tv with satellite, and the best part was the breakfast. Countless options of breads, cheese, fruits, made to order omelettes and the best cappuccino I have ever had! Within minutes walk to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, trendy Via Veneto, metro station & the best and cheapest little sandwich deli accross the street. I loved this hotel so much I am planning on going back and staying at this Fabulous Gem!!! Also, extremely friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel awesome location”
Reviews.Author: alibnz
Reviews.Content: We were on a short trip to Rome, and the Hotel Barocco was perfectly situated for our whirlwind daytime sightseeing and our relaxed evening dining and people watching. A short walk to the Trevi Fountain, and the top of the Spanish Steps as well as many other of the tourist attractions. The room was well appointed and everything you could want from a hotel room - clean, tidy, comfy bed (needed with all the walking we did). Two funny things - the first is thwe coloured lights in the bathroom (ours was in the shower) whish had LED lights that started off white, then went through all the colours of the rainbow. I showered under Red, Green and Purple. The second was the lift/elevator, which was the most funny I have been in. Covered in mirror's and room for 3 people, as long as you dont mind being friendly. LOL. Breakfast was scummy. The pastries and tarts and allsorts of other goodies, along with eggs how you want. And proper coffee - I am from New Zealand and we are a bit snobby abou our coffee, and the 2 weeks I was in the UK, I had poor coffee experiences. Rome was a godsend. And it started everyday at the Hotel Barocco. The staff were friendly and attentive and very helpful. Lots of great suggestions, without being pushy in any one direction. Only downer was that I went to use the bar one night, but no staff, but that was no big loss I just went out and went somewhere else. It did not detract from my experience in any way. I would throughly recommend this hotel (and have done to several friends), and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Rogerpaulm
Reviews.Content: You look for cleanliness, great staff, and handy location. Barocco also has a superb breakfast. We stayed in a family suite. A bit small but very very good. Thoroughly recommended. Staff attitude excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A truly Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: LisaS44_12
Reviews.Content: When in Rome....head to Piazza Barberini! Staying at Hotel Barocco is like stepping into another world, not just in ambiance and character, but also in the exemplary service of the staff and management. Our room was a Junior Suite with a King Size bed and a pull-out sofa bed in a separate room. There were 1 1/2 baths which was great for our family. Breakfast and wi-fi internet was included. Though I didn't particularly have any trouble, the internet can be slow; be forewarned and have patience. The staff were knowledgeable and friendly suggesting restaurants throughout our stay and particularly on Christmas Day, as well as sites we might like to see. They also assisted us with our travel plans as we took a side trip to Perugia and helped us navigate the regional train system. For a truly Roman Holiday, we would definitely recommend Hotel Barocco!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonspongebob
Reviews.Content: hotel is well located near the Barberini Metro- 2 stops away from Termini station when you take the train in from Fuimicino airport. Breakfast is lovely and the staff are brilliant - friendly, helpful and warm. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gem in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Barocco last October and just fell in love with this charming hotel. It is tucked away on a narrow side street but just a stones throw from the sites one goes to Rome to see. Its very Italian elegance is so pleasing, and its coziness is so comfortable. I have the fondest of memories of my brief stay there, and the staff couldn't be more gracious. Thank you Hotel Barocco for adding to the wonderful memories I have of a life-long dream to visit your magnificent city!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy C
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Barocco is situated in a quiet pretty cobblestone side street, yet is within walking distance of the must-see attractions of Rome. Also close by are the 'Hop On, Hop Off Tour Buses' and Taxis etc. The hotel is well run; Management and staff are very helpful. My room was well equipped. After a good night's sleep in a sumptuous bed, I went down to breakfast. The table contained an assortment of foods displayed on a Backcloth of Apricot Damask. The hotel has a dignity and charm; It offers the guests a touch of luxury. In my opinion it is...... Simply The Best! The Tops! The Crème De La Crème.

Reviews.Title: “Defintely not worthy of its 4-star rating”
Reviews.Author: May N
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews on tripadvisor but was very disappointed with the standard of the room. We stayed at room 10 in the annex building. The room was tiny even in European standard, they can't even fit in a table and we have to cramp everything on the cupboard in front of the tv. The carpet was extremely worn out with dirt marks all over the place. The bedding was below standard and they don't even provide a quilt but only an old piece of cloth and blanket. This is not what I expect to get for the room rate they are charging. The bathroom looks new and big but the amenities are lacking, they provide plastic disposable cups instead of proper glass for toothbrushing. This is not a 4-star hotel standard. Apart from the convenient location and helpful front desk staff, there is nothing good about this hotel. Definitely not worthy of 4-star rating and we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barocco”
Reviews.Author: BBH080
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Barocco last spring & loved it. It's in a beautiful area of Rome. You can walk to the Spanish Steps & the Trevi Fountain (5-10 minute walk for both). Via Veneto with it's charming restaurants are right around the corner & Pepi's Bar is in the square about a 2 minute walk away. The Hotel was extremely comfortable & well appointed. We stayed in the Annex & it was great. The mattress on our bed was heavenly, our room was nicely sized, & the bathroom was also a decent size. The staff spoke excellent English & was extremely accomodating. It was a quiet hotel so sleep was no problem. The area it was located in was a nice area (I felt comfortable walking around by myself) & was about a 10 minute taxi ride to the train station. This was our first trip to Italy, but we will definitely be back to Hotel Barocco. Bonnie & Mark

Reviews.Title: “Noise of personell and internet are a problem”
Reviews.Author: Rubyrub
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a convenient area of rome. Overall it is nice. However, being a 4 star hotel I would have expected: 1. Better internet service. We were in a double room but only one device per time could be connected, and the password had to be re-entered all the times 2. The personnel were loud on my floor every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: adrian s
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had just come from a week stay in Paris at another hotel, also rated 4 stars. We could not believe how bad that hotel was. It did not deserve 4 stars at all. So we arrive in Rome, after booking this 4 star hotel through Expedia, expecting the worst. Well, we were in for an extremely pleasant surprise. To summarize the experience, when I walked into our room the first thing I said was, "Now THIS is a 4 star hotel." When we arrived at the front desk we were greeted by very friendly staff who quickly accommodated us by getting our room prepared in 10 minutes, despite the fact that we arrived early in the morning and check in wasn't till 3pm. When we entered our room the first thing we noticed was that it was much bigger than the last room we had stayed in in Paris and it was impeccably clean. The bathroom was gorgeous. This felt like a true luxury boutique hotel. The bed was super comfortable with great pillows. The room had double windows, so you would have to open one to get to the outside window and open the other one. We were thinking that because we were in the middle of a busy area, it would be noisy in the room. But because of this window set up, the room was practically sound proof. The carpeting was soft and clean and it was a pleasure to walk barefoot on it. The concierge/front desk was incredibly helpful. I felt confident that I could go on his recommendation and not be disappointed. Every single place they suggested was excellent, making our experience in Rome that much better, and that's what a concierge should have to do. The breakfast buffet was absolutely fantastic. I still think about it to this day. So many options and everything was delicious. The location on this hotel is perfect. We could walk to every important area and it even had a metro station right down the street. Very convenient, although we hardly used it because we opted to walk everywhere. I only have two complaints about this hotel. One, the free wifi was not that great. An erratic and often times slow connection had me a bit frustrated. And my second complaint is... that we had to leave. We were so happy at this hotel that I didn't want this part of our trip to end. With the Internet problem, I considered dropping the rating to 4 stars, but you know what? This hotel is so wonderful that I won't let that small issue drop its rating. 5 stars for me and I definitely recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barocco - First Rate”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn276
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently traveled to Rome and stayed at the Hotel Barocco for seven nights in total. We were extremely pleased with the hotel and its staff. The room was immaculate and the beds were super comfortable. The bathrooms were up-to-date and spacious. After five nights, we were leaving for an interim visit to Venice. We were able to repack into smaller suitcases and leave our large bags at the hotel for our return visit. On our return, our bags were waiting in our new room, which was as comfortable as the first, albeit a bit smaller. Breakfasts were beautifully set out and special ordered omelets were delicious. The bar is well stocked and light snacks were provided. The hotel staff is very helpful with great recommendations for restaurants. The location is superb -in the middle of the city, in close proximity to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, the Via Veneto and the Colosseum - you can't get much better. The fact that Piazza Barberini has its own metro stop makes it easy to get to the Vatican and elsewhere. All in all, a fabulous boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise in a hotel that delights”
Reviews.Author: DavidMichaeli
Reviews.Content: Our expectation from a 4 stars hotel was for a comfortable and satisfying stay, but Hotel Barocco managed to exceed our expectation! The spacious room was beautifully decorated and furnished and simply delighted us through our 4 nights stay. We stayed in the rooms in the annex (a separate building), but if this is the deal - getting this great hotel while compromising the little inconvenience of getting into the room using keys of apartments house rather than through the hotel lobby, this is a well worth compromise (the rooms in the main hotel are significantly more expensive). The breakfast was also a sheer delight, best selection of cheese and ham, special omelet selection, with such nice attentive service. The service was excellent throughout our stay, useful and always with a kind smile. We will definitely return...

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Worthy of its Four Star Rating!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie S
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that this hotel's four star rating is well deserved. My husband and I found Hotel Barocco on Expedia and booked right away since the reviews were excellent, price was very reasonable, and location was clutch. We flew in from an eight day trip from Paris which was quite a disappointment. We stayed at a hotel that even though it was rated four stars, I must say that it currently stands at a two star rating IMO. From filthy carpeting to poor lighting and broken mirrors in the room to poor recommendations from the concierge. People in general were rude. We couldn't wait to get out of Paris and leave to Rome. We knew that it couldn't get any worse plus we had a good feeling about Rome. We arrived via taxi to Hotel Barocco and were so pleased from the moment we set foot inside. Check in was a breeze. We got there a lot earlier than our check in time. The front desk assured us our room would be ready in 15 minutes and kindly asked us to wait in the lobby. We were so surprised that we didn't have to leave our luggage in a closet and wait for hours until check in time unlike the hotel we stayed at in Paris. When the room was ready, we were taken in the elevator which is quite small. I say maybe five slim people fit maximum. Our bags were to follow separately. We stayed on the first floor in lucky room number 13 which was a room very near Piazza Barberini. The room had windows--each window consisted of double pane windows so you had to open two windows in order to hear the outside street noise. Since the hotel controls the central a/c, you don't have access to adjust the temperature in your room. If it's too warm, you would need to open the windows. The room was perfect only for two people. It provided enough space for each piece of luggage we brought along with a carryon each. The bed was very comfortable. I couldn't use the down comforter they provided because the most I sleep with is a thin blanket plus I found the room to be a bit hot for a down comforter unless you slept with the window open. Pillows were comfortable as well. I loved the bathroom--so spacious, with great toiletries, and a bidet. The shower was very nice as well. My only complaint about the shower is that if I tried to make the water hot just how I like it, the pressure kept decreasing. It decreased to the point where it barely had pressure and it was a rain shower head which you can adjust. As I adjusted it, the water just dripped downwards rather than sideways. The safe was super duper tiny. We could only fit a few pieces such as wallet, weddings bands, small camera, iPad, etc. Our professional Canon camera and MacBook had to stay outside. We felt very safe there, so we knew it wouldn't be a problem. Our room rate included free breakfast buffet plus wifi. The breakfast buffet was incredible! As soon as you walk into the dining area, you are greeted by your friendly waitress and you get to choose where you would like to sit. The center table had a spread of various cheese and bread, luncheon meats such as ham and prosciutto, pastries such as glazed croissants and cannoli, butter, jams, and honey. The back table had a spread of various cereals, juices, and milk. You also had the option of ordering eggs from their menu. Every morning I had scrambled eggs with bacon and it was delicious. Now, when it comes to their wifi, it pretty much is terrible. Many sites I tried visiting could not be opened, most site that did open where directed to their European affiliation, and every time the laptop went idle, the wifi connection was lost and the access code had to be reentered. My husband had to turn off and on the wifi on his iPad over and over again in order to get it working properly. We read in an announcement the hotel left in our room that Italy has one of the worst Internet connections in the world with very slow speeds. Quite frankly, it's true. They are working on improving it. Concierge service was excellent! All dining recommendations were fantastic! Not one restaurant was mediocre. Every place we dined at had excellent food and top notch service. We are looking to come back to Rome with our family since we had such a fantastic time, so we asked if they had suites for a family. Unfortunately, they don't provide rooms for over three guests which is quite a bummer. We loved everything about this hotel except for the wifi issues. Guess we will need to look elsewhere with a family suite. :(

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !”
Reviews.Author: Mohsinx
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Location and very helpful front desk if you are a tourist you won't go wrong in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Randall4867
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well located and staff in general was good and helpful. Room and bathroom a bit small, but well appointed and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barocco”
Reviews.Author: SAMCharleston
Reviews.Content: We adored this hotel! Actually, our room was in the annex, a few feet from the main hotel entrance. We entered through a huge heavy door, climbed the stairs (optional lift) went thru another door, down a short hall, and entered our mini-suite. There was an entry, a small room with armoire, then bathroom, and another room with bed and desk! Plenty of space, and heated tile floors!

Reviews.Title: “Italy gem”
Reviews.Author: Kathy P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and the service was pot standing. Great location in the middle of the city. Outstanding free breakfast buffet included and let me tell you it was everything you could ever want. I Highly recommomend and would sray again next trip! Perfecto!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Haven In The Centre Of Rome”
Reviews.Author: DEREK C
Reviews.Content: The Barocco Hotel is located within easy walking distance of The Fontana Di Trevi, The Piazza Di Spagna and The Pantheon. The Vatican and The Colosseum are in walking distance but taxis are cheap or ride in style in a Horse Driven Carriage. All staff at the Hotel are friendly and helpful. The rooms are individually styled, spotlessly clean with very comfortable top of the range Memory Foam Beds. Flat Screen Satellite TV; Watch Sport, Fashion and News channels are Free or watch Movies for a small charge. Problem is the beds are so comfortable I challenge anybody to stay awake for more than 20 minutes, especially after a full day of sightseeing. The breakfast was excellent and consisted of Cereals, Meats, different tasty Cheeses, Fruit, Fresh Fruit Juices, Yogurt, delicious Pastries and Cakes. Try the speciality Italian Breakfast Omelette and get well tanked up with the full flavoured Coffee. This Hotel is a peaceful haven in the centre of a very busy and vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “orkney”
Reviews.Author: Sheila H
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, clean and comfortable room, good location. First time in Rome, we stayed 5 nights and would go back to Barocco hotel if we returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Graeme R
Reviews.Content: As this was our first visit to Rome, we did not know anything about the quality of the hotels that were there, but we need not have worried. The Barocco is a gem. Very good location for all the sights, very good hotel staff that were always very professional and pleasant to talk to and the hotel is very clean and tidy. But most importantly for us, the room we had (number 43) was perfect. Clean bathroom with waterfall shower, good sized and comfortable bed. It also had a balcony with some lounging chairs and a table, oh and also the outdoor Jacuzzi. Whatever time we left the room to go out, it would always be made-up, clean and tidy on our return. If shopping is your desire, then Via Condotti (not far from the Spanish Steps) is a great place to go, as my good little lady will vouch for and is also within walking distance of the hotel so that you don’t have to carry all those designer shopping bags too far! Also plenty of good eateries all within a few minutes walk of the hotel. I really can not pick any faults with the Barocco and I’m very fussy where I stay! It really is a must place to stay if you are in Rome and we will certainly stay there again whenever back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great staff & Excellent Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TypeAgirl
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th time to Rome and I love this hotel. I used my american airline points to book the room, classic double, and it was perfect. We had room 52, great bathroom and rainfall shower. Beds very comfortable and enough room to move around the beds on both sides. Did not feel cramp even with 2 large pieces of luggage. Best part, they actually had a few english channels on the cable box that showed variety shows so you are not stuck watching CNN the entire trip. I took my 71 yr old mom this trip and we mostly walked everywhere. Since I had been so many times, we visited areas we had not been before. I would HIGHLY recommend if you are going to be there on a Sunday to check out their Flea Market at Porta Portese. It is held every sunday from 7-1 pm - we got there about 8:30 am and it was not too crowded but did get very congested by 11. You will find the same scarves and jewelery there that you find on Via del Corso shopping street. I am sure you all know how to haggle, but what worked best for me is as soon as I made my counter offer, if they said no, or tried to negotiate, I put the merchandise down and walked away. Every time they yelled after me and gave me my price. You have to let them know that you do not feel it is worth more than the price you mentioned and you will not negotiate, it will save you time. Also if you are new to Rome, I recommend the hop on hop off bus. You can walk to everything, but the colosseum is a good walk and all the buses stop there. (or take metro, there is a station right next to the hotel) Also, it is great to take around at night to see Rome with all the lights on. The hotel can accommodate with tickets, same price as the vender down the street selling it. There is a travel agency right next door for any train needs or other things. We decided to book a train to Florence for the day since it is only a 1.5 hr direct ride. We left at 8:30 and returned at 7 pm. That is enough time to spend there - make sure you go to the san lorenzo market - mainly leather purses, but some pretty leather bound note pads. They offer free wi-fi and if you do not have a laptop, they have one by the front desk that they let you jump on and check your emails - no charge. But the BEST thing about the hotel is the BREAKFAST. The best spread I have had at any hotel in Europe. Fresh eggs & bacon cooked to order, prosciutto platters, cheese platter with 4 different kinds to cut from, sliced tomatoes and mozzerella balls, etc. Stay here, rooms are quiet, beds are great, staff is very helpful and the breakfast is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “"Very Pleasant"”
Reviews.Author: SteveAndi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great staff and cozy rooms. Everyone made sure our stay was enjoyable and was helpful in providing information and useful tips. Our only complaint was that the air conditioning and heating is controlled by one person and is not changeable. It was the beginning of November and still pleasant outside. The hotel turned the heat on making it very hot at night. We found out this was true for just about every hotel in Italy. We tried to open the windows but because this hotel is in a great location it is noisy outside and loud at night. Overall a great hotel and would stay here again (just would bring a fan). The breakfast was one of the best we had in Italy!!! The bartender here is excellent and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “First class service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Danielle O
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in Nov '11. You couldn't get a better location. 5 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and a walk past the Trevi Fountain became our regular short cut back to the hotel! All the staff are incredibly helpful and informative. We booked tours directly through the hotel and they worked out to be great value and saved any queuing. The room (we were in 14) was great, looked out over the square and with the added benefit of the smell of freshly baked croissants in the morning from the little cafe downstairs. I was especially a fan of the coloured mood shower. Well worth the money. I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find!”
Reviews.Author: Londondesign
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in an ideal location very near the Metro (Line A); a close walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain (largest Baroque fountain in the city) and there’s even a hop on hop off bus stop across the square. Breakfast was great if it’s included in your room package, as it can be expensive to eat out in Rome and the locals seem to survive the morning on just an espresso. Remember to try the eggs cooked to order. We had two superior rooms (double and twin), average size for Europe so fine for us. Bathroom and room was clean and tidy. Only thing that took a bit getting use to was the large abundance of light switches - they were everywhere. The room had SKY TV which showed BBC news; the majority of other channels were in Italian. There was an electronic safe in the room which was big enough for camera and passports (but not large enough for a netbook). The double room was quadruple-glazed so with both sets of windows shut, the noise from the square was cut right down, if you are a light sleeper you might want to ask for a room that doesn’t face the fountain and square. Only challenge is, you will need to investigate the wider city for ‘authentic’ places to eat, as the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain areas are rife with generic places trying to pull you in, avoid these when possible and if you pre-plan with Trip Advisor you can find some great places. We found one nice place just down the street the hotel is on, called Osteria Barberini. Very handy place when you first arrive. Barocco was actually our second choice as the first choice was full, but in hindsight after seeing the location of the other hotel, we lucked out. There’s not much else you can ask for. Fabio and Cristiano were very helpful and polite and helped us with booking museum & transport reservations and general day-to-day information. They went above and beyond in helping us make our visit more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: postcard_from
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Hotel lobby we were instantly greeted in a polite and friendly manner which set the tone for all our interactions with the hotel staff. As a welcome surprise we were upgraded to a Junior Suite which had a wonderful terrace overlooking Piazza Barberini. The hotel is a true gem ideally located within walking distance of The Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The hop on tour busses stop just opposite the hotel and are ideal for touring the further out sights (Vatican City, Colloseum, Roman Forum). Just around the corner is an excellent restaurant Hostaria Romano. We had an entertaining evening with a waiter who was hilarious. The food is fantastic and the free side dishes left us stuffed. There is an excellent bar just on the Piazza called Pepys which is a great spot overlooking the fountain. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drgnldy1952
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every part of our stay at this hotel! The location is convenient to many of the main attractions yet seems quiet and intimate. The staff could not be more helpful in making sure that we had everything we needed from directions to restaurant reservations. The rooms are cozy but quite nice and we had enough space for our luggage. The bathrobes & slippers were a welcome touch since we were traveling light. Breakfast was simply amazing ... with eggs cooked to order in addition to a delicious buffet. The bar area is also a nice spot for a drink before or after an evening out. The Hotel Barocco has it all ... great location, great service and a great value!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Nicklas V
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are on the smaller side (though not much more so than other European hotels), they are tastefully decorated and very comfortable. The bathrooms are quite large and updated, and the hotel service is fantastic. Breakfast is superb with great made-to-order eggs daily.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roy C
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel!! We spent four days in Rome after a long business trip. What a wonderful place to relax before returning home. We chose this hotel from reviews on tripadvisor. The reviews are right on target. We were more than pleased with this choice. Our room was lovely and most comfortable. We thought the room was large for European standards. The breakfasts were delicious, with many choices. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. The location was perfect, within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The Metro was right around the corner, no need for taxis or the hop on hop off bus. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and will absolutely stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barocco Hotel for a week in August and had a great time. The hotel was very nice and the entire staff was very helpful. I hope to return to Rome in the future and stay here again. The room was fairly spacious, the bed was comfortable, and everything was very clean. The included breakfast with cook-to-order eggs was great. All-in-all it was a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Romelover337
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff and yummy breakfast every morning. My husband and I spent almost a week at the Hotel Barocco. We had a chance to get to know Cristiano, Fabio and Nicola. We felt like family. There is attention to detail and the entire staff remembered us on the second day. The bed and pillows are to die for! Extremely comfortable beyond what we spoiled americicans are used to. Lots of support and you sink into the mattress and pillows but there is a high degree of support. No sore backs or necks. The public areas are very nice where guests can have a drink, breakfast or just a quiet moment with each other. I highly recommend this hotel. I hope we can get a room when we come back, I hope it doesn't get too popular!

Reviews.Title: “Good way to end our trip”
Reviews.Author: Crazybiggsy
Reviews.Content: This was our last hotel before returning home to Australia after 4 weeks of travelling. We had a room with no direct windows in which we appreciated at this stage of our trip as we were totally exhausted and weren't sleeping too well, the darkness of the room made it ever so easy to sleep in for us. Service was friendly particularly the breakfast staff, which was lovely. The hotel was located close to a lot of amenities and we would walk almost everywhere, with plenty of places to find good cheap meals and snacks around us. The staff helped out with reservations and organising our travel out to the airport, nothing was too much of a bother. THe hotel room was nice, a little small, but it had all that we expected in a hotel room, even the double bed was a pleasant surprise as we had been travelling for 4 weeks and double beds were few and far between, the were mostly two beds pushed together, as a couple this is not what we wanted, so we were cheering to see that we had a proper double bed!!! Overall it was a good hotel in terms of location, friendly staff and facilities that we were wanting.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely place”
Reviews.Author: karenkat3
Reviews.Content: I would have a breakfast menu for the guests and serve cappuccino. Also a bigger hotel sign for travelers to see from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Avocatraveler
Reviews.Content: Awesome property for the price. Super friendly staff, alway wiling to accomodate. Great front desk staff who provided maps, directions and dinner recommendations. Dining staff were propmt and kept the buffet fully stocked until the very last minute of the meal service. They will make you a pot of coffee any time during the day. Nick the bar tender poured a generous vodka dn soda and had plenty of US stories to share. Room was clean, we received an early check in and a room on the back side of the hotel which was super quiet, I wish we had the same in Florence.. The property locatio is close to EVERYTHING! Subway, taxi stand, liquor/wine shop, decent restaurants, tie shop, train tix counter in Tobacco shop right out side the door. 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. We walked to Vatican, 45 min and it was easy and exciting, very safe. This is NOT the Ritz Carlton so dont go there with that kind of attitude. The Barocco Hotel is a high end boutique Hotel of appx 45 room. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: petitegal22
Reviews.Content: Terrific. small boutique hotel in a great location. This hotel was absolutely lovely and extremely convenient to almost everywhere. Although our room was small it was so beautifully decorated and quiet. The marble bathroom was quite spacious with wonderful amenities and featured a rainshower and light therapy. Staff was courteous and extremely helpful. Breakfast was excellent. This will be the hotel I will stay at again, if ever back in Rome and I certainly would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to this glorious city.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel G
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel!! Great location. 5 minute walk to Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain! 10 minute walk to The Pantheon and Piazza Novano. Service was impeccable. The staff handled everything for me immediately and with a smile. They recommended great restaurants within walking distance. I felt the price was very fair. Europe is notorious for small hotel rooms. While these rooms are not huge, they are very nice and the bathroom is superb! All marble, great shower and plenty of counter space to put your toiletries. Decedent plush towels. The bed linens were first rate and the bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. AND, the breakfast, which is included in the room price was the best anywhere. I can't say enough positive things about this hotel. I only wish to be able to go back to Rome and see them again!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: BayouBorn
Reviews.Content: Our post-cruise stay at Hotel Barocco was the "icing on the cake"! We arrived mid-morning and were escorted to our spacious and lovely room within a very few minutes, even though we were early to check-in. Every employee that we met was helpful and always greeted us with a smile. We requested dinner recommendations on several occasions and we were never disappointed. The hotel staff arranged transportation from the port and to the airport for us, as well. A stay at the Barocco made our time in Rome just that much better!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome and Barocco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MD L
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the side entrance and small lobby....this place is wonderful. Consider it a hidden gem. You will feel so welcomed here! The staff is professional yet relaxed, friendly and very helpful. The rooms are quiet, clean and comfortable with cozy beds, robes and slippers. The bathroom is modern with a great shower. I loved the personal touches, such as the fruit basket upon arrival, flowers on the beds and the tray of cookies upon departure. Breakfast was very good with fresh and tasty selections. You can also choose eggs to order from a menu. Location is great, it's close to the craziness and crowds but not in it. Be sure to drop by the small bar and visit Nick the Bartender. He's nice and a lot of fun. Only one small area of improvement, seemed like we needed more lighting in our room. We only had these narrow reading lights near the bed. Lamps on the nightstands would give off more light and create a more pleasant atmosphere. Other then that... Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barrocco in Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: Judy M
Reviews.Content: Extremely accomodating for our large group while visiting Rome. Very extensive breakfast included and snacks at cocktail time. Very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RBW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this most charming boutique hotel. From the time we checked in, we knew we made the right choice. Our room, number 44, was absolutely luxurious. I requested a quiet room because I am a light sleeper, and this room was certainly quiet. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. There were shutters to keep the noise and the light out. The bathroom had a decadent rainfall shower with colored lights, and it included high quality toiletries. Our room was kept very clean. The most pleasant surprise about the room was the terrace! It was hard to believe that we were in the middle of a busy city while we sat and drank wine on our terrace. We received a complimentary fruit basket on arrival, and the night before we checked out, we received a thank you note from the manager with a platter of cookies. The breakfasts were fantastic. The tables were set with linen tablecloths, and the buffet was delicious. Breakfast also included cooked to order eggs and omelets. The breakfast staff were accommodating and professional. The concierge was incredibly helpful. We can't thank Christiano and the two Fabios enough for their friendliness, restaurant and touring recommendations, and their professionalism. They helped make our trip to Rome one we will always remember. We found The Barocco Hotel on Trip Advisor. We chose it because of the positive reviews and the hotel's central location. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Merchanda
Reviews.Content: As other fellow travelers mention, the hotel is very well located, with easy access to metro and most of the main tourist attractions in Rome. Our hotel room was small, but very well appointed and the bathroom was very spacious. Breakfast was also very good and according to my fiancee, the coffee was the best she had during our whole trip. The staff at the front desk was very attentive and helpful. Be advised the entrance is on the side street

Reviews.Title: “A Small Gem in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: JRichardsExeterNHUSA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights in Hotel Barocco in mid-October, and enjoyed our stay very much indeed. The Barocco is what a first-rate "boutique" hotel should be: gracious, elegant, accommodating, cozy. Our room on the second floor was small, but extremely well-appointed, the beds eceptionally comfortable. The front desk was welcoming and helpful, lending us a city guidebook and recommending excellent local restaurants. The breakfasts were all one could want. And all this plus a superb location, just off Piazza Barberini with its classic fountain, a location that permits easy walks to most of Rome's cultural attractions. We highly recommend the Barocco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel to stay in while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay! Rooms were clean, staff was attentive, location was perfect, great breakfast! Would recommend the hotel to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gloria G
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful small boutique type hotel. It is centrally situated. It is well appointed, modern, clean and the staff was a pleasure to deal with. The morning breakfast is included and they provide a nice selection of food. My only disappointment was that there was no outdoor area to sit and enjoy the sunset in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Baracco is Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: judy8000
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, the hotel was clean & modern in a great location. I can't say enough about the staff! They were there for us at every turn. Helpful, kind and courteous. I would recommend it to everyone & will deinitely return the next time I'm in Rome!! Thank you Hotel Barocco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Wonderful Staff, Great Rooms and Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: PeanutPopcorn1
Reviews.Content: Our travel agency, WAC Travel (also fab!) recommended this hotel, and it was WONDERFUL! We could not have asked for a better location. A quick 10 minute walk to everything...the Spanish Steps, the shopping (oh boy, the shopping!), great restaurants(Trattoria Tritone, for example!), and the Borghese Gardens. WE LOVED IT! We had a great room with a view of the Piazza and it was such a fantastic room...comfortable, spotless, two bathrooms, a living area. The size was very nice and perfect for us. Plenty of storage space, etc. The hotel's complementary breakfast was lovely. The staff at this hotel are top notch. They were very helpful, friendly, and welcoming. We would NOT HESITATE to recommend this hotel to others. The ONLY THING I would say to think about is this: If you are a light sleeper (like I am), do NOT REQUEST a room with a view! If you do, at least ask for a room on a high floor. The piazza is NOISY! Traffic, sirens, people...Rome is definitely a bustling city. It is like being in Manhattan. But overall, simply sensational! And there is a fabulous scooter rental place right up the side street by the hotel that we used twice and HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Hotel Barocco, for making Rome feel like home!”
Reviews.Author: marieandbob
Reviews.Content: The beauty of the hotel and the extreme care in providing for all of our needs are very much appreciated. From management on down, the courtesy of the staff was outstanding. Thanks to all of our new friends at the hotel. If we ever visit Rome again, we would defintely stay at Barocco again. Bob & Marie A. Shorewood, IL

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to the perfect honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Erin C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to postpone our honeymoon until three months after we were married due to work and many of the out of town guests we had that we wanted to take time to visit with. Best decision we could have ever made! Started the trip in Rome at the Barocco and couldn't have been more thrilled with the choice. Our travel agent had come up with a full list of options for us to review for our stay in Rome and after researching we settled on Barocco...Few points on why you should stay here... 1. Perfect location...we walked everywhere, only taking a taxi to the Vatican, we could have and probably would have walked those days too, but it was extremely hot (90's) while we were there in September. 2. Very friendly staff...anything you asked for or needed they were able to provide. 3. Excellent Breakfast...traditional Italian items in addition to freshly made eggs to order. 4. Possibly the best cappucino I have ever tasted! 5. Beautiful rooms with fully renovated and quite spacious bathrooms. The best part about staying at Barocco that plays to it's location was that each night as we'd walk back from dinner we made it a point to take the route past Trevi...there isn't anything more spectacular than hearing that fountain in the background and then stumbling upon it just walking back from a night out in Rome....

Reviews.Title: “Sandy C.”
Reviews.Author: Sandy C
Reviews.Content: Our first trip abroad was enhanced by the beautiful accomodations of this jewel of a hotel. The staff was friendly, professional, and extremely helpful. The rooms were comfortable, spacious, clean, and included many personal touches like fresh flowers on the beds, robes and slippers, a welcome basket or fruits and plenty of space to spread out and relax. The bar and breakfast accomodations were excellent and the staff was incredible. A wonderful hotel in the heart of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lindalou111
Reviews.Content: Everything was great at this little hotel. The front desk personnel were extremely helpful. The beds were very comfortable. The shower was great. Breakfast was very good. It's not a buffet like most places. You order off a menu. Great location. Highly recommend Barocco Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anna C
Reviews.Content: I own a travel agency in the Philadelphia area and escorted three friends to Rome for seven nights. We found the Barocco Hotel just perfect - great staff, lovely rooms with super comfortable beds with amazing linens and duvets and the breakfast was delicious and served in an extremely charming room. The location of the hotel couldn't be better for exploring Roime. Our concierge, Cristiano was top-notch in helping us with all our touring needs. I almost felt like I was an important guest in someone's very lovely home. Great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Donna Z
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fabulous! It was the most comfortable room of our two week stay in Italy with all the amenities. The staff were exceptional and from we loved the little bar and our bartender Nick! They recommended a great restaurant around the corner so don't be afraid to ask. We would definitely stay at the Barocco Hotel again! Donna and Ed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, all around!”
Reviews.Author: JeffHecker
Reviews.Content: What a great way to start our 2 week trip to Italy. The Barocco Hotel was a fantastic location, comfort, and really nice staff.
