Everyone was very ready and willing to help with directions, baggage, even keeping us from getting a parking ticket when we were loading up our rental for the rest of our journey. only 4 out of 5... not even their fault, but we took the train from the airport to "Termini" station and decided to subway it from there to the hotel (much cheaper than a taxi) - it was only 2 stops... but the walking between the train station and the subway station, with bags, was a bit much. Even though the subway stop for the Barocco is really convenient to the hotel (only a half a block around the corner), next time, we'll definitely stay here, but take a taxi from "Termini" to make it easier on ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Barocco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilmatley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and loved the hotel. Breakfast was delicious and the location was great for exploring the city. This is a great boutique hotel in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Barocco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shkelly723
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but the room was elegant and the bathroom very roomy and nice. The staff was exceptional, from the porters to the buffet people to the gentleman behind the front desk. They helped with anything we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT HOTEL + LOCATION+ SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: emilykk2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just arrived home from a fantastic couple of days in Rome.. When we were booking our hotel we really didnt have a clue where to stay and therefore we went off the reviews on this hotel and its high ratings. I can confirm that it is everthing people say it is.. fab location, beautiful hotel, room is nice and the staff are soo helpful in particular Christiano on reception was very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect, a short walk from the amazing trevi fountain, a short walk to the spanish steps and we even walked to the vatican and stopped at the pantheon on the way. REALLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL..

Reviews.Title: “Small and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: LouLou7751
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very small here. I was told we were getting an upgrade to superior from standard but I don't think there was any difference. The staff here was so helpful, my daughter was ill and they helped up get a doctor and anything else we needed. The breakfast was the best we had in any hotel we stayed in while in Italy. I also think that the beds were the most comfortable. I do have one gripe, they had only one iron, so at dinner time it was always in use. Otherwise it was lovely with super nice people.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: Lynda F
Reviews.Content: We began our trip to Italy by spending four nights in Rome. This hotel was the perfect spot for us. It isn't a luxury hotel, but lovely, small and personal. The location was convenient to the heart of Rome, yet still very quiet and private. We were able to walk everywhere. Our room was spacious and well-designed, though I would've liked a full length mirror. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful with suggestions, directions and concierge services. Breakfasts were excellent as well, and better than other hotels on our trip. The psychedelic lights in the bathtub were great, and I thought it was a pretty cool way to have a night light. All in all, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: mojopower
Reviews.Content: Professional staff. Great location. We used their "special" Limo airport transfer & room package (270E - 1 night)....... decent deal considering that this place is in the heart of Rome but by no means a bargain . We were picked up at the airport without a hitch. We stayed in the annexe. The room was somewhat small offering no view, but nonetheless spotless & nicely decorated. Great mattress & linens. Fully equiped bathroom, floors were immaculate. Breakfast was included in the price & it was very generous by European standards. Flavorful food with quaint romantic set-up. Highly recommend the Italian frittata (a la carte menu is included in the breakfast along with the buffet so be sure to ask for it if you don't see it). Cappucino was excellent. Classy place.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful secret, this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trixi C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so charming! Perfect location,beautifully newly decorated the staff was wonderful and so friendly. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious. Couldn't have asked for a better place to enjoy our Roman experience.

Reviews.Title: “I agree”
Reviews.Author: CosmoLady
Reviews.Content: WOW! The postings are great and so is this hotel!!! It was our last hotel on our whirlwind trip of Italy. All four hotels were wonderful, but this was probably the most luxurious! Bed was INCREDIBLE! The shower was amazing...my husband is 6'6" and he loved it! I had never seen bath products in such cute bottles! We were upgraded due to the relationship our travel agent has with hotel. Our room overlooked the fountain! We had fruit and water waiting to greet us! Front desk was very nice. Breakfast was too beautiful to eat...but we did! Breakfast staff was very attentive. Location was great, central. We were lost many, many times, but always found our way back! I would recommend this hotel and would return!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer O
Reviews.Content: This was the last of our hotels on a 10 day trip through Italy. I would say our room was probably the best we stayed in during our trip. The hotel itself is hard to find initially, our cab driver didn't know where to take us and we were right in front of it. Its has a slightly odd configuration - the lobby is small and on a side street and then to get to our room we walked back outside into a separate entrance upstairs - almost felt like you were in an apartment buidling. The room itself was very spacious and comfortable!! Our first room the air conditioning didn't work great (room #20) so they switched us across the floor to room #50 and it worked great. They were the most comfortable beds we've slept in - very plush and luxurious! Probably one of the nicer perks for my husband was the American channels on the flat screen TV. He was able to watch ESPN and football and baseball - I know trivial, but for Americans who come back after a long day to watch a little TV - it is nice to have some US channels. Location was great - especially at night close to the Spanish Steps and some good restaurants. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Good value, location and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Virginia W
Reviews.Content: We picked Barocco Hotel for location and value. We were pleasantly surprised that it surpassed our expectations. Exceptional service, fantastic breakfast, quiet, clean and beautifully appointed rooms. Walking distance to a very fashionable part of the city. Will not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia91360
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here when we returned from our cruise last week. It is a nice hotel, older but remodeled and nice. Our room was nice, but we noticed it didn't have a shower. I called the front desk and inquired. We were asked if we had requested a shower and I said that our travel agent had booked this hotel so I was not sure. I was told that they would look into it but that a shower needed to be a request. (if you want a shower and not just a tub, be sure to be specific when making your reservation) well, our agent must have requested it because we were immediately moved to another room, the mini suite, which was very spacious and we were told that the hotel was going to be full that weekend so they were making the change now while they still had availability. I truly appreciate that they made the switch. The only negative about the suite is that is is right on Barberini Square, which means NOISY. However, we were so exhausted from our travels during the day that once we fell asleep, it was just fine so this might not be a problem for some people, just letting you be aware. Also, our shower was very slow in draining, but we let the managment know upon check out and they said they would take care of it. Everyone was very nice at the front desk and the breakfast that was provided was also very good and adequate for our needs. Now for the real negative: as part of our hotel booking, a free transfer to the airport was included so the morning we were to depart for the airport, I called down to the front desk and asked if we could leave a little earlier than the 9:00 am time and they checked and said that we could. The driver arrived at 8:10 and off we went. Well, I will tell you that this driver drove so incredibly fast to the airport that I was a wreck!! I saw the speedometer hit 170 kilometers and that is just way to fast, on a Sunday morning with plenty of time to get to the airport. Traffic was relatively light. There is just no reason to drive like that and endanger lives that way. I told the driver 3 times that were were flying on Delta. He seemed to understand and dropped us off at Terminal 3. When we went in, we discovered that we were at the wrong place and that we needed to take the shuttle to Terminal 5. That took some time so it was a great that we had left the hotel earlier than planned!! What I want the Hotel to be aware of is the incredible speed with which this driver drove and the fact that he also didn't seem to know or care where he dropped us off, just that he got us to the airport at any location he could. If the Hotel is going to offer a free transfer, they need to be sure their clients arrive at their destination safely and at the correct location or really, what good is it??

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFinLin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were only in Rome for one night and we wanted to stay close to most sights and shopping, since that is what we wanted to do. The hotel was not my first couple of choises in Rome, but it turned out good. It is not easily spotted from the street, but is located by the Barberini place and close to the metro and taxis, lots of restaurants, the main shopping streets, Fontana di Trevi and the Spanish steps. The hotel was renovated in 2010 with lots of marble - maybe not my kind of hotel design wise, but clean and comfortable. The staff is very helpful and nice; breakfast is very good, too. Good four star hotel with great location!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay this past summer”
Reviews.Author: Opusone1
Reviews.Content: We found and booked this hotel via the internet. One of the reasons we thought it would work best for us was due to its location near the Rome metro station. I was very convenient to the metro. A very short walk to the station. We discovered the hotel to be superb. It exceeded our expectation in how clean and comfortable it was. The staff was very friendly and was always willing to help us with recommendation. Whenever we asked them for restaurant suggestions the recommended some outstanding establishments. I highly recommend this hotel. You will not regret your stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location and a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: raymondwilk
Reviews.Content: I was greated by very professional staff at reception and was pleased to discover that i had been upgraded to a junior suite overlooking barbarini square. The rooms were spacious and well appointed and very clean and comfortable and i enjoyed the wealcolming bowl of fresh fruit provided. I was initially a bit concerned that it might be noisy being so close to a busy traffic area but with the effective double glazing traffic noise was not noticed . (i did once hear an ambulance passng with a very loud siren but that was the only noise that i heard during my stay) The hotel does include an excellent beakfast as part of the package and i thought that the staff were very efficient bringing the freshly made omelet that i ordered as part of my breakfast. The other good feature was the free wifi internet in my room ,the only downside was it was at some times a bit slow downloading but i was not too concerned as it was free something that you dont always get in hotels in Italy. The hotel is conviently located on line A of the metro about 2 stops from termini railway station and there is also a taxi rank nearby in Barbarinini square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Carson D
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was within walking distance to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, and the Vatican (45 minute walk). We were upgraded to a suite in the building next door, where we had our own apartment. Room and bathroom was comfortable, all marble and generous in size. The breakfast was very good- buffet and menu provided. Excellent coffee. I recommend this hotel if you are looking for a base in Rome while sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff....”
Reviews.Author: 649Kim
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in while in Rome. It is close to everything, the staff are wonderful and the rooms were great.The most comfortable beds in the world and great A/C .... Rome was so hot !

Reviews.Title: “central to most things in Rome, good value for location, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bari e
Reviews.Content: We arrived here from Florence, the hotel was very nice, lots of room, it is a bit older but is renovated so it is nice. Very central to most things, if you want to walk a bit you can see lots just by walking around. The staff are very good, they all speak English, the breakfast is excellent and classy. We had a small issue with the washroom flush, so they changed our room right away, they are very good at customer service. The train station is across the street, Local busses and tour busses are also about 2 minutes away. For a big and busy city like Rome the location, service, helpfulness of the staff was excellent. ******** LOVE ITALY********* we went to Paris just before we arrived in Italy and regreted wasting time in Paris, Italian people are so much more warm, welcoming, happy and seem so love life, and their accent while speaking English is sooooooooooooo cool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Skylo123
Reviews.Content: My 9 yr old daughter and I stayed this august. We had switched res from another hotel. I couldn't have been more pleased. Perfect location to venture out from to see the sites. The room was small but great. The most comfortable beds and fantastic showers. The staff was as good as it gets. They were so helpful while we were there and before we even arrived. They handled slot of details for us. The hotel was safe and lovely. We can not wait to return. My daughter loved it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and washroom, supurb breakfast overcome very tight room”
Reviews.Author: Calgarymember
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Barocco for 2 nights in June after coming in from Venice and Florence and prior to a cruise out of Rome. The location is excellent, being an easy walk to most major attractions (i.e., Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona). We opted for an upgraded room and it was very nice, albeit much smaller than I had expected. The room was nicely renovated and appointed, had a really nice washroom and looked out directly over the statue in Piazza Bernini. The included breakfasts here have to be the best that we have ever experienced in our travels of Europe (very extensive buffet plus eggs cooked to order with bacon, etc.) - other places we have stayed have charged up to 30 euro's per person for similar breakfast menu's. With 2 suitcases at 24" plus two backpacks, we (meaning me) had to place one suitcase on top of the bar fridge (no other place for it) with the other one placed on the room luggage rack. As we were there for only 2 nights and would be having our clothes cleaned and pressed on the upcoming cruise ship, the amount of unpacking was minimal and so the room size was not detrimental to us as it might be for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, good quality price ratio, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PatriceVietnam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Barocco for 5 nights and would not hesitate to return should we go through Rome once again. We booked the annex room which is located in a separate buildoing literally 8 seconds away from the main hotel. Room 50 was very spacious and comfortable. I have included a video review of the room so take a look. Annex room 50 was WAY bigger than the regular rooms in the hotel. The price is actually lower than the rooms in the main building which makes the whole thing even better. Hotel is a small boutique type hotel but with a touch for luxury. Service was very good throughout although there were a few odd situations regarding room service. FYI, since the annex rooms are in a separate building, local regulations prohibit the hotel staff from bringing alcohol as they would need to exit the main building and enter a "public space" where alcohol cannot be displayed. If you are staying there, just buy your own wine in one of the numerous shops on Via Veneto and you are set. The breakfast at the main hotel was very adequate with a selection of fresh fruit, pastries, fresh juices and cheese. They also offer a menu from which you can select hot dishes. All this is included in the price of the room, including espresso, cappuccino and other coffees. Location is great as you are within 7 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps, 10 minutes to the Trevi fountain and 30 seconds away from Via Veneto street where you will find the tourist traps and high end shops. Walking from the hotel to some of the major sites like the Forums and Colosseum will take about 20 minutes. Everything is within reach. Around the hotel are nice trendy bars and restaurants but most of the ones on Via Veneto will offer over priced food in a setting that has limited charm. The hotel did however recommend some restaurants about 5 minutes away that were of great quality. So overall, I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. If you can grab room 50, I believe it's one of the best deals in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Greg B
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barocco was more then we could have asked for. Perfectly located in the heart of Rome, you can walk to every site except the Vatican. It is extremely close to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The people working the front desk were extremely nice and helpful. Free breakfast every morning, the breakfast was amazing. I definitely would go back there again. The rooms were also very nice, we stayed in the Annex, the building next to the hotel. Couldn't have asked for anything better, thanks hotel Barocco.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and stylish, in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Alex S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exactly what we expected from the information on the web, and in fact even better than what we were hoping for! Very central, just round the corner from lots of interesting sites, on one of the main tube lines and close to many useful buses (although we visited most places on foot). The style is classic and elegant, but without feeling stuffy, and has all modern comforts. It is a relatively small hotel, with a pleasant atmosphere, in a stunning ancient building which has been lovingly renovated. The room was very well appointed, comfortable and perfectly clean. The management and service is very professional but has also a personal touch and caters for the specific needs of the guests. We got lots of good tips and suggestions from the friendly and knowledgeable reception staff about what to visit (not just the obvious tourist sites, but also some 'secret' corners in the historical centre) and where to find a bit more special shopping and dining. We were thoroughly impressed with the Barocco Hotel and we hope to be back! (Alex - London)

Reviews.Title: “Small, comfortable hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: happytravelingirl
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on tripadvisor after searching thoroughly. It met all of our qualifications: king-sized bed, air conditioned, private bath, complimentary breakfast, wifi, no smoking, great location. The staff was pleasant and helpful. This hotel was recently redone and is very fresh and clean. The Piazza Barberini has a cab stand and is within walking distance of many attractions. I am very picky and would stay there again. We asked for a quiet room so I can't vouch for all of the rooms, but ours was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerfromnc
Reviews.Content: After reading all the excellent reviews, my boyfriend and I determined this was the best place to stay during our recent 5 day trip to Rome. The rates were comparable to other nice hotels in the area. Upon arriving, we were early and the staff was very friendly, offering us water and a place to sit and rest. The room was not as nice as I had expected. Based on pictures from their website and information regarding their recent renovations, I was expecting something different. We were put in room 15 which was definitely not a renovated room. The headboard of the bed even had an old in-headboard radio/intercom system that looked like something from the 1970's. The main wall of the room was outfitted with dark wooden cabinets, desk, and wardrobes which also did not give it the "contemporary" feel that I had envisioned based on their website pictures....overall the room had a dark and drab feeling. The size of the room was small but comparable for the area. The bathroom was nice and that did look like it had been updated more than the main room. We had no view to speak of from the windows (just a view of alley's between buildings). For what was basically a $300 a night room for us (in USD), it was dissapointing compared to rooms we could get for the same price in other large US cities. The location of our room was also near the flight of steps that gets used a lot and also right next to the breakfast room, so it was noisey, luckily I had earplugs with me. It is unfortunate that guests coming in late in the evening are not more respectful of the people in the rooms they are walking by... and we had one particularly noisy family during our stay that found no problem yelling back and forth to each other up the stairs early in the morning or late at night, but of course that is just their rudness and not a fault of the hotel staff. The staff was friendly and spoke very good english and were always willing to accomodate us or answer questions. They also arranged our transportation to and from the airport which went smoothly. The complimentary breakfast was also very well done and a good way to start a busy day of sightseeing. Overall the stay was fine but nothing overly impressive as I thought it would be based on reviews. The location is very good though, right up the street from the Metro and within walking distance to many of the top sites of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Sadiren
Reviews.Content: The room itself was nice. Large room and bath (bath is big enough for two). It's a bit of a walk to all the sites but that's reflected in the price. On the bad side, I had my one and only sweater stolen from our room while we were visiting the Vatican. I reported it the next morning at check out and they said management would contact us but they never did. We went through our credit card to resolve the issue. Other than that, the room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, wonderful hotel, wonderful holiday!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a 'mini-moon' in Rome after getting married very recently. We both agreed that Hotel Barocco helped to make our short time in Rome on occasion we will never forget. As our stay was part of our honeymoon, I informed the hotel of this before we before we arrived and we were greeted with complimentary champagne on arrival which was a nice touch which made us feel valued and welcome. Furthermore, the staff all spoke excellent English, were very well mannered and as helpful as they could be when called upon. Special mention should go to Danielle who was particularly helpful, managing to arrange dinner reservations, transport and the like. Our suite was excellent and all that I'd hoped it would be having opted for the Junior Suite with terrace and 'love pool'. It really was perfect for a couple on honeymoon and I would highly recommend it to couples looking for somewhere romantic to stay whilst in Rome. The room was more than we needed with good en-suite facilities and held at a pleasant temperature by the air con. The real value of this suite though is the outside terrace. You could easily have held a party for 10-12 people due to size of the area and it provides a perfect viewpoint to look out onto the Piazza Barberini at the centre of which is the Fontana di Tritone (Fountain of Triton). Moreover, there was a set of table and 4 chairs (2 large armchairs and 2 standard) with a large parasol for shade which was great for just hanging out and enjoying the sounds of Rome. I knew that the hotel was central but didn't realise quite how central! Situated on one side of the Piazza Barberini, we were literally a 15 minute walk from a lot of the main tourist sites (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, the Pantheon etc) and a 7-8 minute underground ride away from the Vatican which we visited on our full day. Though we didn't get enough time to do the Colosseum, that was only a 10-15 min walk as well. Overall, the location was in our opinion second to none and was the ideal base from which to explore Rome. All 3 elements outlined above, the staff, the room and the location were truly excellent and played a big part in making our stay in Rome so enjoyable and therefore one which we will remember for the rest of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and great service”
Reviews.Author: LilVoyager
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a couple of nights, the room was spotless and very nicely decorated, luxurious bathroom, amazing super comfortable mattress. I asked for an internal facing room, it was so quiet you wouldn't know you were in Central Rome. Very helpful people at reception, especially Cristiano. Walking distance to many attractions. Wouldn't hesitate to come back, very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: j9rollo
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and wished it was more. Hotel was great from the start. The front counter staff at check in where polite and helpful. We arrived early and we were accomodated. The room was clean and modern. Bed was comfirtable and a pleasure following some of the slabs we had slept in over the previous two weeks. We received a complimentary fruit basket, nice touch. Breakfast was great. Eggs made to order were a sign from the heavens. The other selections were first class. We did Rome on foot. The Hotel was within 5-10 minutes of the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Corso (for the shopping) We made our way to the Piazza Venezia. The Colosseum was only 10 minutes from there.Walked to the Piazza Navona, only about 20-30 minutes through the streets. The Hotel is far enough from the centre to feel some relief, but close enough to enjoy ancient Rome walking. The windows openned to get the atmosphere of the street, but with the double glazing it was then very quiet. The bathroom was modern and clean. Would definately recommend the Hotel Barocco to everyone and would drefinately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseyTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. We booked a basic room which was tiny even by European standards, so we upgraded to the next level (I think it was 25 euros more/night) and were much happier. Wifi access in our room was spotty, but I could easily do all I had to at breakfast. The breakfast was very good with eggs made to order. Staff was very helpful, and while you could walk to many sights, the easy-to-use subway was right there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bessy_codgers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Barocco for three nights whilst looking around Rome. The position was close to perfect, easy walking distance to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain plus not too far from the Colosseum. Rooms were modern(renovated) whilst the hotel still retained a bit of 'old Rome'. Bed was also really good! Service was ok, nothing spectacular but nothing disappointing either, which was our feeling with the hotel in general. Breakfast was also quite good as well. Only thing I would say is it cost more than I felt it was worth, room was VERY small but it was a great position which is a large part of what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MeganMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June and really enjoyed it. Reception was always helpful and provided bookings for taxis and restaurants and sights. The room was well appointed and clean, and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was quite luxuriously done in marble. However the height of the bathtub made it a little hard to get into the tub/shower for a less mobile person. Bathrobes and slippers and hairdryer were provided. The breakfast spread was delicious, and in addition to the buffet you can order eggs your style. The service at breakfast was very professional and the eating area really lovely, including newspapers. There is a small elevator that works well. Location of this hotel is excellent as it is within walking distance to many things, yet not too close to the crowds. Overall we loved our stay here and would book here again for any future trips to Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice staff, but a bit pricey.”
Reviews.Author: HippoOTG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a recent vacation in Rome. It was my first time in the city so this was a great location. Walking distance to Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and the Spanish Steps. Staff was friendly - this is old-school hotel - no card keys - an actual key that you drop at the desk when you leave. The elevator was slow and tiny, but working. The room was small by US standards, but typical for Eurpope. The rug could have used a good cleaning, but other than that the room was clean and well appointed. While I enjoyed the hotel, it was a bit pricey (like everything in Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excelent location, only internet that does not work well”
Reviews.Author: docarva
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, frienldy staff, clean and modern rooms, the hotel is a great place to stay if you are planning to go to Rome. Very central, with walking distance from the main turistic places. The breakfast buffet is not big, but delicious. The only negative point is the internet connection in the hotel that does not always work and when it works, looks like if I was back to the dial up era... Just be carefull with the taxi drivers in the airport and in the Termini Station, they create rates and do not use the taximetro as they should.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJL59
Reviews.Content: We had a great room overlooking the plaza and fountain. The staff at the front desk were very nice and helpful. The breakfast was excellent. The room was clean and very nice. The location is very good. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Rome !”
Reviews.Author: Thomasyt
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife was at allot Hotels in the world and this hotel was Excellent ! The Location is the best in Rome near all the hot spots in Rome by walk ! The service was beyond what we expected, The team of the hotel was PERFECT and we got best service we can wish, The breakfast was very reach and taste good, The room was very big and very comfortable the bed was very good and we had a good time at the hotel, I can tell for sure that we will be back to this hotel in our next trip to Rome, Thomas,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: mikeybee1975
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely worth every EURO! The room, people location and we will never forget the BREAKFAST! I will stay here every-time i return to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Barocco!!”
Reviews.Author: DB01234
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend on the 21st July 2011. Had an amazing stay, perfect location within walking distance to all the sights. Breakfast was good, lots of choice and a great service. Reception were very helpful with pre-booking tickets for the sights so we avoided the long queues on arrival. Staff were very pleasant and only too happy to help. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Italytwin
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff especially the porter! Clean room, lovely decor; yet no shutters on the main window for privacy at night. Beautiful bathroom, roomy shower; yet no light above the sink. Good location near metro and walking distance to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Comfortable bed, room safe and hair dryer a plus. Very good complimentary breakfast. Don't forget to leave room key at front desk. Only negatives: noisy at night and construction in hallway at 8:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “Best Night's Sleep! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: russo_umphrey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Rome last November. We stayed at Hotel Barocco for 4 nights. The bed and pillows were the most comfortable I have ever experienced while traveling. We have a tempurpedic at home and their bed was equally as comfortable. As a bad back traveler, comfort is key. I booked this hotel soley on it's reviews of the beds! Hotel Barocco is in a great location. You are minutes from the Trevi Fountain and a quick walk to the Spanish Steps. The Barberini Piazza isn't as spectacular as others - which was fine for us - less tourists, less noise etc. We saw many sites while in Rome and we had no trouble with taxi service getting to sites or returning back to the hotel. There are several restaurants right around the hotel, so as weary travelers we didn't have to walk to far to eat after a long day of sight seeing. The room was nice and clean. The bathroom is small, but normal for Europe. The room was a little to warm for me, but it was November and the AC wasn't available. We did hear some noise from city, but it wasn't bad. We didn't try Wi-fi, so I can't speak to that. We were able to get CNN on the TV, but that was the only english speaking channel we had. That was fine for us, but might be a challenge with kids. The breakfast is decent and the service was great. I highly recommend staying here. When we go back to Rome, we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: light12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel Barocco at the end of our trip to Italy. The location is excellent between the Spanish steps and the Fontana di trevi. Rooms are comfortable and the bedding is perfect. The hotel staff are super helpful and the restaurant they recommended was great. When we return to Rome we plan on staying at the hotel Barocco. If you have a motorcycle riding permit I would recommend renting a scooter , it is a great way to see Rome

Reviews.Title: “Clean But Claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: Soonie99
Reviews.Content: We ended our Mediterranean cruise with an extra day in Rome. As an avid globe trotter, I have stayed in many hotels all over the world. This was not my first time visiting Rome. I have to admit how impressed I was with the level of cleanliness of a city hotel. The hotel signatured bathroom amenities were a nice touch. I did not expect that. However, upon arrival to the entrance of the hotel, I was quite surprised to see how small the lobby was. It literally fits one sofa and the small front desk. There was a huge line of people trying to check out while there was only one staff taking care of one customer at a time. My husband had to stand right outside the sliding door, because there was not enough room to stand in-line. I realize that the hotel operates out of a prehistoric building, which was beautiful. But I have never seen such a small hotel lobby especially with this kind of price. The elevator was very claustrophobic, 2-3 people max, not including your luggage. They did not have a service elevator. Many times, we had to wait for the maid to drag the laundry out of the elevator in order to get in. By the way, even though the metal plate on the elevator buttons showed "Ferrari", do not expect any speed when calling for one. Most of the time, we just dove for the stairs. They only had the elevator on every other floor. So you either have to take a flight of stair up or down after you exit the elevator to find your room. I know we are very spoiled by American standard. My husband and I stayed in the Grand Suite during our cruise trip. Our pricey hotel room was merely a third of a size of our ship room, a little bigger than our ship's bathroom, which was difficult to get used to. There was no view. But knowing that we only have to stay for one night, we didn't let it bother us. The staff was very helpful with giving us directions to various places, gave us a map of the city, and made our dinner reservation for us when asked. They were very friendly and courteous. Breakfast buffet was adequate. The ordered coffee was very delicious. I wish they had more Protein options. Although you could order cooked eggs from the waitress. There were multiple varieties of bread and tons of sweet baked goods to choose from, which took me by surprise. I thought Europeans eat healthier! Over all, I think the hotel exceeded my expectation on cleanliness. However, I would splurge a little more for space and view.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Peter200018
Reviews.Content: Staff were great, room was really nice and spacious. Zero view from our room, but did not care. Good location so would definitely reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Barocco - the perfect choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dabuddy
Reviews.Content: I hope I can spare you all the hours of research I did with books and trip advisor. Book Hotel Barocco for the most wonderful hotel experience in Rome. Every part of the stay was perfect. The location: on a lovely side street off of Piazza Barberini where you can walk 50 feet to a metro or bus stop or a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps or 10 minute walk to Trevi Fountain and if you're into walking just keep going and you can get to Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The ambience: absolutely silent! It was incredible during crowded, busy, noisy July in Rome we heard nothing from our room. You can barely even hear other people's doors close. The breakfast: order your eggs and your coffee any way you like and then add to it with fruit, breads, cakes, proscuitto, cheese......oh my, it was hard to decide. The staff: we were greeted with notes and gifts for our anniversary and they were always so helpful and friendly when making our dinner reservations and giving walking/metro directions. The room was a comfortable size and the marble bathroom was a good size and done beautifully - great shower head but wierd shower door so water splashes out a little. Had an adaptor for my hair straightener but the outlet still killed it. No clock in the room - bring one if you like to have it. It was a luxurious, very special experience that we recommend to everyone. We went on from Rome to Positano.....going to give another excellent review to Hotel Palazzo Murat. The food in the south was better than in Rome, in our opinion, but some restaurant comments in Rome: Ninos (spanish steps)- too expensive for what it was Ditirambo (campo di fiori) - mediocre food and the most unfriendly waiter Gusto Osteria (via del corso) - very good Cul de Sac (navona) - only go if you really want meat Le Namauchie (colosseum) - our favorite Rome meal Also, if you're looking for walking tours I hope I can spare you hours of research. Rich Brunn was excellent for our Vatican tour and Antonella with Rome Walks was fabulous for Ancient Rome walk.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rmp0
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days and nights, and loved every minute of it! Hotel staff was so helpful and welcoming, our room was small but beautifully decorated and the bed was amazing! Buffet breakfast and wonderful bar at night completed our day. Located near everything, an easy walk to all things Rome!!!! Would go back to the Barocco in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: happyoptimistic
Reviews.Content: We expected a small room as we were told rooms were small in this hotel, and in general space does come at premium in Rome... so we were very happy to receive a very comfortable deluxe double room which had been upgraded free of charge from a standard double. I presume that this was because we had a carry cot. Overall the entire hotel has been decorated to a high standard with marble/ cream color pallet. The bed was the best we have slept on and the sheets were clean and fresh, changed every day. The bathroom offered a spacious modern large sink and spacious modern shower with lights. The breakfast was very good offering a wide range of continental breakfast with the addition of ordering hot omelets at no extra charge. Try the traditional italian one with basil - beautiful. All the staff we mature, professional, helpful and very pleasant, something of a premium in the UK. I cannot fault this hotel in anyway. If we return to Rome we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: nzt0567
Reviews.Content: On our short stay in Rome, late May of this year, we had the good fortune to stay at the Hotel Barocco. Our room overlooked the Triton Fountain in the Piazza Barberini. Our room was spacious, with plenty of cupboard space and a large comfortable bed and well-appointed bathroom. We were impressed with the cleanliness and range of fittings. The location enabled us to easily organise our visits to “tourist attractions”, especially with the excellent advice from the concierge (Christiano) who was incredibly helpful in checking opening times and advising on location and bus/train access when we were not inclined to walk. The included breakfast was a feast from a well-stocked buffet table complimented by an omelette made to order by the chef. This was our third visit to Rome, and in our opinion, it was the most comfortable; due primarily to the excellent facilities and the high quality of service provided by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Sea98
Reviews.Content: A very good location. The hotel is situated on a side street. A very small reception area. The receptionist was efficient and friendly and so was the concierge. We were upgraded with out request which was nice. The room was large with a large beautiful marble bathroom. Stunning antique furniture all around the room. There was noise late at night from the corridor, it is not the hotels fault but it did disturb the tranquillity. The problem was with the breakfast. 2 waitresses which were literally rude and blasé! They did not come to the table for 14 minuets, even though it was not busy. Both were just chatting to each other laughing constantly. I got up and requested coffee for two; the dark hair waitress looked at me with a rather unpleasant stare. She came to the table to take our order, but was cold and unfriendly. My wife was rather upset by her approach. It did ruin our meal. The bar service at night was very good and the wine delicious. On our check out after we were asked how our stay was, I informed the receptionist about the breakfast incident. He thought I was joking! I advised him that I was not. He explained that the waitress that we were talking about is very shy. I said in reply - She was certainly not shy to us! I expect from a hotel in this calibure which has a good reputation, to employ affable and polite stuff not a rude an impolite stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: Tripophil
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. The staff was extremely helpful. The room was very clean, cozy, well decorated, and homey with a very nice bathroom! The location was a few minutes from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The breakfast was fantastic! I would recommend this hotel to everyone with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: twinkie4104
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Wonderful location with easy access to public transportation. Easy walking distance to many tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: juliemartin910
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our trip to Italy. We spent 4 nights in Rome at the Barocco Hotel and 5 nights in Sorrento at another hotel. The Baracco was perfect for us. It's located just a few minute walk from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. We walked to both every night for dinner and people watching. We were able to walk to the Coliseum and it took us about 30 minutes which wasn't too bad. The subway or Metro train station is right across the street from the hotel. We used it to get to the Vatican which is just a few stops away and also to get to Naples when we were heading to Sorrento. The subway was very easy to use. The hotel was very helpful and responsive before my arrival. They helped arrange a pickup at the airport for 50 Euro before our arrival. I think if you book directly through the hotel's website it's cheaper but I had booked through a different website. The staff was very pleasant. We arrived and they upgraded our room for free. The room was perfect. It was small but the bathroom was large and we had a large bathtub. The beds were 2 twins together and super comfortable. I found the linens (nice big duvets) to be very clean and comfortable. We actually stayed at the hotel at the beginning of our trip for 4 nights and then we came back the last night of our trip to fly out of Rome. The last night we were not upgraded so we got to experience the classic double and it was also very nice. It was very similar to the upgrade but without the bathtub. The free breakfast was perfect too! There was a large table of pastries, meat and fresh fruit and bread. You can also order an omelette or scrambled eggs. The waitstaff was very friendly! The hotel staff was very friendly. They suggested places to eat in the area and helped us with directions to nearby attractions. I would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Definitely coming back”
Reviews.Author: gupta_shivan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located....within minutes you can be at piazza republica, spanish steps, trevi fountain, via del corso and condetti....the rooms are great and the receptionist Michelle Trabucco great with all the possible help he can extend...highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: HLSESS
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights- great concierge- recommended great close by restaurants- on Piazza Barberini- 5 minutes from Spanish Steps- great bar- small rooms but nice bathrooms!! Close shutters to outside so sun doesn't shine in- we didn't figure that out until the last night-

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveldoc824
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and could not ask for a better experience.The hotel upgraded us to a suite (unexpected). The room was very nicely furnished and the room had a huge bathroom. The shower was probably the nicest we have seen in Italy . The tiled floors were spectacular . We felt like we were sleeping in our own bed at home as this was a very comfortable bed. Our breakfast (included) was also very well done. You could also order omelets, scrambled eggs or fried eggs at no additional cost. The staff was very friendly and helpful with directions . The hotel is in a good central location just a few minute walk from the spainish steps. We would certainly stay at Hotel Barocco on a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: diricc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter for 3 amazing nights in June. The staff was welcoming and warm at our arrival and incredibly helpful throughout our stay. They helped arrange tours, recommended restaurants and were always friendly upon our return to the hotel. They were always eager to be of service. Our room was bright and comfortable and cozy (the beds were plush). After returning each evening, we would find small gifts in our room from the hotel, i.e. a plate of fresh fruit and bottled water, bath and body lotions, and finally a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine. Would absolutely recommend this hotel and will make this our home away from home in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: RobertLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, room 51, which is at the front of the hotel. The hotel is situated on the Piazza Barberini which is served by a Metro station and most of a hop-on/off open bus tours. Easy walking distance to the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain. It has been refurbished so everything has a new and fresh feel. Our room was very small but nicely done. Nice choice of buffet breakfast with a freshly cooked eggs menu. Small bar area with a lounge. The staff were brilliant throughout our stay with excellent customer service. We used a taxi to get from FCO airport and back at a fixed rate of 40euro each way. The red Citysightseeing Roma bus offer a 2 day hop on\off bus ticket for 20 euro which we used to its max. If you like fish I'd recommend a restaurant called Tuna which is in the next street to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"LOVED our room, definitely stay there again!"”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMunky
Reviews.Content: We absolutely were pleased with our room. We had the Deluxe Double Room overlooking the Triton Fountain. Bathroom- The cleanest, spacious, with glass door (no water spilling) and hair dryer was a plus. Bedroom- LOVED LOVED LOVED the bed! I booked this room because of their beds and cleanliness. I don't stay in hotels with hard smelly beds.. This bed was so comfortable that we had the best sleep EVER! Loved the decor and colors- i took pictures of the bed, i loved the headboard!!! . We ate some of the complimentary fruit and used the complimentary slippers too. We enjoyed the flat screen and watched American channels. Carpeted floor and enough room to put luggage. Overall the room- Smelled good, clean, enough room for two, comfortable clean beds, great view, free WIFI with code at front desk- has anything you need! View- even though it was overlooking the Triton Fountain and street. We thought it was the best view of that hotel. They have double windows so the noise stays outside. We would open all windows in the morning and let all that fresh air in. LOVED IT! Proximity to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Vatican- We were about two block from Spanish Steps, a few more from Trevi Fountain. We WALKED everywhere!! It is close to everything and believe me, you do not want to drive in Rome! Breakfast- European breakfast with options to order Americanized eggs coffee etc. They are extremely courteous. Enjoyed the food, the orange juice and pastries!

Reviews.Title: “Classic beauty with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JustLale
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 2 nights and the last night of our 9 day vacation here and it was wonderful. We got to experience both the hotel and the annex and found them both charming, comfortable and spotless. The rooms were beautifully appointed and for as much time as we spent in them, the size was just fine. The beds were the most comfortable ever. The annex was definitely my favorite with it's 18th century flavor. The staff couldn't have been more helpful arranging airport transfers, providing directions, maps and suggestions as well as doing everything possible to meet and exceed our needs. We were just steps away from Piazza Barberini and so many more historic sites as well as some of the best Italian food we've ever eaten. This is just a wonderful hotel and I look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “what an excellent surprise”
Reviews.Author: Flyingeman1
Reviews.Content: this lovely hotel absolutely exceeded our expectations. They arranged a car service to pick us up at the ship's dock. (great price too). the room (25) was elegant and priced quite fairly. We easily walked to Spansh steps, Hassler rooftop terrace, trevie fountain, great restaurants. The courtesy breakfast was exquisite. If we come back to Rome, Hotel Barocco will be our choice od hotels. We will recommend it to all we know traveling to Rome, and we will tell our travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Expectations”
Reviews.Author: EastBeachBum
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Rome so perhaps our expectations weren't in line with reality, considering the price of this hotel. First the positives about the location... It is in a great location to many of the key attractions such as the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. There were very good restaurants nearby. Now our impressions of the hotel itself... The room was a dark, poorly designed "postage stamp" with a very comfortable bed. The decor was artsy and very pretty, but useless. As a practical matter, one could not stay for any length of time as there is no space to unpack - no drawers or closet space. The bathroom, although large, was poorly designed with no vanity space or hooks of any kind. The room overall was much smaller than a typical cruise ship cabin. The only furniture in the room, except for the bed, was a desk that was useless as there wasn't room to slide the chair out to use the desk. The staff appeared to be helpful but we asked twice to have the previous guests' trash removed and it was still there, not removed until the regular housekeeping service the next day. The small bar was nice, with appetizers. The breakfast was fine. They did arrange a ride to the airport, which was nice. If we had it to do over, we'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dmover24
Reviews.Content: We booked this room under the advice of our travel agent, and she did a wonderful job. We were with in 5-10 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and the Pantheon. The staff were helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: roozoo
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop after 16 hrs of traveling. The car we arranged through Barocco Hotel to pick us up from the airport was a huge blessing. We just had to get our luggage and the car/driver were waiting for us when we got to the curb and took us straight to the Barocco Hotel. We were a bit sheepish with our ability to speak Italian, but the folks at the front desk spoke amazing English and couldn't have been any nicer with helping us check-in and get settled. When we checked in the porter was so sweet and attentive and brought our bags up right away. The lift was very tiny, but we loved it as it was an old building, so it was fitting. We stayed in the Junior Suite which was well worth the price. The room was small compared to what we're use to in the States, but we were prepared based on the reviews and we were very comfortable and loved the private terrace that over looked the plaza below. The terrace actually made the room feel larger. We also loved that we were able to get English speaking channels via the satellite TV which pleasantly surprised to us. The bed was so comfortable and the room was tastefully decorated. The lay-out of the room was very unique. Bearing in mind that the hotel was built in 1900, you could see a lot of attention had been given to the floor plan and the space was very efficiently laid out. The hotel has a very unique character and has a very warm fuzzy energy about it that made us feel very relaxed and comfortable staying there. The bathroom was a bit different. We loved the marble in the bathroom, it was beautiful. The novelty of choosing which colored lighting we wanted to shower in was a first for us, but again it all added to the experience which was wonderful. We also enjoyed the jacuzzi tub on the terrace as well. It was a bit surreal to sit and relax in this private jacuzzi on a hotel roof top in the middle of Rome at night. It really was a lovely experience. OH! And the breakfast, which was included with our stay was AMAZING! Fresh eggs, cooked the way we wanted, fresh breads, cheeses, pastries, fruit, juices, etc. It was a great start to our long days of sight seeing while we were in Rome. We were considering staying at a hotel outside of town as we were concerned with the city traffic/street noise, but we were glad we spent the extra to stay in the city, because it saved us money big time in the long run when it came to transportation. We would have spent so much more in cab fare traveling in and out of the city anytime we wanted to go some place or see something. Turns out the noise never was even a factor. The hotel was so well insulated that when the terrace door was closed you couldn't really hear much going on outside at all. What more, the location was very central to the places we were touring and there were so many yummy eats and treats all around the hotel. We were able to walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, which was really nice and it enabled us to really see more of the local sites. The concierge was extremely helpful from giving us directions to local sights, to arranging a car to get us directly to our cruise ship, they couldn't have been any nicer or more helpful. We will definitely be returning and will certainly be recommending Hotel Barocco to friends and family (actually we already have been *smiles*).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice updated rooms with a very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: readytotravel327
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms that have been recently updated. We found all of the staff outstanding. Very nice breakfast and a cozy bar to have a refreshment after a day of seeing Rome. Rooms are not real large but the bathroom was larger than expected. Very well equipped room with high end amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in superb location with friendly and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: ablock40
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here. Although the rooms were not large, the location was great! The breakfast was wonderful , the staff friendly and accomodating and we left for the day well fortified! If we return to Rome, we would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise or Post-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travlinmom1429
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barocco Hotel after a cruise. The hotel picked our group up at the port and transported us to the hotel. We were greeted very warmly at the hotel and given vouchers for the Hop On- Hop Off bus to tour Rome until our rooms were ready. The bus gives a good overall view of Rome so that you can get your bearings. We needed some help with another reservation for at tour we had previously booked and the hotel desk clerk gladly helped us. The room was spacious by Europe standards and the hotel is located close to the Barberini Metro stop at the bottom of the Via Veneto. OUr room was surpisingly quiet considering the location right off a main piazza. As part of our cruise package, we had a car to the airport. Breakfast was included, but I would skip it and go to the cafe next door for croissants and coffee. Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “This was a wonderful oasis in the middle of Rome's craziness”
Reviews.Author: AMB217
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Barocco for 7 nights, and was extremely glad that I made the right hotel choice. I was a female travelling alone, until my friend arrived on the 4th day of my trip. The front desk staff welcomed me the 1st day, even though I arrived a few hours before check in. They told me where I could sit and relax while the room was being prepared; this was great because I was severely jet-lagged. My room was at the front of the hotel, on a quiet street off Piazza Barberini, an excellent location. The amenities were great - very comfortable bed, bathroom, and good quality linens. The daily breakfast far exceeded what I expected - fabulous selection of juices, pastry, fruit, meats, cheeses, and eggs, which were made to order. The dining room staff were friendly, spoke English, and aimed to please. (There's a great cafe next to the hotel that's open for lunch and dinner, and has good food). I traveled a lot for business for many years, and I must say that this hotel made me feel more at home than others that cost a lot more. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in central Rome with great staff and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LarryDC_14
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barocco is located in an ideal location on Piazza Barberini with its entrance around a corner on a side street. My wife and I have very happily stayed at Barocco almost annually since 2003. All our rooms have been comfortable and well appointed with excellent baths. Service at Barocco is very professional and friendly. In particular, the people at the front desk stand out for the help they provide to guests. Very knowledgable about Rome, they make valuable suggestions, arrangements, and reservations as guests may require. Breakfast at Barocco is second to none in variety and quality. My wife and I will be staying at Hotel Barocco again soon.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: afillman
Reviews.Content: Pefect location for the three of us. Helpful and very courteous staff. The accomadations were lovely. The breakfast was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great City”
Reviews.Author: moopy_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barocco hotel with my wife at the begining of April 2011. Our room was in the Annex building (which is ten meters from the main building) The room was very nice, it was clean , modern with a big bathroom. The location of the hotel is perfect. 5 min from spanish steps and from Trevi fountain. Enjoy Rome it's a great city!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in the middle of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: lydjoseph
Reviews.Content: The Barocco Hotel is conveniently located with a polite and professional staff. (just as other reviewers have said) Our most important criteria to successfully rate a hotel is if we slept well (Especially when in the hectic city of Rome.- where you need to be alert at all times or you'll be run over by a bus, a car or a vespa.) The Barocco Hotel was fantastic in this regard. Our room was super quiet and very dark and the bed and pillows were fabulously comfortable. We like a softer mattress and soft pillows and that's what we had. We were in room 25 and while we had no view (at all) we also had no hotel or street noise. (not a sound) This was worth every penny for our 'jet lagged' first few days in Italy. Absolutely would stay there again. BTW: breakfast was also excellent. (with made to order eggs!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “exceptionlly comfortable bed, spotless new bathroom, helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: theoo48
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a very convenient location and if you walk towards the Borghese Park the location seems quite upscale...other directions are noisy and not very serene but nevertheless very close to hop on/hop off bus stop and all the tourist sites. staff at the front desk and in the bar are very willing to please and helpful. breakfast staff could be a bit friendlier. breakfast is the only meal served at the hotel and it is very acceptable. in addition to variety of self serve items it includes made to order eggs and cappucino if you want either. hot eggs were welcome after travelling in italy where they are often not offered for breakfast. we appreciated the fresh starched table linens on the tables set out just for breakfast. there is a little coffee shop attached to the hotel so i guess that is handy but the music is very loud and the food isn't exceptional. the beds are exceptionally comfortable and it is nice to have new spotlessly clean bathrooms. rooms are very small though and on the dark side. guests should be aware that there is very little room to spread out clothes and other belongings. that said, given the small square footage, they are as functional as possible and we would give up a little space to have king size beds which are not always found in lots of hotels in italy. you can open the windows if you want or close the windows and shutters to get quite a good degree of quietness.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Azluvz2travel
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome during the beatification of the Pope in early May. It was immensly busy! The front desk staff took great care of us with tips and warnings of crowds. Beautiful hotel and a wonderful friendly staff made for an amazing stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not functional and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Buzzard13
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights in this hotel and I would not recommend it. Our room was not functional at all.....no counter space in bathroom, couldn't open closet all the way in bedroom, no drawers. Very very noisy at night....lots of banging going on. Assumed some construction in a connecting building but made it difficult to sleep. Location was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: Jackiby
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 3 nights in room 14. A reasonable size, good bathroom with coloured light show in shower. Check in staff were excellent, breakfast needs improving as well as the attitude of the staff serving. Typically, language barriers can create confusion but they should display a more courteous manner rather than roll their eyes & outwardly give the feeling that we must be idiots. We had to “bite our tongues” on a few occasions. Overall, the hotel is well maintained & very clean. We would rate the Barocco at 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Staff, Excellent Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: BAH827
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barocco Hotel for 5 days in the beginning of April and just loved everything about the hotel and it's staff. The wonderully helpful staff helped us with everything from resturant suggestions, to directions, to tour ideas. They were always avaliable and extremely friendly, as well as eager to assist in any way they could. They arranged our pick-up and transfer from the airport to the hotel and everything went extremely smooth. They even accommodated our cancelled flight and later arrival time without any problem at all. The drive was also very professional and friendly. We booked a Superior Double room and found the size of the room and the bathroom to be nice. The room and bathroom were extremely clean and nicely updated. The bed was so comfortable that when we returned home from our trip we decided to get a new mattress that was more like the hotel's. It is also located in a terrific loction with in walking distance to many of the major attractions and great resturants. We walked to most places, but also took the bus and metro (stops and stations are literally right across the street) to get a better feel for the city. All in all we had a wonderful stay at Barocco Hotel and would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone traveling to Rome who wants a great hotel in a great location with a superior staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: wuniat
Reviews.Content: The Barocco is the best hotel we have ever experienced in Rome. Great room: modern, well finished, great linens, bright with windows on two sides. Breakfast buffet was fantastic everyday. And the staff were helpful in every respect. Hotel location just off Via Veneto was also appreciated. Far enough away from the madding crowds of the Trevi fountain, etc to give a welcome sense of relief at the end of the day. Yet a short walk and you are able to see all the attractions. Even Vatican City is only about a 30 minute walk. Would surely stay again, and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: remj
Reviews.Content: We took two rooms for three nights at the Barocco in Easter week, and had a fantastic time. The hotel is very convenient for the city centre sights, and we walked everywhere (including to the Vatican). Loads of restaurants in easy walking distance. Good bathrooms, excellent breakfast, helpful staff. Our teenage son managed to leave his phone charger behind and the manager kindly posted it back to the UK for us (free of charge). If we had to find a flaw it would be that our room was a bit small - but that is really only to be expected in a city centre hotel. Our kids were in room 11 and (contrary to the experiences of another reviewer) had no problems with noise on the corridor. (Mind you, teenagers sleep through anything!) Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast, very nice room”
Reviews.Author: nettads
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our vacation very much. The room was great - our bed was perfect, and so was the bathroom. The only problem we had with the children. Their bed was a sofabed - not very comfortable, and somewhat squeaky. The staff was nice, the breakfast was very good, and the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place with great service”
Reviews.Author: Sirenaboston
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking to see all historic sites. Room was very comfortable with a great bed and a beautiful and spacious marble bath. Breakfasts were superb. Service was very responsive as well as proactive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel....”
Reviews.Author: glhd
Reviews.Content: The hotel location, rooms and staff are perfect for the leisure traveler looking for a relaxing stay close to restaurants and the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location....but price high for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: spyce
Reviews.Content: hi we just return from rome...tha hotel has a great location, walking distance from the spanish steps...the rooms is normal.they put flowers and recived with a fruit basket!!!they arrange for a an upgrade beacuse they sa us with lots of baggae(lol).. they have graet staff, great breakfast, and everything was super!!!but the price was high for the overall hotel!!!!would i stayed againg maybe if i find a better deal!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: BDRoyal
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Rome and the Barocco played a large role in our enjoyment. When we arrived, there was a demonstration in the piazza in front of the hotel - an authentic Italian experience! - which made it difficult to reach the hotel when we arrived. The hotel staff repeatedly apologized for the inconvenience even though it really was not much of a bother....we ended up with a free upgrade, although I do not know if it was related to the demonstration. Our room featured a large terrace and an outdoor tub, which was a delight. The staff was courteous and professional at all times.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: TravelinSurfDog
Reviews.Content: WOW was I impressed. The hotel itself is a good quality hotel and an excellent location near the Spanish Step and Trevi Fountain. The rooms were very comfortable and the overall hotel quality was very good too. But that was not what impressed me. What I loved was the amazing and thorough service of staff. AMEX Travel royally screwed up our reservation, so when we got to the hotel - no room no record. The staff was outstanding in taking care us, putting us into a room, and dealing with the hassel of AMEX to clear up the issue of the travel voucher that was never sent. It seemed everytime we walked through the lobby, everyone knew about the issue we had checking in but wanted to make sure our stay was going well. Even though the hotel did nothing wrong, and AMEX messed-up, they did everything they could to make sure our stay was memorable. Loved the hotel - Loved the staff! I am sure there are plenty of boutique hotels in Rome like Barocco, but I doubt none that have staff as engaged and caring!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in Rome, close to everything and extremely hospitable.”
Reviews.Author: gunnerandclaire
Reviews.Content: We had no doubt that we were in the hands of seasoned, and thoroughly hospitable, hotel staff. Our comfort and care, and our enjoyment of Rome, were obviously their mission. The rooms, though not spacious, are newly decorated, and the hotel is perfectly located. We stayed one week, and would have gladly stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good as long as you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Agree with other reviews that it is good service, location, and rooms however room 11 is on the staircase and near the restaurant. Woken up at 7:00 am by people walking up and down for breakfast and generally just noisy. Didn't think that room is value at 200/n.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near The Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Brian1024
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barraco, Room 43 is the best, which overlooks a Fountain in the Bertini Square. Our room was very modern and had a terrace that overlooks the square from the 4th floor! It is very chic! Bed is great and Roman tub on terrace. The hotel is very close to the Spanish Steps and the US Embassy. Metro line across the street where it was 3 minutes to the Coliseum. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and accommodating. Negotiate the Breakfast into your rate. It will save you at least 40 Euros for the 2 of you and it is worth it. Also, they can arrange for a private car to pick you up at the airport, the cost was $50 Euros, cheaper than a cab or the train...We are both very picky travelers and are fearful of the European 4 star standard...This exceeded our expectations and we would rate it a good 4 star (US Standard). Bon Voyage, Susan and Brian

Reviews.Title: “Rome perfection”
Reviews.Author: GuernseyJules
Reviews.Content: Just got home after a fabulous 3 night stay at Hotel Barocco - wow, this place is wonderful! Firstly, the location is everything. The Metro station Barberini is no more than 2 minutes walk, making it so easy to get to the Vatican and the Colisseum etc. It's on all bus routes too and the fantastic 2-hour open top hop on/off buses go from oer the road. The breakfasts are superb as are the lovely Italian waiters who serve them with a smile. The rooms are spotless and nothing is too much trouble. We walked the 5 minutes to the Trevi Fountain and found a fabulous restaurant near there - down a side road - called L'Argetto, wit the best pizzas ever. Great place to be if ever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!!!”
Reviews.Author: macfan1999
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a great, convenience location. Steps away from the metro station and great for sight seeing. The staff was great and every restaurant they recommended was great. The bed was comfortable and the room spotless. The included breakfast was a feast! The 'American' coffee they had was the best ever. Great accomodation, great value, great location, great staff, what else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central Rome hotel - splash out on the tub!”
Reviews.Author: marting
Reviews.Content: At first we were thinking of getting a room on the outskirts of Rome but saw the great reviews of the Barocco and went for it. The hotel is small (about 20 rooms) but this doesn't detract from the service. The standard of cleanliness and the quality of all areas is perfect. From the second you step in the cosy reception you are made to feel welcome, without the hotel team being over the top. The room with the "love tub" is fantastic. The bathroom is very well equipped (2 sinks and a shower where you can select the colour of the lighting!), there is a mezzanine floor with a desk and a very, very comfy bed with windows that let in very little noise (incredible for such a central hotel). And then there is the outside area. You can see from my photos how great it looks, and you are right in Rome! You can lay in the tub (which is covered) with the rain crashing down and not care - we put in some of the bath gel and it was fab. Or you can sit in one of the 4 chairs and listen to the world below. Absolute amazing. And then there is the food for breakfast. We didn't know about the cooked options until the 3rd day when we found a menu - up till then we were very happy with the continental breakfast. You can eat so much but being Rome you will walk it off. Also fantastic coffees. Location wise you are bang between St Peters and the Coliseum so everything is within walking distance, or you are bang on a mtero station (tip: it is actually easier to walk than get the metro at Termine - so many stairs there!) All in all this was the perfect hotel and I cannot fault a single thing. If you are lucky enough to get the tub room you will be in luxury (it's a great pit stop between sightseeing and dining out). Highly recommended. I wish I was there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast & very convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: PrincesseEm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Barocco and loved almost every minute. The hotel was very easy to find from the Barberini metro station even though we arrived at nearly midnight and it was dark. The check in process was fast and painless and the front desk agent was friendly - speaking in English and Italian with us. We found all of the staff members to be welcoming and helpful throughout our visit. We had a room in the annex section which we quite enjoyed because it was quiet although it would have been nice if the front desk agent had explained how to find it the night we checked in! The room overlooked the street and we could see the Piazza Barberini if we looked out from our window to the right. The traffic noise got to be a little much at times but it wasn't unbearable. The room was cleaned regularly and we liked the turn down service we received in the evenings. The room itself was comfortable if not a little small but quite normal for European standards. The bathroom was clean and spacious although I am quite short (5'3") and had trouble stepping in and out of the tub with very high sides. The highlight of this hotel for us was the breakfast. You can easily pay 30 to 40 Euros for breakfast in this touristy city and having it included in our rate was a welcome bonus, not to mention that it was wonderful not to have to hunt for a restaurant first thing in the morning. The food was fresh, plentiful and delicious. We didn't realize until the second day that we could have eggs made-to-order, which we took full advantage of! They also offered made-to-order hot beverages (try the hot chocolate - so decadent!) and had a nice variety of teas and fruit juices as well. If you can't find something to please you with all the different hot and cold items available then don't bother typing a review that says "I'm not a picky eater but..." because there is plenty to please all. The hotel was an easy downhill walk (5 mins) to the Trevi Fountain and maybe a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. There are lots of buses around as well as the Metro A right close to the hotel.
