The front desk staff are happy to help figure out what bus you need to take to get where you want to go (not just tourist attractions - we needed to get to a non-tourist place and the front desk agent directed us perfectly). The only negative to our stay was on the last night that the fire alarm (or maybe security alarm - not sure) went off several times between 3am and 5am. The front desk staff the next morning told us that it was some kind of issue with the whole neighborhood although I can't imagine what since the power didn't go out...but we were deffinitely dragging our feet a little the next day due to the interrupted sleep, not to mention being a little nervous for the rest of the night not knowing what was going on. My boyfriend was convinced that every little sound was a burgler trying to break in. Speaking of safety - there was a safe in the room although we did not make use of it. You leave your key at the front desk upon departure each morning and pick it up when you return. Also, the management posted in a previous reply to another review that internet would be free as of March. This was not the case for our stay from March 11 - 14. Overall we would deffinitely return to this hotel if not for the great breakfast then for the excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: SPman00
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty good, it had really nice bedding and sheets, together with a newly renovated shower. The room was very small, much smaller then even budget US hotels. The breakfast that came with the place was really good, especially the cooked to order egg menu. The only issue I had is coffee isn't self-service, and the server forgot I ordered coffee, even after they brought food out and saw we had nothing to drink and had to ask twice. The hotel was really quiet, which I learned to appreciate later on in my trip. The only issue with noise was we could hear the other guests when they were in the hallway. One other note, we used the private car service the hotel recommended and it was frightning how dangerously the driver runs these cars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: amydc02
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel on the basis of its very positive reviews and its location. Its placement at the Barberini metro stop was very convenient for sightseeing and the hotel was within easy walking distance to many sights, including the Trevi fountain, Pantheon and Spanish Steps. There were also a number of nice dining options within walking distance to the hotel, which worked out well since the metro closes at 9pm on most days of the week. The staff at the hotel are exceptionally helpful and the breakfast was decent, with a number of hot items available for order (included in the room cost). The internet worked but was a little fussy...it was necessary to get the staff to reset the connection on more than one occasion during our short stay. However, we were able to gain access throughout our stay. The king bed was very (actually extremely) comfortable and the hotel was quiet which allowed for a good night's sleep after a long day of sightseeing. Only major disappointment was the room itself - size was spacious (stayed in a superior room) but the overall furnishings were quite dated and the room did not have a view of anything (however, I think that also made it a very quiet room which was desirable to us). Room offered a safe which we used and we did not have any security problems at the hotel. Our room had a stand up shower and the shower head was difficult to direct in the location you wanted it to spray. The room was very clean and overall the stay was decent. However, I was hoping for a more modern room given the price. The room we got did not resemble the one pictured on the hotel website - I think there is great variation in the room types at this hotel which you can tell from user uploads of photos to the tripadvisor site. Overall, it is a reasonably good place to stay given its location. It offered a comfortable, safe and convenient stay. Just a small disappointment in the styling of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Everything!”
Reviews.Author: jenniferfaust
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Barocco. It was a split stay as we spen three nights at Hotel Barocco, two nights in Sorrento and then two more nights at Hotel Barocco. The breakfast was really nice and the bar area where we had a before dinner drink every evening was very nice. The staff was excellent and set up a few tours for us, including a private tour of the Vatican, the tour guide was excellent. The location is very good and within walking distance to most tourist areas. The only thing we didn't care much for was the hop on and hop off bus recommended by the hotel. They changed their schedule without letting us know and we had a difficult time finding the place to get back on. We had to walk a long way to find the stop at night. The desk staff came out and helped us with a rude taxi driver who tried to over charge us, which was very nice. The room was small but very comfortable and he bathroom was very modern.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It !!!”
Reviews.Author: Josephine025
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful weekend at Hotel Barocco to celebrate our mothers 60th. This was a real treat as all have children which we were leaving behind to celebrate in Rome. From our arrival at the hotel we were treated with personal service and attention, the hotels location is fabulous, walking distance from all the main attractions apart from the Vatican. Our rooms were ready on arrival, which meant we could freshen up, leave bags and go. Rooms were beautifully designed and are very large for European standards, great bathrooms !! The next day, breakfast was very varied, fruit, fresh croissants, hams, cheeses and freshly made omelettes which were delicious. We were looked after very well by Elspeth. Another day seeing the sights with transport recommendations from reception after a fabulous breakfast. Two nights wasn't enough - We went home feeling refreshed and well looked after. If you are looking for a luxury hotel with a central location and great staff - this is for you.. We will be back to Hotel Barocco. Thank you for all your care and attention.

Reviews.Title: “Descreet luxury”
Reviews.Author: David_79_CZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is hardly visible from the piazza and has no extra view. But we spent the time walking around, returning to the room in the evening. For such stay it is a perfect combination - great breakfast, clean and calm room, large and comfortable bed, close to the center (5 min to Fontana di Trevi or Spanish stairs).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: canada8989
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel Barocco on a visit to Rome in late February. We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel, that was in a good location. The hotel far exceeded our expectations. In terms of the hotel, the staff were amazing. Everyone at the front desk was extremely polite, knowledgeable and spoke English fluently. Cleaning services were fantastic - twice a day. And breakfast was a perfect size with a variety of options. The room was very spacious, especially for Rome from what I understand. We stayed in two rooms. The first one was an upgraded room thanks to our upgrade certificate from TripAdvisor. This room was amazing with a balcony over-looking the Bernini fountain. The room was updated with a large washroom, and rain shower. It was at the end of the hall on the first floor, room 14 I believe. The bed was very comfortable, and it had a new TV. The second room we stayed in was a more standard room. This room was extremely spacious, yet slightly dated decor. It had a renovated washroom, and a very comfortable bed. Very little sunlight, only a small window with not much of a view. Regardless, for the money - you could not beat this hotel. Besides all of the amazing hotel amenities (free internet, breakfast, and great restaurant and tour recommendations), the hotel location is incredible. The hotel is located within walking distance of nearly the entire city. Within 10 minutes you can be at the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, the Villa Bourghesse and many other tourist attractions. If you are up for a walk (maybe an hour) you can even walk to the Colosseum. One day we took the bus to the Jewish quarter and walked back - without stopping, it would not have taken more than an hour and a half. Bus stop for tours is right around the corner. STRONGLY recommend a bus tour. Take it for 48 hours, it can get you three partial days of travel around the city and every tourist attraction is nearby or within walking distance of the stops. Do not spend much time evaluating the companies that offer tours, most stops are standardized for all tours. Lastly, take the hotel's restaurant recommendations. Tritone is amazing. Alfredo is a must. Every restaurant they suggested was great - definitely a bonus to their great customer service. Overall, great hotel. Loved Rome and loved the Hotel Barocco. Would definitely stay there in the future. Strongly recommend for couples travelling, young or old.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, close to everything...”
Reviews.Author: raybon56
Reviews.Content: We spent two wonderful days in the Hotel Barocco in the beginning of February. We truly enjoyed it and will definitely go back. Everything was excellent. We had a nice front room. We have nothing negative to say about the Hotel or its staff. It's very central, the subway and buses are a step away, there are many small cafés and restaurants in the area. You can easily walk everywhere, if you don't want to take public transportation. We chose the Hotel because of its location. It was a good choice, it was recently refurbished. They did an excellent job.It was worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, awesome breakfast in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: sb727
Reviews.Content: Sister and I stayed here for 3 nights in the annex of the hotel. It was quiet, close to everything, and had an amazing breakfast in the morning. You can't go wrong staying here. Rooms are beautiful and possibly renovated within the last couple years. Take a short walk to "That's Amore" restaurant. Great food and awesome service.

Reviews.Title: “We spent a wonderful week at hotel Borroco in Rome”
Reviews.Author: liranz
Reviews.Content: We booked the Junior Suite at a price lower than some other hotels "superior rooms". Upon arrival the receptionist upgraded us to a Suite room. The suite was very roomy, very nicely decorated, had a GREAT bed [ my wife is pregnant and finds it difficult to sleep even at home. She had great full night sleeps there, and we even took the model of the bed], a hot-tub and a shower. Breakfasts are very nice, where you get your own personal egg cooked for you, and of course there is the usual buffet to choose from with cheese, sliced meats and pastry. Every member of the staff was very kind and helpful, and we felt really welcomed. The staff spoke decent English, and were always readily available. On the evenings we asked them for restaurant recommendations and always got good choices. The location of the hotel is also great. We spent a week in Rome and only took the Metro to get to the Vatican. Everything else we did by foot. The only downside was the Internet connection. They have wifi with broadband connection (I used Skype to make calls), but they have a system where you receive your own username and password that expire after few hours, and you have to re-enter them every time. This was a bit tedious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SanClementeReitler
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed here for 3 nights while in Rome. Our room was huge and very tastefully decorated. We had a very comfortable king size bed, and another bed for our son. It was definitely much nicer than we were expecting based on the price we paid. Breakfast every morning was delicious. They had a buffet full of pastries, meats, cheeses, yogurts, and cereals. In addition, they made omelettes and eggs to order. It was a great way to start the day! We will absolutely stay her again when we return to Rome. They take excellent care of their guests and even gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne. We really enjoyed our times at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Italian in Every Way...”
Reviews.Author: shotguncapital
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Barocco for five days for the first time ever. For this trip we wanted someplace romantic - so staying in a big chain hotel (Hilton, Mariott, etc.) was out of the question. The Hotel Barocco was perfect in every way. As for location, it is perfectly centered around the major historical sites in Rome (almost all within walking distance), and is across the street from the Metro (to get to the Vatican). It is on the Piazza Barberini, but on a small cross street so the rooms are quiet and isolated from major traffic. In our opinion, the best coffee in Rome is across the street (Pepe's Bar), and the best pizza in the world is around the corner on Via Veneto (Ciao Bella). The rooms are impeccably styled in Roman decor. Our bathroom was huge, all marble, with a wonderful bathtub for soaking after spending the day walking, eating, and taking in the sights of the eternal city. The bedlinens are of exceptional quality, as is the mattress and pillows. I am a picky sleeper, and got the best nights rest in this hotel. The windows open, which is a rarity in hotels these days, so you can sleep with the sounds of Rome in the background. The included breakfast is wonderful and traditional Italian, with the option for more "American" eggs and bacon if you wish. The staff provides exemplary service, speaks fluent english, and tolerated my marginal Italian so that I could improve during the trip. Nick in the bar is great, as is Danielle at the front desk. To sum it all up, for five days we did not want for anything. Every little detail was taken care of invisibly by the staff. From directions, restaurant recommendations, or even an umbrella when it was raining, we truly felt we were "home" during our brief stay. We will stay here again very soon. Danielle & Nick: Grazie per la vostra ospitalità durante il nostro viaggio a Roma!!! Jim & Shelley

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable location, newly refurbished, clean and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: RoseandBlas
Reviews.Content: Took my son to Rome for a week-end in February. I've been there before, and have suffered some awfull hotels. So I was not altogether sure of what I would find. Must say I was surprised by how nice the hotel, and particularly the room was. First off, the hotel is 2 - 3 blocks away from the Spanish Steps. We walked to Termini station on our way back to the airport (approx 10 min). We either walked or took the bus the whole time. It was really and unbeatable location for tourism. The room itself was small and, since it was an interior room, had very little light. However the carpet, furniture, TV, bathroom - everything was brand new. Very clean, very nice. My son loves going to hotels because of the buffets. The breakfast buffet was very good and the service was excellent. Because the hotel is somewhat small, we had to wait for a table on the second day, but it was fast enough. An the staff was fenomenal. Overall, I would recommend it. It was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and would like to go back”
Reviews.Author: cknapp
Reviews.Content: We had such a lovely stay. I had spent a long time searching for a hotel that had everything we wanted and with good reviews. Hotel Barocco delivered exactly what it promised. The staff were fantastic, very friendly and incredibly helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. I have to admit I am very picky about hotels, so many of them get it wrong. It is lovely to find somewhere that we would happily go back to! Good location, easy to walk to a number of places, particularly Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Metro also very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: jessica30328
Reviews.Content: The staff at Barocco Hotel were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast that was included in the hotel price far exceeded my expectations, and it was very tasty. The room was small (which is typical in Europe), but it wasn't cramped. I believe this hotel was renovated/refurbished a year or so ago, so the bathrooms were very chic, and the bed was extremely comfortable. We were also surprised at how frequently the room was cleaned (twice a day, I believe). House keeping kept the room as clean as possible (vacuumed and new sheets/towels daily). The location was wonderful - right in Barberini Piazza a block away from the metro stop. However, since there isn't a large sign in the piazza saying "Hotel Barocco" or anything of the like, it was a little difficult to find the entrance of the hotel. The entrance is a few meters down a side street from the piazza. Being close to the metro stop was very nice since we rode this to Vatican City. With the exception of Vatican City, all other major site-seeing destinations in Rome are a short walk away from the hotel, which is definitely one of the best parts of this hotel. If you're not opposed to walking 15 minutes to your final site-seeing destination, I would recommend this hotel because you'll find all sorts of other great sites to explore on the way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, intimate, friendly, attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Kfafa
Reviews.Content: Nice junior suite for 3 in the family, very helpful receptionists and concierge.Gave our kids free internet constantly. Cute breakfast rooms and plenty of variety although service a little wierd. Take the taxi offer from the airport to the hotel, its good value. Great location, walking distance to Spanish Steps, Trevi, Via Veneto, plenty of restaurants and shopping options. Taxis inexpensive to most areas. Choose restaurants carefully as many look more of the same. Get the hotel to book a table at Gusto, its a definite must eat and great modern variation of the regular Roman theme. Also the Ricotta Cheesecake (with chocolate) from the 7th generation Jewish Bakery in the Jewish Quarter is an absolute MUST!!! Sit on the nearby steps and have a perfect cheesecake picnic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: swalters925
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the first 4 days/3 nights of our honeymoon. The staff was perfectly bilingual and more than helpful and polite. The daily breakfast was delicious and the rooms were extremely clean. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a quaint, friendly, clean, well-located hotel in Rome. I would most definetely stay here again on another trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, best value , best friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theguide1963
Reviews.Content: we chose the hotel only because we read TA reviews.everything was even better than expectaions.we came 2 adults with 1 child - age 3 , and we got a large room , at the back of the hotel ( far from the piazza ) .it eas excellant stay ,the staff was very polite and helpful, breakfast big buffet , with service ( all kind of coffees, and omlets free of charge ), and dont forget the location, we stayed 4 days in rome and used the metro only once.! we for sure will come back to the Barocco hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Loumund
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have only just returned from this hotel. We had a great stay. Staff were friendly and helpful. They made you feel welcome. Our room was small but very comfortable. It had every thing that you needed, including Sky TV and a hairdryer. Our friends were staying in another hotel and they didnt even have a wardrobe! This hotel was in a great location, in the old part of the city. It was a nice walk to the Spanish steps and the Trevi Fountain in the evening (10mins). Metro was around the corner. 10mins ride to the colloseum and Vatican. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small but well-appointed rooms, service could be friendlier”
Reviews.Author: Middle_East_Explorer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nicely-restored mansion. Piazza Barberini is a great location, a bit off from the main centers of activity but right at the bottom of Via Veneto. Everything is a short metro or bus ride away. There are also good restaurants in the neighborhood. As for the hotel itself, rooms are quite small and the huge beds take up most of the room, but bathrooms are large (although not well-lit) with bidet and good shower (no tub). Breakfast was very good with a lot of variety, and, of course, excellent coffee. The only things for which I would fault the hotel are the lack of free internet and the general unfriendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerMo11
Reviews.Content: The hotel has benefitted from full refurbishment in 2010. The decor and in-room facilities are excellent and I found the bed large and incredibly comfortable. The room was small (although a superior), and the four-poster bed made it difficult to move around without bumping into metal bars. The breakfast is good, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Everything is in walking distance and the location is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Good value, helpful to the extreme, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Knight666
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Barocco and immediately I realised that I had left my phone in the taxi - which had already departed. The hotel made a number of calls and managed to track down the taxi driver and I had my phone back the next day. Fantastic! Our room was very large considering it was one of the cheaper rooms. A very large, immaculately clean bathroom with bath and separate shower. No traffic noise considering the location next to a busy square and great blackout curtains ensuring a great night's sleep in a very comfortable bed. Situated very conveniently about 30 metres from the Barberini Metro station, and all major tourist attractions well within walking distance. Breakfast was a very slight disappointment with no hot food available, but this may be slightly picky. A fantastic 5 day break - thanks Barocco!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a fabulous experience.”
Reviews.Author: Rogofor
Reviews.Content: The front office was great, the elevator was a boon for an elderly couple, and the room was comfortable and well appointed. Breakfasts were varied and tasty. No other meals, but plenty of choice in the nearby area. Our laundry was efficiently and quickly sorted out. We just didn't have a long enough stay. More time to visit Rome would have been wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic hotel, location, staff, all great”
Reviews.Author: Peggysmummy
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be fairly central and we were, great location walking distance to trevi fountain, spanish steps also very handy tube station literally acroos the road 4 or 5 stops to the vatican and just a 1 euro each way. The room was onesof the nicest Ive stayed in with a great view of the Barberini plaza and fountian, quite at night with no problem from noise etc. Buffet breakfast were very good also. Will definately be recommending to friends and if I retrun tho the eternal city again (sure I will) then will be booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent rooms, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: withkids_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barocca from the 1st January to the 5th January 2011. The hotel organised a car to pick us up at the airport and it was waiting when we arrived. We have 2 children aged 10 and 13 so booked a suite overlooking the Plaza Barberini, which was lovely and spacious with a bathroom which had a bath and separate shower, plenty of room. The staff serving breakfast were especially helpful and the food was fresh with plenty of it! The hotel is literally around the corner from the Metro although we only used this when visiting the Vatican (which we did twice during our stay). Location is ideal, especially for shopping. It is a 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain, and although our room overlooked the plaza, we heard no noise from the outside traffic. I would definately recommend this hotel for families, and staying here means you can walk to all locations easily. The weather was lovely during our stay, but would imagine during the summer, it would be too hot as the streets are very crowded. We followed all of the tips on trip advisor when visiting the Collesseum etc, and these were well worth knowing. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: wayleggo
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4 (2 teenagers) on a 2 month europe tour, we can get stressed and had just booked out of a dump apartment(not available on TA); trip advisor reviews led us to Barocco, and we enjoyed the rest of the Rome stay. Superbly obliging staff, refurbished fresh and light rooms, spotlessly clean and pleasant breakfast service. Our standard double room was very compact (no space for an armchair) but the quality fittings, quality en-suite countered that. They have larger rooms. Walk everywhere, the location is tops. Our rooms were quiet with no corridor noise, and being on a side street no bothersome street noise. An excellent 4 star hotel. And on a long tour with teenagers , it was a treat to have dozens of english language TV channels via cable. why isn't internet included "free" nowadays!

Reviews.Title: “We miss the staff.”
Reviews.Author: BelieveUMe
Reviews.Content: Aside from the rooms being comfortable and elegant and the bathrooms being immaculately clean and sleek in design and the breakfast buffet being sumptuous and overflowing, it is Hotel Barocco's staff, especially those at the front desk, that made our visit to Rome feel like we were staying with family. They couldn't do enough to make you feel more comfortable, to help you find whatever you needed in the hotel or in the city, to help you fix a problem even if it had nothing to do with the hotel, or to find any way to make things easier for you--and always with sincerity and thoughtfulness. They even helped us deal with a dishonest taxi driver. All other great things aside, it is Hotel Barocco's staff that truly makes this hotel a genuine treasure. We enjoyed Rome so much, largely because of them and the help and advice they gave us. My husband and I cannot forget how wonderful they were to us. I hope they read this review.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: joangarbo
Reviews.Content: The beautiful and spacious room we had had a terrace overlooking the Piazza Barbarini. Hotel staff were gracious and accommodating. One snag before we left: I had left a tip for the HK staff on our departure date. I was planning on doing the same for the bellman; but we discovered that he had taken the HK staff tip when he got our bags, and then denied it. We rose a stink and called him out. Don't know what the hotel did with it, but I didn't tip him when we left.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: westbaysouth
Reviews.Content: great staff, very comfortable rooms, excellent location. breakfast included makes it very convenient to start your day. We were there over new years eve and when we returned a bottle of prosecco was on ice for us to enjoy. Will return again

Reviews.Title: “Negative Review”
Reviews.Author: Tippytoes2612
Reviews.Content: I am due to stay at the Barocco on 29 March for 4 days. I always fully review each hotel before booking and this seems to have the best reviews for the whole of central Rome. As Franco the manager said, you cannot compare US hotels with those in Europe - and I have stayed in many. I am looking forward to my stay, which is to celebrate my daugher's 40th birthday, and fully expect it to be a very enjoyable time. Mrs Duggan Wales

Reviews.Title: “great little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajb693
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for four days, and overall would rate this hotel highly. It is in a great location and the staff are all really helpful. They were happy for us to stay longer in the room as we had a later flight . There is a seperate seating area that is open all day with four comfy sofas, so assume the other reviewer missed this. The rooms are small but they are fine for a city centre hotel and the beds are excellent. They have gone to a lot of trouble to shut out the noise from outside and we never had any problem with street noise, unfortunately we did get woken from an early delivery one morning at 5.00 am , we were given a complementary bottle of wine and the manager was excellent we never had any problems again, and he stressed how unusual it was so think we were just unlucky Would definitely stay there again , although i think best to avoid rooms that back onto the service stairway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: JagHi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hotel Barocco in Rome. Our stay was amazing! The staff was very accommodating setting up tours for us, making restaurant accommodations, arranging taxis, and providing any recommendations we needed. The accomodations were spectacular! We stayed on the 4th floor ste 43 and it had it's own private terrace with outside hot jacuzzi tub and a huge table to relax outside. Unbelievable! The beds were very comfortable and our rate included a wonderful buffet breakfast. Ournrate was 245. Euro per night and it was worth every penny! From the hotel, we could walk everywhere but bring good walking shoes as the roads ( cobblestones) are uneven. The hotel is situated in Piazza Barberini and very close to the Trevi Fountain. When you arrive into Rome airport, you can take a taxi for 40 euro but go to the official taxi line at the airport. We had many people trying to scam us for 60+ euro that were waiting for us right outside of baggage claim. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: duponter
Reviews.Content: The staff, indded, were nice and friendly. But for €300 a night, i was expecting at least a nice lobby to sit in. Instead, there was one sofa in the tiny lobby. There is a sitting room somewhere which is not always available to guests--locked! The room has nice stone floor with great view of the fountain but very loud day and night since the street is a major thouroughfare! During breakfast guests would talk about the noise!!!! The room was clean though floor was sticky at times and no slippers were provided for. Breakfast consisted of one non-sweet bread and all others were danish pastries, cakes, tortes. This property would be no more than a two star in the States.

Reviews.Title: “Why not to come back in Barocco hotel when being next time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Igor1969
Reviews.Content: Nice location, close to sightseeing and shopping area, very friendly stuff, good breakfast,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryQ68
Reviews.Content: A great start to a romantic weekend in Rome was the limosine service that we booked through the hotel. When we checked in the hotel had our room ready even though we arrived before the offical check in time. Also the nicest surprise was the room upgrade that the hotel gave us. We stayed in the Terrace&Love-Pool suite which was a beautiful room with a wonderful view from the terrace of the Triton Fountain. A truly romantic wonderful litle hotel that made our weekend in Rome one that we will always remember. Thank you to the Hotel staff who were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful beds”
Reviews.Author: rometohongkong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barocco for four days in early December. The hotel is in a great location for anything you want to do in Rome. You walk out the door and see the beautiful Fontana del Tritone by Bernini. The hotel is typical Roman, a very small elevator, oddly shaped room etc. But it has recently been updated and the rooms are very nice, with brand new windows and shutters that hold out the sound nicely. But their best addition has to be the foam top beds, absolutely the best in Rome, these beds are heavenly. sorry Westin!!!! The breakfast is very nice, and served until 10:30 for you late sleepers. All in all a very nice hotel. One area a lot of hotels fall down on is the internet access. They farm this out to a third party and you pay an arm and a leg for it. In this case the access was awful, most pages didn't want to load. Also you had to put your access code in every time you went on which was a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: TandCfromHawaii
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, just around the corner from some great restaurants, cafes, metro stop, shopping...and walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and the Colosseum. The bed was the most COMFORTABLE bed I've slept in Europe! Perfect after a long day of sightseeing! The breakfast was excellent, with eggs and bacon cooked to order for us Americans if we desired it..but the selection of meats and cheeses and cereals and yogurts and fruit was quite abundant. It was easy to catch a cab too since they stack up near the piazza around the corner. They recommend a parking garage just a few blocks away, reasonably priced and safe covered parking. It is a little pricier than some other cheaper hotels, but I think its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kjfranklin
Reviews.Content: It was a bit warm in the room even for November so we kept the windows open but it had a bit of road noise for sleeping. But other than that it was in the perfect location to walk to all attractions. Room was beautiful and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was very good. We are very happy to have chosen the Barrocco Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Elegance and Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: maggietravelista89
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at Barocco Hotel and would stay here again on my next trip to Rome! Our room was better than I could hope for with a 4 star hotel. It had the most comfortable bed with luxurious bedding and amazing shower/ shower head. They had turn down service and all the amenities you could want (except conditioner). The staff was friendly as we constantly asked for tourist advice and restaurant directions. They were eager to help us with planning and give us the name of the best gelateria in Rome. The hotel is in the best location, 5 mins walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, close to fabulous food and a metro stop that will take you to the Vatican in 5 minutes. Also, you have to pay for internet here, which may be one drawback, but when our allotted time that we paid for ran out, they generously extended it for free. The breakfast was nice as the brought us fresh fried eggs (perfectly cooked) and of course amazing coffee and hot frothy milk. I travel a lot usually staying at 4 and 5 start hotels and this hotel has certainly has been one of the best I have ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: blue85stephanie
Reviews.Content: Located at Piazza Barberini the hotel is close to Piazza di Spagna, the Fontana di Trevi and Via del Corso. The hotel is near the tourist buses route and you can also get a taxi or bus at the piazza. Rooms are small but clean. Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateScottsdale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Barocco for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was clean, bedding was top quality, bathroom was large and modern. It was decorated beautifully in a classic style with all the amenities of top notch hotel. Our room over looked the Piazza Barberini, which is what we requested. The views at night were exquisite. ( Be aware that this is a busy piazza, so there is some noise.) The location is fantastic. We walked to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, and Trevi Fountain a couple of times. In fact, we walked to the Vatican and Coliseum from the hotel. It is not too far from Rome Termini, if you do not have much luggage to carry. Now the staff, these people were helpful in every way possible. They are knowledgable, friendly, and willing to help with restaurants, tours, walking directions, and any questions. Each suggestion was a perfect solution. Our compliments to the hotel, front desk staff, and housekeeping, they were the best that we encountered in Italy, and we had only good experiences on our trip. And, don't let me forget to mention the breakfast buffet. It was excellent and the service staff very attentive. Thanks Hotel Barocco for a perfect stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barocco is a quaint hotel and hidden gem in the center of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: ares_2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barocco is a quaint hotel around the corner from Barberini Metro, walking distance from the Trevi Fountain, great shopping and dining. The hotel is spotless and nicely decorated. It has an excellent full breakfast and our room was quiet and cozy. We'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal start to our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: evonelf
Reviews.Content: We booked the pre/post cruise package with Hotel Barocco and it was the best decision we could have possibly made to start our vacation out right. Barocco took care of all our pre cruise concerns from the prompt email responses to the pick up at the airport, arrangements of a city bus tour and the transportation to the port. The room was spectacular with a delightful surprise of a rainfall shower, spacious room, and a lovely private terrace overlooking the Piazza Barberini. Perfectly situated near all the major sightseeing sites, it is an easy walk to a new discovery in every direction. And we must also commend the reception staff whose helpfulness left us with such a great lasting impression of Barocco. We are already looking forward to returning on our next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and delightful!”
Reviews.Author: mzsusanfini
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the day we left, Hotel Barocco was a delightful experience! The friendly desk staff, the quaint (but very clean!) room and the wonderful ambience all added to a fantastic experience. The room, although small, was comfortable and current. The bathroom was a delightful surprise of calming hues and modern conveniences! The bed --- too wonderful for words!! Our party availed ourselves to a small room off the lobby. We enjoyed every evening after vigorous siteseeing with a bottle (or two) of wine and conversation. This hotel is truly a jewel and I would urge other travellers to stay here without reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Nice Location but some things did not work”
Reviews.Author: AndyFla
Reviews.Content: Rooms were BEAUTIFUL--but lights by bed needed a college degree to figure out how to turn all of them off and on..and ...some of them never turned on ever... Bathroom was beautiful- showerf had lights that glowed pink/lavender when turned on...VERY nice. Towel warmer never worked and phone in bathroom NEVER work nor was replaced when we asked....An hour and 1/'2 to wait for someone to bring towels was crazy..we went ahead and showered with the teeny towels left. Need to UPGRADE quality of towels--very rough and tiny compared to the luxurious gorgeous small room. Breakfast was wonderful...all types of hams,cheeses,hard boiled egss, juices,croissants,pastries etc. VERY VERY GOOD> Front desk was very good 99% of the time . Christiano, the 7 am-3pm front desk person was terrific !! The nite before we had to leave we asked for a wake up call..thank the lord I set my cell phone-- it woke me up. I called downstairs and was told the guy at front desk and he was going to call soon...and this was 1/2 hr AFTER we wanted the wake up call..NOT the way to be if u NEED to get up to catch a plane. IF u r in that pickle, go downstairs and tell them u want an AUTOMATIC WAKE UP CALL....then it works just find. Would we stay here again--yes.....was it perfect, no but pretty darn close.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for the finale to our trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: principessa3225
Reviews.Content: After traveling around Italy for over 3 weeks we ended our trip with a 4 night stay at the Hotel Barocco, and it really couldn't have been better way to finish our vacation. For some unknown but delightful reason we were upgraded to a junior suite that was very spacious, lovely, and had a wonderful view of the Piazza Barberini and it's goings on. The entire hotel staff was extremely friendly, everyone at the front desk very helpful with arranging tours, dinner recommendations and reservations, and anything else we needed. Breakfast was very nice...my husband loved that he could get fresh eggs....service very good. The location is ideal, off the Via Veneto, near the Spanish Steps and Trevi, with a taxi stand, the Metro and a bus stop all right there. The only down side is the piazza can be a little noisy through the night, but playing a bit of soft music seemed to soothe it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit and nice location”
Reviews.Author: tomannwilliams
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a great location combined with excellent helpful service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: gogreenChicago
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at Hotel Barocco twice in October. On our first stay we were upgraded to Jr. Suite #59. I would recommend this room if you feel like you need extra space, there is plenty. It has a very comfortable bed, ample bathroom and balcony overlooking Piazza Barberini. You will hear more street noise in this room and to get to the room you take the elevator to the 4th floor then down the hall, then up a marble spiral staircase. We had a wonderful staff member that showed us the way when we checked in. Our second stay was in room #46. This is a smaller room but with all the same amenities. This was a quieter room as it is not on via Barberini but it doesn't have a view. If you can't find your slippers, check the bottom drawer of the night stand. Both rooms had very comfortable beds and came with a fresh fruit plate, robes and slippers, flat screen TV, safe and turn down service. The bathroom amenities are good but you will need to bring your own conditioner and wash cloths - lots of towels but no wash cloths. Breakfast was more than adequate with fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, meats, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, yogurt and your choice of coffees. We experienced exceptional service - we were directed to a travel agency down the street where we bought train tickets. We were able to buy subway tickets at the front desk and the metro stop was just a block away. The staff was always pleasant and professional. Note: When you are arriving, let your driver know the entrance to the hotel is around the corner on via della Purificazione not on via Barberini.

Reviews.Title: “A charming small hotel with nice public spaces.”
Reviews.Author: MLH0000
Reviews.Content: We were here for three nights and although the room was small and lacked drawers for clothes as other guests has noted, it was beautifully decorated, appeared just recently renovated, and exceptionally clean. The bathroom was good sized, but did lack a light over the sink and mirror which made it hard to apply makeup. The beds were so comfortable and the overall feeling of the room was wonderful. We both loved the breakfast and we were impressed that it wasn't exactly the same everyday. I was a little surprised that some food items were not replaced once they ran out even though it was still early, but everything was so good I just made sure we were early to breakfast! Exceptionally helpful staff completed the experience and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Maisyandlilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in hotel in October, 2010, along with another couple. The staff was helpful with good restaurant suggestions, the rooms were spacious for Rome, and the breakfasts were satisfying. The public areas of the hotel were in good shape and nice. The location was very convenient for sightseeing. I would recommend this hotel to future travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff; Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PleasantRidge
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out the service was excellent. The room, as anticipated, was a bit smaller than an American hotel room because the hotel is in an old building. The room did not contain a chest of drawers; but, otherwise it was beautifully furnished and the bed was VERY comfortable. The bathroom was fairly spacious. The breakfast was more than adequate and the service was cheerful and efficient. Despite not having a restuarant, bar snacks and room service items are available. We were steps away from a metro stop and several buses passed right by the door. My husband and I are seniors, and I hurt my knee the week before our trip and was using a cane, but we were able to stroll to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The hotel staff arranged tours, recommended restaurants and even supplied a converter as we'd managed to leave home without ours. We plan to return to Rome and use this hotel. I would recommend this hotel for other couples.

Reviews.Title: “Appealing hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: UKzealot
Reviews.Content: We loved the Barocco! The hotel has recently been refurbished, and the room (14) was most attractive (though slightly small). The bathroom, though, was roomy and the shower - an overhead drench shower with color-shifting lighting, no less - was pure delight. The breakfast, quite adequate, was served in a variety of pleasant little rooms. The English-speaking front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Best of all, the location just of Piazza Barberini is just a half-block from the Barberini Metro stop, a short walk from many interesting galleries, shopping precincts and famous sights, and directly across the street from a Bernini sculpture. The only minor negative of room 14 was its location right on the Piazza, which is a busy thoroughfare night and day. Double-glazed windows kept noise to a reasonable minimum, but in fairness, there was a bit a traffic noise in the room. It wasn't particularly bothersome (in other words, I would happily stay in room 14 at the Barocco again). We were very happy with this choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little place and the great location!”
Reviews.Author: LeasaNT
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Barocco is tucked away in a little alleyway right off of Piazza Barberini. It's very close to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, but not so close that you're in the midst of the tourist masses. The proximity to Piazza Barberini makes it extremely easy to get here by taxi. The lobby and the breakfast areas are nothing fancy, but they are spotlessly clean and offer everything you could need. The front office staff was extremely helpful and very friendly. They took great care of us. The room was the real treasure... It was teeny-tiny in classic European style, but it was new, modern, spotless and comfortable. It had the nicest and cleanest bathroom that we experienced on our trip. We loved the nightly turndown service and the robe. All in all- it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Good location for transportation options. Quiet!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JBinBeantown
Reviews.Content: We had no idea what neighborhood we should stay in on our first visit to Rome. When we arrived at this hotel we were a little put off by a 'cat urine' smell, but quickly discovered it is not in the hotel, but just outside the entrance. Something to do with a sewer grate, we decided. Every day we had the front desk staff help us make plans. They happily reserved for us at the Borghese Gallery, though they didn't tell us you only have two hours, then the staff at this former villa kick everyone out and let a new crop of visitors in. They loaned us a guide book to Rome in English, as we didn't have one. They found us a private car to take us to the airport for our departure. They delivered our laundry on time when we had them do it for us. They answered questions galore, always with a smile, and our room was fantastic. If you can possibly get room 19, it is one flight up so you don't have to wait for the small elevator; it overlooks the beautiful Triton Fountain; the double windows keep all the street noise out and it is really a two - room suite with a huge bathroom with separate jacuzzi bathtub and stall shower. Sky TV is included if you care about that. We thought the wood on the furniture was a little tired and worn, but we quickly overlooked that as the bed was huge, comfortable, they left us SIX pillows and many blankets and we had a walk-in closet with tons of room in it. Fantastic for a hotel in a big city. We enjoyed breakfast, where eggs were made to order and three different juices were provided in addition to yogurt, fruit, many sweet things and rolls, cheese and meats coffee, tea, etc. More fresh fruit rather than canned and fresh squeezed juices would have been nice, but we understand why they don't offer that. As it is, breakfast is quite busy, but there is always a table in the pleasant breakfast room when you show up between 7 o'clock and 10:30 for breakfast. Till 11 o'clock on weekends. We found the hotel to be excellent, but the location a little far away from many of the sites we wished to see. Yes, it's near enough to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain to walk, but there isn't much to see once you've been there. Piazza Navona is more exciting, and a bit too far to walk. You are very far from "colloseo" and Vatican City, but Rome is big and you can't be near everything you wish to see. There are some great restaurants in the Spanish Steps neighborhood, but if it is rainy or you have delicate shoes on, you're probably going to want to take a cab because it isn't 'just around the corner'. Also, this neighborhood is on one of the famous Roman Hills, so in one direction or another, you're walking uphill. Someone who lived in Rome said to me "Romans don't go there, tourists do" about this neighborhood, and he was right. But given that we were tourists, it worked well for us. To start our day without becoming overheated, we often took cabs in the morning to our destinations. The cab rides in Rome are not cheap and the jerkiness of the ride, the air pollution in the city and traffic sometimes made me a little nauseated. For those who are willing to take public transportation everywhere, the Barocco is a perfect location. It is right on Piazza Barberini with a Metro stop and major bus line stops; there is a taxi stand right on the piazza as well when you want the comfort or security of a cab. The front desk will sell you as many bus tickets as you wish and the Metro system is very easy to negotiate as it has only two lines and they converge at the conveniently named "Termini" station. We did wait a very long time one morning at Termini to switch from Line B to Line A and it would have been difficult for someone with claustrophobia. Hundreds and hundreds of people were waiting on the platform when a train finally came. A real 'Roman' experience! The Barocco staff provided us with a welcome basket of fruit when we arrived, which was a nice touch, and they didn't care if we put leftovers or our own drinks in the fridge/minibar. They have a bar from 4pm on and newspapers if you wish to keep up with the local news, so if your room is a little small, there are public spaces to hang out and relax and maybe meet other guests. I have close to four hours of internet time I can give someone the code for if you are staying at the Barocco in the next three months because we bought five hours of internet time for 15 Euro, a very reasonable price for a big city, and didn't use up our last bit of internet time. Contact me and I can give you the codes if you see this in time to use it. The internet service was excellent, by the way. We brought our own netbook computer. There is some terrific shopping in the area. I particularly liked a boutique around the corner called Roux for women's accessories and clothes and this hotel is located very near the eerie/weird Cappucin Friar Cemetery, which you can visit for a donation of 1 Euro and you will not quickly forget. Always felt safe in this area at any time. We never tired of gazing at the Triton Fountain by Bernini and felt lucky to have such a spacious, quiet room and helpful staff to support us in our first visit to this ancient city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean with nice bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: maggiemay7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Palazzo Bernini and is right across the street from the subway & bus, which is an easy and inexpensive way to travel, as well as by foot. Our superior room was very clean with a comfortable bed and fabulous modern bathroom. Ours had a large walk in shower (w/rain showerhead) and large bathtub. The fiber optic colored lighting was a nice touch in the bathroom, although it would have been nice to have a magnifying mirror or a bit more light above the sink. The room is small, but well appointed and the breakfast was very nice. Nice little amenities and excellent water pressure, as well as a quiet sleep. Also, the price was reasonable by Rome standards, but it would have been nice to have free internet service as we did in Venice & Florence.

Reviews.Title: “good value for a centrally located hotel with upscale amenities”
Reviews.Author: breccia
Reviews.Content: Quality finishes and fixtures in the bathroom, comfy beds with nice sheets - my only niggle is the size of the rooms - but that is to be expected in central Rome I suppose ( a short walk from the Spanish Steps). The first room we were shown was dark - the window opened to a wall - and management graciously switched us to a much nicer room when I complained. We opted for the limo transfer to the airport offer, which was a fantastic deal at 20 euros - the driver was excellent and the Mercedes clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel Barocco!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmoya72955
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Barocco for a total of 5 nights and we simply couldn't have chosen a better hotel. The price was right along with the perfect location within a walking distance to Via Veneto and Spanish Steps. The Concierge was always helpful and ready to meet our requests, no matter what time it was. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. All in all, the hotel staff made our stay in Rome even more memorable. Next time in Rome, I will definitely stay at Hotel Barocco. Jessy Moya and Family

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: petetom
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome and somewhat apprehensive. Picked Hotel Barocco based on others' evaluations and were pleased with results. The brick and mortar part was good, even though the room was on the small side, but the staff was superb. The gentlemen manning the front desk and the breakfast personnel were amazingly helpful, friendly and well informed. We also lucked out on location. Not knowing Rome and where each place of interest was located, we found ourselves being able to walk to most of them or get the Metro a few steps away, or the nearby taxi stand and bus stop. I would recommend this hotel to everyone interested and be assured that if our travels take us to Rome again, we'll be at Hotel Barocco.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: LondonFoxy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome for part of our honeymoon. We were really impressed with our room and the hotel. It is really close to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain and not far from anywhere else. The staff were all very helpful and gave us a bottle of Prosecco on our first night there. There was a great buffet breakfast and the option of eggs and bacon. We were really impressed with our room and the decor. Although our window did not over look anything spectacular the room made up for it. It was quite small in size but had absolutely everything and was really comfortable. I would recommend staying at this hotel a) because of the location and b) the comfort of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: makaira1985
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel that is within walking distance of most of the places you will want to visit. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and dinner recommendations and reservations. The breakfast buffet was very nice. We really enjoyed having an after dinner drink in the bar with the friendliest bartender, Nick.

Reviews.Title: “A solid hotel choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KMItaly2010
Reviews.Content: Good location close to major sites. Piazza Barberini was a little noisy with car traffic but a higher floor works well if you face the square. Friendly staff and very clean room with updated bathrooms. Upgraded room included a larger suite like room with 1.5 bathrooms. True king size American bed was nice, mattress was firm but not uncommon in Europe. Breakfast was good and included eggs to order upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean Accomodations in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tpcinva
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay at the Hotel Barocco. The hotel is situated near the Spanish Steps and within walking distance to many tourist stops. The staff was very professional and friendly. The room, while small (we understand that space is at a premium in Rome) was nicely appointed and clean. It would have been nice to have had something better than a lukewarm shower every morning. When we arrived to check-in, the elevator in the hotel was not working, and our room was on the 6th floor. We also had to call maintenance for a running toilet. We liked the Baracco, but will probably consider other hotels for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Renovations, Great Location, Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: goirish1981
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hotel Barocco in Rome. It is a quiet, small boutique hotel that recently was renovated and is nicely appointed. it is located close to many of Rome's great sights and the Metro system. Despite being very close to the Piazza Barberini, it is quiet and the room was large by European standards. The staff was warm and helpful and provided great recommendations. We will stay there again on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best things about staying in Rome was being at your Hotel. Just wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katme51
Reviews.Content: Your limo service was a great way to start our first trip to Europe. You made getting there so easy. The service was great, a super location, the room was adorable and the breakfast was way beyond anything that I thought it would be. The hotel is elegant, yet warm. I loved our location--walking to everything. Can't wait to go back to Rome and Hotel Barroco would be my first choice of a place to stay. It had a very European feel plus all the amenities you could want.

Reviews.Title: “Fantatic Hotel - Beautiful Terrace and outdoor tub”
Reviews.Author: mlc13
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barocco was fantastic. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Rome. My husband and I stayed there the first four evenings of our honeymoon. Beautifully appointed rooms with a great view from our private terrace to Piazza Barberini. Very convenient location, near Metro - Barberini Stop. Hotel provides complimentary pick up from the airport with a stay of more than three evenings. 260Euro/nite is more than we typically would spend, but well well worth it. Rate included breakfast, typical Italian hotel breakfast of cakes/sweets, cheeses, yogurt and croissants with cofee, tea, service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Stop Researching! This is your place!”
Reviews.Author: Angksu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week in Rome and had an AMAZING time! Hotel Barocco is wonderful. Stop researching. I spent hours and weeks looking for a great place to stay and I found it! Everything you read about Hotel Barocco is true- Great rooms, amazing breakfast, helpful staff, great location, and very clean rooms. If we ever come back to Rome, we will definitely be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff, good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: sophster216
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of August 2010. The room was updated with a modern roomy bathroom. The bedroom itself was quite small (but up to European standards), Breakfast was mainly cold cuts and fruit. It is conveniently located half a mile from the Spanish steps and 1 mile from Trevi Fountain. Very accessible to the majority of popular locations. My only complaint was the A/C. There was only 1 setting (since the hotel closed off the higher setting). It was kinda muggy and warm especially after a shower..... I would recommend this to a friend if they are visiting Rome for a night or 2 only!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: CCGourmand
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Barocco was a charming hotel for a two night stay in Rome! Great location, close to the Trevi fountain and the Spanish Steps, both beautiful sites. Our room was very large, and the rooms quiet, not at all what I expected, and would make a long stay quite enjoyable. The beds are heavenly, a tempurpedic memory foam that let me sleep like a baby! The morning of our departure the hotel arranged for a driver who was on time and professional. The service staff is excellent, accommodating all our request. Oh, and the free breakfast is amazing, typical Italian fare, including meats, cheeses, breads, fruit, etc. All in the most beautiful display. I would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Comfortable mattresses which is a plus”
Reviews.Author: jrnmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome before leaving for the Amalfi Coast. Excellent staff and the mattresses were soft and comfortable. Close to many attractions and will set up airport pick ups. Loved the fruit and breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - larger rooms than I'd imagined we'd get!”
Reviews.Author: rspriest
Reviews.Content: We had two important requirements for our hotel in Rome - good location for sightseeing and good air conditioning, since we were visiting in August. This hotel had both. Spacious bathrooms with rainfall showers - definitely didn't expect that. Good sized room with very comfortable bed. Room was "tidied" pretty much every time we left the hotel, which was unexpected. Very friendly staff. Breakfast wasn't anything to shout about, but it was good enough. Good location right off one of the metro train lines at the Piazza Bernini. Just about any direction you walk you ran into amazing sights, shopping, and food. Couldn't have asked for a better value. I warn you against visiting in August, though, because it was so very hot. We are pretty tough travelers, but we still took a mid-day break each day to escape the heat. There is a reason the pope leaves Rome in August - it's HOT. Wireless internet is available for a reasonable fee. We were there for three days so made use of the 15 hours (cumulative, not consecutive) for 15 euros. It only charges you for the time you're online, and it was helpful for those last minute things you want to check into (how late is xyz open, what's the best way to get there, reviews for a restaurant you walked past, etc). Make sure to go to http://www.ilgelatodisancrispino.it/ (San Crispina Gelateria) as often as you can while there. Short walk, and the most amazing gelato you'll fine. Also, if you're going on a vatican tour we recommend www.7hillstours.it (7 Hills Tours).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobB20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Barocco for 2 nights. It was a really nice stay. The hotel is small, but very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was small but very nicely appointed and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was very good. The location of the hotel is quite nice and is within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The only negative was the curtain in the bathroom. It was very shear and we felt that people in the building across the street could look right in at night. Not a real big problem, though. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: Educator_9
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my first trip to Italy. Admittedly, we were nervous trusting the internet with our hotel reservation. The Hotel Barocco met our expectations. We would definitely return to Rome, Italy and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: aliciawash
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay in three different rooms, because of breaks in our stay in Rome. All rooms were very nice with wonderful beds and bathrooms, not what I have found in Europe in other locations. The first weekend we had a junior suite with a huge outdoor patio overlooking the Piazza Barberini on the 4th floor. Room was on the small side but bath and patio more than made up for it, Very private. Then we moved to another room in the main hotel for one night and that also was very nice and more spacious. When we returned to Rome later in the week we were in the Annex and this was also a very nice and spacious room, not good views but who needs views. Location is great! a short walk to the top of the Spanish steps, the US embassy and the Galleria Borghese.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great People”
Reviews.Author: GregO8
Reviews.Content: I rented a car coming back from southern Italy and was supposed to drop it off at the airport. I dropped the family off first and the hotel manager made a call, without me asking, to see if we could drop off the car at the train station which was a 10 minute walk versus a 1/2 hour drive and then the train back in. He had it arranged. Nice bar at night and breakfast in the morning. Ask for the new rooms up front as they have better air conditioning systems. We had 3 rooms and all were nice and spacious (for europe). My wife and our 5 kids loved the convenience of this hotel and the friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: worldtrekker5770
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my elderly parents to Rome. I perused many hotel websites before deciding on Hotel Barocco. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this magnificent boutique hotel in all respects. It's small, quiet ambiance was perfect to return to after a day of sightseeing. The location was centrally located for historical sites, restaurants and shopping. The staff were extremely warm and helpful. A daily breakfast was included, complete with full table linens and the best coffee! While the rooms were small, we found them to be more than adequate in comfort (I'm ready to buy a new mattress because of them!). The room decor and facilities were beautiful. I highly recommend Hotel Barocco to anyone who plans to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: andreaponte
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Barocco. The location is wonderful, close to everything (Piazza di Spagna, Piazza Napoli, Palazzo Barberini, etc.) with taxi rank in front and subway on the side. The staff was very friendly, giving information and helping with everything we needed. The rooms are also very good. We had read in other reviews tha the rooms are too small, BUT IT IS NOT TRUE. The bathroom is very big. Everything was perfect. The next time we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot to pick on here, all-around great stay!”
Reviews.Author: BeeNYC_10
Reviews.Content: *Great location *Great rooms: beds, cleanliness, quiet, A/C *Very good breakfast *Very nice and helpful staff *While I would stay here again, rooms are not cheap. Fully priced, I would say.

Reviews.Title: “Greate country, greate city, greate hotel, greate stay”
Reviews.Author: poikka
Reviews.Content: Quite, conveniently placed hotel with comfortable rooms, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ValcheAurora_Ontario
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were given a room that had just had the carpets shampooed.. However, the smell of the cleaner and the fact that the carpet was still very wet did not go over well with my husband and I. Cristiano was at the front desk and was more than willing to have our room swtiched after checking a few other superior rooms I found the same problem with the carpets so was getting a little upset thinking I would have to spend the night smelling chemical clearner. After telling Cristiano that the other rooms were in the same condition he moved us to a suite for 2 of the 4 nights we had booked at no additional charge.. How is that for service? Very freindly staff, good location will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. Don't hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “A great, nice hotel to recommend to any of my”
Reviews.Author: ciudareal
Reviews.Content: A nice positive surprise in agraet location, great bedroom at a modernised instalaltions, nice breakgfast and easy by all the service ,polite service. Of course to recommend to any close friends

Reviews.Title: “Our memorable Roman holiday due in no small way to our stay at Barocco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CactusPete14
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Borocco Hotel.. The room was clean, very tastefully furnished with a comfortable bed. The amenities were luxurious. Our room looked out over Piazza Barberini which was an added treat. The breakfast was fabulous with almost too much to choose from. The staff ffrom the front desk to the food and beverage area to housekeeping could not have been more accomodating. We also took advantage of the hotel staff's offer to arrange transportation for us from the airport. The location was in walking distance to several fine restaurants and near the metro which we used several time. Complaint? Well, we wished that all hotels in Europe provided a fully enclosed shower! We managed to adjust and are pleased that we followed a relative's suggestion and stayed at the Barocco Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler280
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior room at Barocco which gave us ample space for ourselves and 2 suitcases during our 3 day stay. The room had an area with a desk and two large closets. The bathroom area also had ample space and was modern in all aspects. During our stay temperatures were in the mid 80'sF but the hotel air con worked very well. The hotel location is very good, within comfortable walking distance to Gallery Borghese, Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain. The hotel is on Piazza Barberini which is also one of the stops for the Hop On Hop Off buses which is very convenient. Breakfast was good and if you are one who needs to have a large breakfast you can order from the kitchen. Staff were very helpful when we sought directions and other information. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations were of great help to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: arejaysee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this establishment four years ago, and was thoroughly impressed with it at the time. This year, I was not so sure what to expect, as the hotel underwent some renovations not too long ago. As it turned out, my stay this year exceeded my expectations, as the renovations were of great help to this hotel! The rooms continue to be comfortable and reasonably priced. As well, the establishment is in a very good location in central Rome, close to a station of the Rome Metro as well as the famed Via Veneto. Furthermore, the hotel staff were of great help during my stay. I will certainly stay there again on a future visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel with fabulous staff, old-world feel and beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: UrbanAreaNettie14
Reviews.Content: Although located on a busy traffic roundabout (circling Bernini's Triton Fountain, no less) our room with serene and cool with a fabulous view of Bernini's masterpiece. The underground entrance and ATM are just across the piazza, and the staff are remarkably accommodating. Much of Renaissance Rome is within walking distance, including the Piazza Navona, the Trevi Fountain, Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish Steps. The staff are ready with maps and directions for your every departure and can schedule guides by the hour for you or your group. Breakfast is beautiful, and the bar is a welcome evening respite!

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: wellsey60
Reviews.Content: We Had booked this hotel online and Were not really sure what to expect from the photos . When We Arrived We Were Pleasantly surprised , the rooms were bigger than what We Had previously stayed at in Rome and were very nice. The location is excellent , 5 min walk to the Spanish steps and other tourists attractions . Great place with a nice breakfast thrown in . Would stay there for sure agian .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient,clean and the employees really try”
Reviews.Author: genebeans
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews on Trip Advisor we stayed here for two nights with three rooms and our young family with our grandchildren. Breakfast was fine and the rooms are very clean and the location was safe and convenient. I would recommend that anyone rent the junior suite as the ohter rooms are kind of small-We had a superior double and after spending ten days in Italy before arriving here it seemed too small for our luggage etc however it worked out very well. Bathrooms are re-done and fine. Beds are typically hard and comfortable. I would recommend this to a couple with no more than one child and it will be a good value

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located near the Spanish steps with very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: zursto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barocco for the first few nights of our honeymoon in Italy. We paid to have a car pick us up at the airport which was very reasonably priced. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. There was always someone at the front desk who could speak English. They gave us good recommendations for restaurants, train service, taxis, etc. The hotel is conveniently located about 2 blocks from the Spanish Steps which was why we elected to stay there. I had formerly stayed at the Bernini Bristol on a different trip but we decided to save some money by staying at Barocco. The location is great. The only negative would be the size of the rooms. The bedroom is very small although that is typical for a Roman hotel room. The adjoining bathroom, however, was very good sized. Also, they recently completed a renovation so that the entire room and bathroom was newly painted with new windows, bedding, fixtures, furniture. It was very well done. Our room was located above the reception area by a very busy street and we were wary about the noise level. The new windows, however, were effective in keeping out any noise. We slept comfortably every night we stayed there. Their complimentary breakfast was very good and we rated it the best breakfast of the 4 hotels we stayed at while in Italy. Overall, the hotel met our needs, was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful even though the rooms were small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean rooms, very good location”
Reviews.Author: suburb123
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel, it was clean and the room was quite nice. The location is very nice, about 5-8 minutes walk to the Trevi fountain area, about 10 minutes or so from Spanish steps. Even though its on the main street, it's not noisy at all. Polite staff. They don't have iron/ironing table in the room so I had to ask for one. Had to return it after using it right away so that was the only inconvenient point. But otherwise, a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “charming and great locale”
Reviews.Author: jimaut
Reviews.Content: Stayed her on the Honeymoon...the hotel is newly renovated and very nicely laid out. On a side street in a super location the service and quality of breakfeast food made for an excellent 3 days. They also were super at suggesting places to eat and set us up with a private tour guide for the Sistene Chapel. The elevator and certain areas of the hotel are small and tight, but not uncommon for Europe. The street is quiet and other than some hallway noise we did not hear a peep. Also, it sits on Plaza Barbenini a charming place to grab a drink and hit the metro station if you need to move to another area in Rome. Restaurants they recomended that were excellent and not to expensive were Santa Lucia, Perluigi, and Babette...all GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel experience on every level!”
Reviews.Author: Margo L
Reviews.Content: We began and ended our 2 week 30 year wedding anniversary trip at Hotel Barocco. We asked for a driver from the hotel to pick us up at the airport, which was wonderful after flying all night, and he was waiting for us outside the terminal with our names on a sign. From the moment we walked through the door of Hotel Barocco we were warmly welcomed and well-taken care of. Our room was not ready, so they brought us coffee and fruit in the sitting room by the front desk. It was raining, so after the coffee, they gave us an umbrella to take a walk while the room was being cleaned. The hotel location is wonderful. Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps just 5-10 minute walk away. Our room, #49, was exquisite! Loved it! Had a balcony overlooking Bernini Square and fountain. Extremely comfortable bed, nicest bathroom we had on entire trip (4 hotels). Fruit plate was in the room for us. Beautifully decorated. We spent 4 nights, and each morning we really looked forward to breakfast! Lovely, delicious. Perfect service. Excellent coffee and made-to-order omelettes. Fabio at front desk was delightful and professional. He took excellent care of us and was very helpful with every request and question. If you are Catholic, there is an English speaking Mass on Sunday mornings at 9 a.m. just a 5 minute walk away at Saint Susanna. It was beautiful, both the church and the Mass. Our last night, we returned to Hotel Barocco to be close to the airport. Again, warm and welcoming staff. Fabio was again kind and charming. The servers at breakfast all stopped by our table to chat and say good bye, and wish us safe travels. We had a driver from the hotel take us to the airport the next day. He was also very kind, answering our questions and sharing his knowledge of sights we passed along the way. A perfect beginning and end to a perfect Italy experience. I highly recommend Hotel Barocco.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Lynnette
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Barocco in May 2010. They have recently re-opened after doing some upgrading. The new decor is modern and lovely. Our room was a very small, but this is not a big deal for us (it was also oddly shaped with the walls slightly misaligned- this was nicely disguised with mirrors and most folks would likely never notice it). The bed was the most comfortable one we slept on in Italy and my husband thinks it was more comfortable than our bed at home! The bathroom was a little hit or miss.
