Great shower, fancy basin sink, but no where to put toiletries. Also there was apparently some sort of leak I think., When we check in I noticed the carpet around the door to the bathroom was damp. After our showers the next day the capret was very wet, despite the fact that there was no water on the floor and the shower door had been tightly closed. Not sure what that was about. The location of the hotel is great- very close to Metro and many things to see and do (be sure and hit the Capuchin Crypt right down the street- wild stuff!). One word of advice to the owners- your internet access is grossly overpriced- 5 euro for 30 minutes is outrageous. We wanted to check our flight info but didn't because of the outrageous price. We wish we had- we got to the airport to discover that our flight was 7 hours delayed and we could have slept in and spent the afternoon in Rome instead of sitting around the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and staff!”
Reviews.Author: stuvt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights in Rome at this hotel. The hotel is situated perfectly for walking to all the major sites except maybe the Vatican which we decided to take a cab. The front desk has a good free map to guide you to everything. Walking around can be intimidating at first, but once you get acclimated it is easy. The Barberini square, where the hotel is located, has a taxi pickup a few steps away where you can easily catch a cab. The hotel is "hidden" on a side street from the square, but once inside you can tell it has been remodeled. Everything looks new and clean. Typical small European room but modern. TV has a few English speaking news channels to keep up on current events. The only complaint is our bathroom didn't have enough lighting at the vanity, but we managed by opening the shutters. The hotel has a laptop you can rent to check in your plane tickets or check email too. The breakfast was wonderful with a variety of simple breakfast foods, juices, and water. Try the red orange juice. Coffee and made to order eggs can be ordered through the staff. The staff took great care in making sure everything was replinished. When we went to the Vatican a young man immediately approached me when I got out of the taxi to sell me a tour. We were hesitant at first, but agreed. It was great. 40 Euros each let us bypass the HUGE line. We had an English speaking guide and each of us received an Ipod type listening device so everyone in the group could hear him. Finally, the hotel arranged a car service to take us to the airport. 50 Euros in a nice Mercedes. A taxi costs 40. And to top it off, the front desk manager came outside before we left and wished me a Happy B-day when my wife and I had forgot. Great ending to fine trip.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again on my next return to Rome”
Reviews.Author: mikev108
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Rome for 4 nights as the 1st stop on a 4-city tour of Northern Italy. We planned on seeing a lot, but at a very leisurely pace -- not a strict agenda. The Hotel Barocco was the ideal home base for us in Rome. It was our first hotel in Italy so we were pleasantly surprised to arrive to a friendly, welcoming staff who spoke perfect English and was very helpful - providing a map and pointing out the key sights nearby and watching our luggage until we were able to check in, since we arrived so early. The hotel is conveniently located in Piazza Barberini, close to many great sights. 5 mins to the Pantheon, 5 mins to the Trevi fountain, 15 minutes to the Spanish Steps, 15 minutes to Piazza Venezia, give or take...I'm not even sure. My wife and I had originally anticipated taking buses or cabs from our hotel to certain sights that seemed pretty far when looking at a map. Maybe it was because we were so excited to be there and so amazed by everything we were seeing, but we found ourselves walking everywhere. We walked as far as north as Piazza del Popolo along the Via del Corso, as far south as Trajan's market, and as far West as Piazza Navona. We never once stopped to realize how much ground we were covering. The hotel is a short block from Via Veneto and and nice stroll up it takes you to the old city walls and Villa Borghese (10 mins, tops). It all felt like it was right next door. When we walked as far as Piazza del Popolo and realized it was going to be a hike back, we jumped right on the subway and it took us right back to our hotel. We went to mass at Saint Peter's Sunday AM via the subway and it was as simple as can be. The subway stop is steps away from the front door where Via Veneto meets Piazza Barberini. The bus stop is a few steps in the opposite direction - which took us down to the Colosseum, right in the heart of Ancient Rome. So as far as location goes, for us, it was ideal. Although we didnt use it, the train station (Termini) was a few blocks away. The staff couldn't have been nicer. Thankfully, we didnt need to rely on them for any emergency situations since everything went very smoothly, but the few times we had to correspond with them was very pleasant. We stayed in the Junior Sweet which was lovely. 2 rooms seperated by pocket doors. Enter into the first room with a walk in closet, long desk, pullout coach, and large window overlooking the Bernini fountain in the center of the Piazza. The second room has a King bed with another window looking over the piazza, and a large marble bath. The shower, albeit small (i am a large person) was extremely nice with both a handheld shower head above, and optional jets on the side. By far, the best bathroom epxerience I have ever had in Europe. I have never stayed in a 5-star hotel, though. 2 countertops with mirrors made it easy and efficient for both my wife and I to get ready at once. Also worth noting, the room TRULY IS SOUNDPROOF. I cannot vouch for the internal walls, but with both interal and external windows shut, you could not hear ANY of the outside noise. Especially considering its a major Piazza and there is a lot of vehicular and pedestrian traffic, I was Truly amazed how quiet the room was. The ONLY negative thing I can say about the room itself was although I had the air as low as it could go, it never got really cold. I like my room cold regardless of the time of year. Ironically, of our 4 hotels in Italy, this was by far the nicest, and turned out to be the cheapest. Maybe we got lucky? The only thing I can imagine that people MIGHT complain about, which made no difference to me, was the entrance to the hotel is on a narrow sidestreet so when you step out of the door, you dont have much room before you are right in the middle of traffic. It's iiterally no big deal, but I bet some picky people might complain. The included breakfast was one of the most extensive in all of our 4 hotels as well. It was the only one that asked every time we sat down if we wanted eggs. I really enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay there again if I am ever fortunate enough to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGyrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and were very happy. We would definitely stay here again. The hotel's LOCATION is great. We were able to walk everywhere we went -- from the Trevi Fountain, to the Coliseum, to the Vatican. Wonderful location! In addition to the great location, the hotel was very clean and stylish. It felt like a 4 star hotel. The breakfast buffet was quite good (breads, meats, cheeses, egg creations). The staff was friendly and helpful (good restaurant suggestions). They had wireless internet, but it was not free, which was unfortunate. We would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value and nice accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: joytrek
Reviews.Content: Very convenient and close to Metro. Nice clean rooms with comfortable beds. Newly remodeled so everything has a great feel. Nice staff that are willing to help and are accommodating. Breakfast included eggs made to order, bacon, fruits, juices, coffee and many other self serve items; every aspect of breakfast was good. I would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: ColinAllinson
Reviews.Content: Mostly good points :- - Beds extremely comfortable - Very convenient central location - Newly refurbished in a traditional style - Very friendly and helpful staff - Very good double glazing that cut outside noise to a low hum - Large, well decorated and fitted bathroom (room 22) - Good breakfast with the addition of eggs and/or bacon on request - Small but pleasant bar and public rooms Some small negatives - With the exception of our bathroom, everything was small - although high ceilings and extensive use of large mirrors helped to make it feel more spacious. The first 4 couples at breakfast sat in the breakfast room and the rest in one of the 2 overflow rooms by the bar. The reception was small but well presented once you got past the fact that the main entrance was a fairly unprepossessing doorway in a side street. - There was a lack of information readily available. The concierge was on duty 24hrs and very friendly / knowledgeable. I am sure that any questions could be answered - if you knew what to ask. It is just that there was nothing available to browse. Overall, despite a couple of minor reservations, we found it a very comfortable, pleasant and convenient place to stay. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrollKent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Barocco from 4th till 8th of April. We wanted a Hotel central to the cultural areas and chose the Barocco based on reviews on Trip Advisor. We had a pre-booked Limo service from the airport and the driver dropped us directly at the front door, so no problems finding the Hotel. The staff from check-in to check out were really helpful. We were given introductory tour guides, maps and a general overview to the local "must-see" sites on arrival by the concierge, which was very good. We also booked the Vatican and St.Peters Tour through the concierge and that Tour went flawlessly, with a direct pick-up from the Hotel Reception the following morning. The room was small but very clean, and the good sized bathroom was spotless, with a good shower and a decent hairdryer. There was limited space for clothes, with only one small wardrobe and no drawer space for clothing, so we ended up living out of our suitcases, but apart from the lack of storage space we had no other issues. The bed was very comfortable and it appeared that the sheets were changed daily. The breakfast was good, with eggs to order and plenty of choice. A good start to a long day of sightseeing. The Hotel is central for sightseeing or shopping, with the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain only a few blocks away. The metro stop is in the square which was handy for the colosseum visit. The main shopping streets of Via Del Corso (and side streets), Via Dei Condotti and Via Nazionale are also an easy walk from the Hotel. All in all an ideal base for a Rome trip. We had a late afternoon pick-up for the flight home, but the concierge put our suitcases in storage after check-out so we could enjoy the remainder of our last day getting in some last minute shopping. Overall a great little hotel in a perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: CaliTraveler07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March. It was our first time in Europe, and I was nervous because this was to be a whole new experience for my husband and I. The staff at Barocco, specifically Christiano, were very friendly, and more than willing to help us with everything from transportation from the airport to our hotel, to figuring out the best way to get around and where to go. The hotel was clean, room bathrooms were elegant, and hotel was well located within walking distance to Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The breakfast was simple, but good, and the staff were very friendly and happy to meet any of our requests. The area was great-- lots of eateries, a hop on hop off stop nearby (although we learned the metro system fairly quickly which meant we saved quite a bit of money.) , taxis nearby. The only negative was that the bed was not very comfortable, and the sheets were very stiff. I noticed that the first night we slept there, but by the second night, it didn't matter too much to me because I was so tired from all of the sight seeing. The price was a bit high for the time of year, and considering we paid half that in some of the other cities where we stayed in 4 star hotels. But, overall, I would say the selling point for this hotel is the customer service, the cleanliness of the room, and the location. I would stay here again. It is definitely a hidden gem, as you cannot see it from the main street. Also, their wireless internet did not work for us, but we were able to connect to another unsecured network...

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Choice”
Reviews.Author: mdrrar
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Barocco is in a great location. It is just off Piazza Barberini and a short block from the Barberini Metro stop. It was a 5-6 block walk to the Spanish Steps and maybe just a little longer to the Trevi Fountain. It had just opened after remodeling. We had a Superior Room which was very nicely appointed but a bit cramped. It was difficult to find space for our two suitcases. The bathroom had a shower and was very large and nicely done. The only real complaint was that the in room safe did not work. (it only needed the batteries put in) and I was assured that it would be attended to by the next day. It was not. The breakfast was wonderful. It had a large selection of pastries, cold cuts, cheeses and fruits. All of excellant quality. In additon, one could get scrambled eggs and bacon. The staff was always courteous and spoke English well and were more than willing to help me with my poor Italian. There was wifi available at an additional cost. It worked very well. If we return to Rome and elect to stay in this area, we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating, Excellent Staff and Great Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: tapat65
Reviews.Content: When we booked our hotel we based our choice on Trip Advisor reviews. We were hoping that we were not being mislead. WE WERE NOT! Our stay at Hotel Barocco was wonderful!!! The staff is very accommodating and assisted us with dinner reservations, tour reservations, and any other request we had. The hotel decor is beautiful and the rooms are very nice. On Christmas Eve, the hotel staff left a small gift in our room wishing us a Merry Christmas. What a treat! Part of our family stayed in the main hotel and part stayed in the Annex. We were a bit leery of the annex before we arrived, but do not be, the rooms in the annex are great. Our family definitely recommends Hotel Barocco and we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The helpful staff, excellent service, and location of the hotel will make your stay in Rome a memorable one!”
Reviews.Author: mel1035
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Barocco in Rome, Italy the last week of October 2009 for our honeymoon. The hotel in the Piazza Barberini. It does not have a grand entrance so is hard to see from the street. You actually have to go down the side street to go into the hotel’s entrance. Once inside, there was a large arrangement of fresh flowers that made the lobby smell wonderful. The lobby is small and the elevator even smaller. I was a little worried getting on it being it barely holds 3 people with luggage, but we didn’t get stuck. The positive: We had the honeymoon package, so we stayed in a junior suite. It was a very nice room. There were a dozen long stemmed red roses in our room when we arrived, which added a nice romantic feel to the sitting area. There was also fresh fruit set out in our room daily. Our balcony was huge and had a wonderful view of the square. The rooms next to us had a wall around most of their balcony, so we were fortunate to be able to look out over the square. The room was fairly quiet. You could hear some of the street noise outside, but if you closed the outside shutters of the windows, it was not bothersome at all. The hotel staff was very friendly and spoke very good English. Each concierge was able to assist us in recommendations for a place to eat and in directions to get there or anywhere else in the city. Their recommendations were always excellent choices for the types of places we wanted to eat. If you need an iron and ironing board the hotel will bring you one on request, but it does not stay in the room. Anytime we had a request (like needing a converter plug, the iron, etc.) the hotel staff would have it to our room within five minutes. I was very impressed with the service. Unfortunately we only got to eat breakfast one morning our entire stay due to leaving early for tours (and sleeping in), but it was very good and the food was fresh (eggs, thinly sliced bacon, cheeses, coffee cakes, etc). The location of the hotel was excellent. Most of the sites and good places to eat were a 5-10 minute walk. The Coliseum and Vatican would be a too far to walk, but the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, St. Mary’s Basilica, Fontana Trevi, and many others were well within walking distance. The hotel also has an airport transfer for Euro 50, which I would recommend using as it will be a private car with plenty of room (unlike the taxi’s that are small, compact cars). The hotel will arrange for the transfer. The hotel also arranges for taxis if you need one to go anywhere. All you have to do is let the front desk know 2-3 minutes before you’re ready to leave and the taxi will be there that quickly. The negative: The king bed was firm, but in doing reviews I read this seems to be typical in Rome. The bathroom is a little small by American standards, but was still nice. I would recommend taking your own hairdryer though as the one in the bathroom is not very powerful and takes a bit to warm up, so it took a while to dry my hair. The room has an “old” feel to it, but I liked it given that we were in Rome and I did not want to stay at a typical American hotel. The elevator was out of service about three times while we were there, but not for very long. I would also recommend taking your own converter plug. The hotel let us borrow theirs and it worked fine for charging the cameras, but when I tried to run my small portable fan that I brought with me, it blew out the converter and my fan. It was actually funny after the shock of it wore off! All-in-all, I would definitely recommend staying at the Hotel Barocco. The helpful staff, excellent service, and location of the hotel will make your stay in Rome a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Paynemg
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barocco turned out to be just the right location and price for seeing Rome. The staff were quite helpful (especially the front desk) and the breakfast staff were so friendly and polite. The room was clean, with high ceilings, lots of marble and a very comfortable huge bed (we stayed in "The Annex" which is an apartment building attached to Hotel Barocco). Our room (#50) was quiet but did not have an outside view (we knew that before we arrived). Everything the hotel told me in e-mails before our arrival was accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a short stay. Friendly. Nice change versus chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Barocco in Rome for just one night while in the city for work. It made a nice change from all the chain hotels that I usually stay in. Though not sure I would want to stay more than a night or two here. The hotel is in a good location right in the centre of things, but as the hotel is in an alley off the busy square (so can be hard to find!) it is very quiet. The staff are very helpful and friendly and speak excellent English, and so make visitors feel welcome. I was in the annex which is 2 doors down and up on the 1st floor. It seems that the block the annex in is an apartment block and they have a section of it that they have made into 4 or 5 rooms. The room was large and traditionally decorated with oil painting style pictures, big drapes and heavy dark furniture. It was classy. The bed is large but not that comfortable. The bathroom is huge with large bath and separate shower. Internet access is available by wireless but very expensive at 8 Euros for an hour! There is a small breakfast room with a fairly good spread on a buffet and staff that was helpful and fast. I did find the room a bit oppressive as there is one narrow window onto the back of other apartments and so spending time in the room would not be that great. The central heating was a bit oppressive as well as only very hot even at lowest level. Overall a very cost effective hotel with good prices, very clean and smart. But for me fine for a short stop, but would not like to stay longer as felt a bit oppressive but if using it as base for sightseeing or business then is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - clean, reasonable rates, excellent breakfast included,”
Reviews.Author: Bay-Tation
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days - great staff, a block from the Metro. Walking distance to the Tivoly Fountain, Spanish Steps, central location. Ended up extending one day and was upgraded to a suite at a lower rate than booked on hotel.com. I would recommend calling direct for the best rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: langeah
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. The hotel is on a side street off of a nearby plaza, so we never had an issues with noise in the room. Our room was in the annex building next door to the hotel. It was small, but comfortable with a great bed and the biggest bathroom I've ever seen in a European hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful - the concierge helped us find a good travel agent to book our train tickets so we could avoid the huge lines at the train station. And the complimentary breakfast was the best of our trip! The hotel's location is wonderful. There is a subway stop just around the corner, which made getting to the Vatican very easy, and almost everything else was in easy walking distance. We walked to the train station, Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, the Pantheon very easily. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel with B&B style - convenient to everything.”
Reviews.Author: AussieBEARandJR
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights (post cruise) here. This was our second trip to Italy and we were so pleased with this little hotel. Before we booked we looked at every hotel in Rome for days and days but always returned to the Barocco listing. The hotel's reception was very friendly with a nice young bellman who stored our luggage since we arrived 3 hours early. We went out for a walk to the Trevi Fountain and had lunch and we returned the bags were in our room. The concierge was helpful with all of our questions regarding buses, directions, pharmacy (I was sick one day) and other things. He prearranged our ticket reservation to the Borghese Gallery as well. Upon arrival we received a ticket for two complimentary drinks from the bar but did not use them until our last night. I wish we had gone to the bar earlier, as the nice young bartender had put out a small spread of finger foods and we spent a little while just chatting with him. The complimentary breakfast buffet was very nice and offered a good assortment of items to suit most tastes. All of the areas of the hotel were nicely decorated and quiet. The maid service was excellent including turn down service. Our room was small, which is common in Italy, but very clean. The bathroom was quite large with a tub (with shower) toilet and bidet. The location was everything with the Bernini Square & Fountain right across the street, Via Veneto around the corner and several shops and restaurants two minutes from the hotel. We walked to the Trevi Fountain, The top of the Spanish Steps, the Bottom of the Spanish Steps, The Pantheon and Piazza Navone with no trouble at all. We even walked all the way to the river and then to Trastavere one day and found that we could have walked to the Vatican if we had wanted to. The hotel was also within walking distance of the Borghese Park, but probably about 35-45 minutes. The only negative thing I could say about the hotel is that the entry had been moved from the main street (Tritone) to a little alleyway which made it a little harder to find and that the bathtub was very small (narrow). A large person would have a problem using the bathtub, but after 14 days of showers, we welcomed the bathtub. We stayed in room #11 which was a short flight of stairs (or you can use the elevator) from the lobby and the bar and breakfast room. The tall double windows opened on a little alleyway but it was nice to be able to open them from time to time for fresh air. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoContessa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated perfectly to walk to all of Rome's major attractions. The staff was wonderful, the room a little small but immaculate, and the breakfast was delicious. There was a huge selection of great restaurants within a block or two. We really loved our stay here. Great linens too!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: pj1021
Reviews.Content: Hotel beautiful, immaculate, great food and location - reception staff and bartender Nicola couldnt be more helpful - I would highly recommand this hotel to anyone and would go back again. Thank you again for a wonderful visit. Paula from NY

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near All The Sites”
Reviews.Author: carnval
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days at your hotel October 8th to the 11th it was more than we expected. Your location is just perfect, our room was great and your service was definitely top self. The breakfast was outstanding, a lot more then we imagined. On a scale of 1-10, I would rate your hotel a 10 in all categories. You’re definitely better than a 4 star rating. Thank you for making our stay in Rome a most pleasant experience, I would recommend your hotel to any of my friends who are planning a trip to Rome. Thank you, Carolyn & Valentine Bilcik Peekskill, NY

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location - Lovely Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carby2020
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between 17 and 22 October and found the location to be ideal for visiting all the tourist sites. Our room was no. 34 and directly overlooked the piazza. Although the piazza is busy the room was triple glazed and we had no difficulty sleeping at all. My only complaint would be that we could have done with more towels in the room. No doubt if I had asked I would have been given them as the staff were all polite and very helpful. As a handy tip when visiting Rome I would suggest having a couple of BITs in your pocket for easy travel (they only cost 1 Euro) and book to go to the papal audience on Wednesday mornings. The tickets can be uplifted from a church 5 minutes walk from the hotel on the Tuesday evening. When you attend the audience don't worry about getting to the front try to get your seat at the edge of the seated area as the pope is driven around the area and you get really close to him.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Trebleo
Reviews.Content: The Barocco is like having a little condo nestled into a big, quick-moving city. The rooms are nice, the breakfasts amazing, the staff very pleasant, and the bar a little haven to come back to after a long sightseeing day. The entrance is off the main street, tucked away and the rooms are so soundproof you can't hear a pin drop.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: shipoogirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Barocco for six nights in a double classic room. The bedroom had enough space for us, tastefully decorated, and the woodwork was beautiful. The dressing room and bathroom were located behind the bedroom, down a few steps, which made the room seem much bigger. Our room was on the 3rd floor on the side of an alley. When you looked out the window you could see the piazza and fountain. We did hear a little traffic noise, but it was pretty quiet at night and did not interfere with sleeping at all. Didn't hear people in rooms on either side of us. The AC worked fine for us, but in the summer months it might not cool the room down enough. Just move the drapes out of the way for the air to circulate. It did get quite cool during the night and I had to throw an extra blanket on the bed(husband likes a freezing room). The front desk staff/ breakfast room staff were fabulous!!!! We thought that the breakfast buffet had plenty to offer. Croissants, sweet rolls, small hard rolls, pastries, tortes, three types of meats, cheeses, bacon, scrambled eggs, fruit salad(always refilling) and yogurt. We had plenty to eat and variety was great. Front desk staff always gave us good info-on how to get to places, restaurant tips etc. Used a car service to get to airport when we were returning home. They arranged car and it was cheaper than car service I had set up to pick us up from airport to bring us to the hotel. Barrocco is close to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Bus stops are closeby, taxi's are across the Piazza and Metro is steps away. Hotel is also next to the Via Veneto with great restaurants and great evening strolling. We would stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a big bustling city”
Reviews.Author: viaggio_09
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two nights here after a week in Sicily. The hotel was very nice- well situated for walking to major attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They arranged a car and driver to take us to the airport - and it was better than a taxi (cost less, too). They also recommended a restaurant which we enjoyed. The breakfast buffet was the best we experienced in Italy (this was our second trip). Our room was very comfortable- 2 twin beds with lots of room. The woodworking is beautiful. I would have liked a slightly larger television. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Left immeditaley after checking in.”
Reviews.Author: moontraveller18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and Rome was our last stop. We checked into Hotel Barocco, walked up to our room on the 4th floor because the elevator was broken. We barely got into the room and knew that we had to find another place to stay. The room stunk of smoke, there were two ashtrays in the room, empty, but leaving obvious evidence that smokers had previously stayed in this room. The whole room felt moist of mold and uncleanliness. Being that I am allergic to mold, I could feel the tightness in my chest immediately. We took to the streets and found another hotel for our last 4 nights in Italy. I have stayed at a lot of hotels in Italy, many of them not being 4 stars, as this one claims to be. However, this was by far the worst hotel. I was extremely disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Will not return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GM-CalgaryAB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barocco Hotel nights of Sept. 17, 18, 19. Not much good to say about this hotel other than the staff - they are wonderful. But the rooms are in desperate need of upgrading. The carpets are old and mouldy, and the beds are very old - hard and uncomfortable. The rooms are very small, as well as the bathrooms. There was no airconditioning, so we kept our windows open during the night to get some air. What a mistake! We were eaten alive by mosquitoes coming in through the windows, and the noise was horrible. Of our 2 weeks through Italy, this was the worst hotel by far. Yes, the location is good, and the breakfast was also very good, but we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: isabella9207
Reviews.Content: It was in a good location, walking to the spanish steps where all the great shops are and people are always hanging out. you can probably walk to most places from here except for the vatican. only complaint was that the room smelled, well, the air conditioning smelled. we would turn it off in the morning and air out the room but they turn it back on before you get back to the room so it smelled anyway. I think there are better places to stay at...staff was really friendly/very helpful (i think that is with most hotels) but how great is that when you have a smelly room? it was clean except the bathroom did have a little tiny bit of mildew on the tiles. I'm very picky about clean bathrooms in hotels. In america, this would be a 2.5/3 star max. If location is your only reason for staying here, reconsider....you don't need to be that in the center of everything. it's a city with great public transportation and i think as long as you stay in the center, you'll be walking distance to most places. this area is safe though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bazbell
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this hotel from the moment we arrived. The staff were swift and efficient at sorting our rooms and transporting our bags to them. We stayed in the annex area, next to the main hotel and were impressed by the size of the rooms. The beds were firm, but certainly comfortable and all linens and towels were changed every day. The hotel is situated next to the metro and tour bus stops and thus is ideally situated for access to all parts of this compact city. Breakfast is a continental style, but there is plety there and the staff bring you more as soon as you request it. My only concern over this hotel is that is has many small steps between areas that could be difficult fo the disabled.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: First_time_in_Venice
Reviews.Content: I was there last week with my husband. We picked the hotel base don the good reviews (rank) vs price. The location is good, and convenient because of the subway. However, you will walk a lot in Rome, so a closer hotel could be better. The bed (mattress) is one of the worst I have ever slept in. My carpet at home is probably more comfy. The room is rather small, and they make it look smaller with all the furniture (desk I understand, but not the gigantic dresser). The breakfast is ok, but not great. The omelette didn't look good to us, so we stuck with ham, cheese, bread and yogurt. If you come early there are some pastries, but if you come later, they do not seem to get replenished. The staff was helpful to print the vatican passes and gave a us a good restaurant suggestion (santa lucia). There are little stes everywhere in this hotel which doesn't make it easy with luggage. Overall it's ok. We took the Leonardo express train from the airport to Rome and then the subway. This should have been fast, convenient and cheap, but the "express" train broke down, of course...

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great location, pleasant and efficient staff, super clean”
Reviews.Author: andreafromsacramento
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for six nights. We appreciated the charming appearance of the hotel, the extremely clean facility, pleasant staff, the breakfast buffet, the quiet comfortable room, (larger than we had expected) and great location. It is right on Piazza Barberini, a few steps to Via Veneto, a Metro stop, gelaterias and restaurants. There's tabacchi, a farmacia and bancomat across the piazza. There is a taxi stand right in the Piazza and taxis also a few paces away in front of the Hotel Bernini. We easily walked to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza del Poppolo, shopping on the Via Corso. We are walkers, so we also walked to Campo di Fiori, Pantheon and Piazza Navona and the Termini Station. The staff in the delightful breakfast room were very nice, as were the folks at the front desk. We appreciated the quiet room and the shuttle service to and from the airport (for a price). We definitely would stay here again and would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: btitle
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old grandson and I just returned from Rome and a terrific stay at the Hotel Barocco. The hotel was charming, fabulous location where we either walked or took buses and/or the metro all over Rome. The front desk staff was most helpful having a terrific knowledge of all the sights and which buses to take. The hotel was immaculate and the air conditioning most effective. The breakfast had a very good selection of items.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: KBMN
Reviews.Content: Location was very good, easy to walk, taxi or bus to most tourist sites. Rooms were VERY clean, comfortable and spacious. Staff was welcoming and helpful. Breakfast buffet was best we had while in Italy. Can't say enough good things about our stay. Would definitely stay again if ever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great staff and a nice place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DesiTrvler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Barocco this July. It's location is excellent. You can walk to Trevi, Spanish steps and Collosso (if you feel like it). Given that Rome's subway system is real simple (even for me) and all the historic spots are on Line A or Line B and Barocco is right outside Piazza Barbareni stop - makes it almost too easy to go anywhere. Without us being in this central location - would have been a challenge to cover the sights and sounds of rome in 11/2 days time. Hotel room was clean with nice marble floors. Since it is not a mega hotel - it has its own charm. The only times we ran into other guests were during breakfast in the morning. Breakfast is part of the price - and it was a pretty solid breakfast for you to begin your day. By default most Italian breakfast places don't give you real fruit - unless you explicitly ask for it (some info for the fruit lovers out there) Internet connection was disappointing - restricted to the small lounge area-but Rome was too busy even for me to be sitting in front of my computer. I unfortunately misplaced my phone during the stay - staff was courteous and sent me an email indicating that they found it and were willing to ship it to me. This is a great hotel to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barocco, very good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LesMary
Reviews.Content: INTRODUCTION: We stayed at Hotel Barocco in Piazza Barberini, Rome for 3 nights precruise, 7,8,9 June 2009. We had read good reviews of the hotel. RECEPTION: Upon arrival at 9am we were greeted by a friendly receptionist who gave us room keys as room was vailable, great, after a long 21 hours flight from Sydney, Australia. We were accommodated in the adjacent apartments just up the lane 20 metres from the actual hotel. THE ROOM: An old building but the room was reasonable spacious, well furnished, comfortable bed, desk, chair, airconditioned, very quiet, facing lane, heard no traffic from busy Piazza Barberini. Bathroom was fitted out in marble, toilet, bidet, shower, all good. Very satisfactory for a 3 night stop. THE HOTEL: Would call it a boutique hotel, around 20 rooms I suppose, well furnished, breakfast room nice, continental and hot breakfast included and unlimited cups of the best cappucino. Breakfast staff and hotel staff very obliging. Hotel is very well situated in Pizaa Barberini. Walk to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon etc. Plenty of restaurants nearby and corner shops. Some great walks around the hotel and found a couple of good reasonably priced trattorias in the lane where hotel was. The hop on, hop off bus also stopped outside hotel, we did that one day, great tour of the city. We paid around AU$300 a night for room and breakfast, booked through an on line travel agent in Australia, not cheap but nothing is cheap in Rome. CONCLUSION: A very good hotel in a very good location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, charming room in the "Annex" building. Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: WishIWasTravlngNow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barocco in late June, during our first trip to Italy. We stayed here based on a recommendation from a friend and we were not disappointed. Highlights: Fantastic Location: The location could not be more convenient, as it is located around the corner from the Metro stop at Piazza Barberini. (We took the train from the Rome airport to the metro station, hopped on the metro, and Piazza Barberini was the second stop - so easy!) Once we had our "Rome bearings" we also realized that we were within walking distance of tons of popular sights. (Spanish steps: 5 minutes; Trevi fountain: approx 5 minutes; Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Campo Di Fiori: 10 - 15 minutes). There was a bar/tabac around the corner, along with a small grocery store, and many places to eat nearby. Very Friendly and Helpful Staff: The staff at Barocco go out of their way to make you feel welcome and like no question or request is a problem. They were also helpful prior to our arrival by answering all of my email questions promptly and were extremely friendly and courteous when we had a bunch of "how do we find this place in Rome" questions upon arrival. Convenient: The breakfast that was included with the price of our stay was great and very convenient. Cereal, fruit, meat and several cheeses, eggs, bacon, patries, yogurt, juice, fruit, coffee or cappucino made to order. Beautiful and Spacious Room: We stayed in the Annex building (4 rooms available next door to the main hotel). The Annex rooms were added to Barocco in recent years, so the decor is a little different than the rest of the hotel, which we loved. (the website represents the room descriptions well). The room was more spacious than any room we stayed in during our 2 week trip to Italy and France, was very clean, and the bathroom was huge. The room was also very quiet. While in Rome, our favorite meal was across town in the Trastevere area at a wonderful pizzeria called Dar Poeta. One of the best meals on our trip and possibly some of the best pizza we have ever had. Located at Vicolo del Bologna 45, Trastevere, Rome. A little difficult to find, but don't give up!

Reviews.Title: “Good interiors but terribly loud”
Reviews.Author: EMa68
Reviews.Content: I found the room quite nice, very classic 50's decoration but noisy. I was facing the side street and felt like the buses were driving through my room until 1am when they stop. No double pane, shutters are purely decorative and cannot be shut. It is not possible to sleep until traffic stops. The personnel was polite, breakfast a little stingy in fresh products (poor orange juice). If only it was not that noisy, I could have considered coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but loud”
Reviews.Author: NCSUJB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights but two were not that great. If you are located anywhere near the street, even on the side street where we were, it is very very noisy!! Friday night was so bad we didn't get any sleep what so ever. Wasn't worth it to change rooms as we were leaving the next morning. The breakfast everyone is raving about was awful to us. Eggs were runny and cold and the yogurt came out of the cup like milk. We got there almost right when they put the stuff out so it shouldn't have been that bad. The staff was very nice throughout our whole visit so that was a plus. The hotel is in walking distance of everything. The only thing we took a metro to was St. Peter's and it was only 1 euro per person. The metro is very close to the hotel which was another plus. The maids do not understand what a "do not disturb" sign is either. We left this up a couple of times and each time we came back to our room we found that they had entered and clean anyway.

Reviews.Title: “good location, thats about it”
Reviews.Author: ob23
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel barocco at the end out a 3 week trip and while it was in a convenient location, probably would not be quick to recommend for the price. i had to use a few am ex points, and this was the best rated for the additional money i had to spend. if i had to actually pay the room rate without the points, it would be way overpriced. if you at all are sensitive to noise, this is not the place for you. while i totally understand we are in a large city (which i love), beyond the traffic, there was what we dubbed "crazy guy" in the piazza yelling at cars and making all sorts of odd noises. we first were given a room with a side window (not facing piazza barberini, but a side street). i thought it would be ok as i wear earplugs anyway but after being in the room for an hour or so, we determined that there was no way we would be able to tolerate the noise and asked if there were any other rooms available. the gentlemen at the front desk was very accomodating and did find us an interior room, albeit with twin beds, but by then we didnt' care. the room was huge compared to the first one and was very quite but pretty dark. i don't think housekeeping was very happy with us about moving and didn't really hide the fact. other than the front desk, i didn't find anyone that worked their to be very friendly. rooms could use an updating but the bathrooms were very nice. breakfast was good, plenty of the normal european fare. the hotel is very well located to any of the sites. just a quick stroll to spanish steps, pizza navona and trevi but we took a cab to st peters. we love rome, but for the posted rates, probably could find something a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Cat89Nj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, and the staff in the lobby were very helpful. Room was very nice and clean, and we did not hear any street noise with the windows closed. You can walk to most sites. Taxis are expensive in Rome. We took the metro to the Vatican (1 euro each way), and the lobby staff sold us the tickets. There was a metro stop right in the Piazza Barberini. The staff also recommended an excellent restaurant that was very close the Trattoria Trittone. It was the best food we had in Italy. The breakfast included scrambled eggs,excellent pastries, and very good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: lilbet48
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly placed in a beautiful part of the city, within walking distance of most of the sights,. The room was great, clean and comfortable, bathroom with bath, shower and bidet. Breakfast was excellent, loads of choice and the staff were helpful and very friendly, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, HIGH VALUE, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoSchwank
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Rome in late April - did all the tourist stuff from the Barocco as our base of operations. Every detail exceeded expectations. Staff was top-rate, professional and eager to serve. We upgraded from our base suite to balcony suite for twenty Euros/night - a great bargain, especially since we were "paying" for base room with American Express points. Good restaurants in vicinity and an excellent location just off Via Vittorio Veneto. This hotel is comprised of two adjoining buildings - has been expanded and upgraded recently - cleanliness and staff attention to detail were more than could have hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrosco
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to Rome and I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via Veneto, Via Conditti, the metro. There are many great restaurants steps from the hotel. The hotel is tucked down a small side street right off of Piazza Barberini and is very quiet. The staff was fantastic and very helpful. Our room was very generous especially by European standards. The breakfast buffet was filled with eggs, bacon, meats, cheeses, yogurt, pastries, etc. Great value, great hotel, nothing bad to speak of.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: ee001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location for a short break in Rome. It was easy to transfer from the airport by train and metro and then after that it was possible to walk to all the main attractions. The staff were all very friendly and our room on the 1st floor of the hotel was clean, spacious and very quiet. The selection at breakfast was very nice and the bar was a lovely place to sit for a quiet drink after a long day of sight seeing. The hotel does not have its own restaurant and the recommended restaurants were quite pricey, but there are plenty of good restaurants not far from the hotel - look out for Gusto Pizzeria which is located not far from the Spanish steps. This is not a luxury hotel, but it offers a great location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, good location”
Reviews.Author: Tinryland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really well located - once we had made our initial trip from the airport to the hotel, we literally walked everywhere else - until it was time to make the trip back to the airport. The hotel is really close to the metro (though we didn't use it). Staff on the front desk were very helpful, and spoke excellent English. While there is a lift in the hotel, there are quite a few internal steps/stairs, I wouldn't recommend it for older people. Our room was clean and we had plenty of space, nice large bathroom. The only issue was that the bathroom had a really bad smell - it was ok when we arrived but got progressively worse - the plumbing is not the best. The wireless internet didn't work in the room, but worked in the business centre in the lobby - bit annoying. We were in room 41, to the back of the hotel, not a good view but nice and quite. Breakfast was very good - plenty of food and very good coffee. Overall it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce VIta”
Reviews.Author: chriscaoili
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from March 9-16 2009 with my Sister in a two (2) standard twin comfortable bedded room on the Fifth Fl. in a very clean room, space for 2 people, classic deco, marble bathroom floor, modern facility, mini refrigerator, safe deposit box, large mirrors, enough closet space. tall windows with a sideview of Piazza Barberini. They have an elevator to the salon/bar for our free breakfast : fruits, yogurts, cheeses, croissant, italian bread, muffin,, Hot Bacon , omelette, coldcuts (salami, ham, prosciutto) with orange juice, mix juices . A Complete breakfast but the best Cappucino in town. It's -100 meters from the Metropolitan Barberini and Bus 492, 62 that can take you everywhere. Less than 10 minutes walk to Fountain of Youth (Trevi), Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Via Veneto. near Despar Grocery store for non tourist prices. We had Lunch at Tratorria Tritone and Il Giardino di Albino for a delicious Roman meals.and Perfect Focaccia, Pizza, Gelato at Squisito Cook across the street. There is a great deal on shoes (50% off) at ARALDO , 108 via del Tritone, as well as Benetton, Rinascente Mini Mall, Prada, Gucci, Louis Vuitton at Via Condotti. We booked the Pompeii, Naples Tour ( must-see and visit ) with Carrani Tours recommended by The Best Concierge; Cristiano, Fabio, Michele, they are always smiling, ready, know everything about Rome . The kind porter Ronaldo will help you with your luggage, any probems in your room. You will start the day lookingat the smiling faces of Simone and others at the Breakfast Room , walk down to Trevi Fountain to throw three (3) coins to wish to come back to the Hotel. excuse the wrong spelling.

Reviews.Title: “Not easy to please but...”
Reviews.Author: Jazzhound
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love to travel and have done so to a number of cities ranging from Vancouver, Canada to New York City and now Rome. One of the biggest worries is finding a decent hotel. Location and the hotel itself can make or break a trip. This hotel was checked out using Tripadvisor as well as other review sites and had good reviews. It turned out to be in a great location close to the metro and within walking distance to just about everything. It was great. Every morning started with two pots of Latte and breakfest (included) and then a day of adventure. We even took one day and flew on Ryan Air to venice for next to nothing spent the day and returned that evening. We had our favorite restaurants Pizza Re and The Monticito. Cheapest gelato was just up the street at the McDonalds beside the spanish steps. This hotel became an oasis in the middle of the dy when it was so hot and the staff were always friendly and helpful. We would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for families with small children”
Reviews.Author: TheRoamingIrish
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 2 night stay at Hotel Barocco and loved this hotel! The hotel is only steps away from the drop off point of several Hop on Hop off bus tours, a must with small children. We were able to check into our room early around 10am and the room overlooked the Piazza Barberini with 2 bathrooms, and a sitting area that converted to a pull out bed for our children. The bathrooms were very nice and clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly and we enjoyed the lovely bar area at night after our adventures out all day. The breakfast was a buffet and provided typical European meats, cheeses, and breads but also eggs, cereals, sweets, and yogurt that the kids could eat. After spending a lot of time researching hotels and location within the historic district of Rome, I was very satisfied with the hotel and it's charm. Finding wonderful hotel accomodations for 4 was very time consuming. We highly recommend this hotel and you cannot go wrong with the location. This hotel is a nice walk to the Spanish steps, Via Veneto is right around the corner (including the Hard Rock cafe), the shopping district, and the Trevi fountain. We also took a private tour the first day we arrived which helped us get a really good lay of the land. While expensive, it was worth it for a 4 hour private tour to areas that we would not have seen with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in great location”
Reviews.Author: berkjenn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a quick getaway to Rome and stayed at the Barocco for 4 nights. We found all of the staff overly accomodating and quite friendly. Our room #20 in the Annex was wonderful. Quiet, good size, comfortable and beautiful bathroom. The location is so convenient with the metro and bus stops right at the Piazza Barberini and not so crazy that you cannot cross ther street as in many other areas. The breakfast is consistently good. I would absolutely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kec_10
Reviews.Content: Surprise visit to Rome with my partner.The Hotel is in the perfect location , right opposite you will find the easy to use metro system that will whizz you around Rome , alternatively you will find a taxi rank in the piazza , also only a few minutes walk away you can visit the many wonders of Rome , the Pantheon , Trevi fountain and many other sights. The Hotel is clean , pleasantly decorated , small and intimate.The staff are friendly and very helpful and always willing to assist , before I visited Rome on this occasion I sent some emails and asked questions via the hotel web site , very helpful indeed. The breakfast , one of the best i have seen for a long time , a lot of variety and choice.and plenty of it for those with bigger appetites .I would definately recommend this hotel and i would definately book again when in Rome again... A perfect Valentines weekend we arrived with the sun shining and left with the sun setting , a wonderful , brilliant weekend..

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Georgeous12
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barocco is not a great hotel, but the location makes up for some of what it lacks. Its located on Piazza Barberini, which isn't a huge tourist attraction so there aren't large crowds at all hours, but it is a well known point of interest which makes it easy to find on any map. There is also a taxi stand in the Piazza which is extremely convenient. And its an easy walk to many of the sights, especially the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The hotel itself is a little dated. The rooms are small and the furniture and bedding are pretty worn. I like rooms with a little bit of character, but this room just felt neglected, nothing had been updated in years. My only true complaint is the antiquated carpet, it was so incredibly old and tattered that I hesitated to walk barefoot on it. However, the room was kept very clean and the bathrooms are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “very good place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: russoturisto_1971
Reviews.Content: location is close to ideal. very friendly staff. Cosy rooms, however, some of them have little bit strange lay-out. (It is connected with a complex design of directly house in which the hotel is located) Station of the underground - it is direct near an input in hotel. highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect combination of location, quality and service”
Reviews.Author: tanyaestela
Reviews.Content: This past November I made a great decision by taking advantage of the fall special offered by the Barocco hotel in Rome. The location was spectacular, piazza Barberini. Within the piazza you can walk to the metro. You can utilize the service of one of the 3 companies offering the hop on hop off service. Or you can simply walk, the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps and via Del corzo are all walking distance. The rooms were wonderful especially if you have a view of the piazza like I did. Remember folks European hotel rooms are a little smaller than USA ones but, boy was this little hotel room great. It had all the comforts of home and when I foolishly forgot my a/c adapter they kindly lent me one of theirs. The hotel lobby has 2 little living rooms with comfy chairs tables and even a plasma TV. Let’s talk breakfast, YUM OOOO. I was foolishly expecting pastries and coffee and what I found was, Eggs, ham , fresh tomatoes, Cappuccino, Fresh breads, fruit, juices . I recommend this hotel as a past guess but also as an experienced travel agent. The service was always friendly the room immaculately clean and plain old traveler ready.

Reviews.Title: “pretty decent choice”
Reviews.Author: Wolverine73
Reviews.Content: The hotel upgraded us to a suite, which was quite spacious (it even had an extra half bath) and overlooked the Piazza Barberini. This was a mixed blessing. Around 3:00 a.m. one morning, a group appeared outside the hotel blaring the Bee Gees "Stayin' Alive" from a CD in their car. This is no joke. They were persuaded to leave, but not before the song ended and we got into "Night Fever." It was somewhat surreal. That said, it wasn't the fault of the hotel, but underscores that you gamble with noise at this location. Unfortunately, we also had a major leak in the bathtub one day, which was fixed for the most part (the minor leak the next day was easily mopped up with a towel). Breakfasts were decent, but unspectacular. The location is a good one for catching the metro or walking to many of the attractions in Rome. Pretty decent selection given the options in this price range in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ThorstenManthey
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel and the staff is friendly! When I worked in Rome I stayed at this hotel for many week and it was a pleasure every day. It is a short walking distance to everything and very close to the metro. I would recomend this hotel for anyone staying in Rome for a longer period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely room”
Reviews.Author: LSPAberdeen_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Barocco on our first visit to Rome. On arrival at the hotel, the staff spoke excellent English and were able to advise us on the distance to all of the various sights, give restaurant recommendations and provide tour details. The hotel is walking distance from most of the major sights, we walked to the Colisseum, the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Palazzo Barberini and Trevi Fountain. The metro stop across from the hotel is only 4 stops (about 10 minutes) from the Vatican and all of the open top bus tours have a stop directly outside the hotel on the Piazza Barberini. We stayed in room 62, a superior room on the top floor of the old part of the hotel. The room was very spacious by continental European standards and had powerful air conditioning, tv, safe and plenty of storage space. The bathroom was smallish, with no bath only a shower but it was nicely decorated and the shower was quite powerful. Breakfast was really lovely, a nice continental choice and also a cooked option. We really enjoyed staying here and the location couldn't have been any better, it was quite expensive though - we booked through lastminute.com and paid £250 per night, no reflection on lastminute, they were the cheapest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Room”
Reviews.Author: ronigraham
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice...accomodating. Very helpful and spoke English, which was a plus! Convenient and safe! The only problem that we had while I was there was my pashmina (scarf) was taken by the cleaning staff. Hotel acted as if they were going to assist us with finding or replacing it, but I have not heard anything since. On the other hand, clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lonestar438
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Barocco for 5 nights this month. I booked it after I had read previous posts on Trip Advisor. The hotel lived up to our expectations. Staff was very helpful - breakfast was excellent - and our room/bathroom was very nice. We stayed in the attached building to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Shule
Reviews.Content: I spend three nights in Barocco in late July. Overall impression is great. The hotel is in perfect location. Reception staff very professional and efficient. Rooms are nice, comfortable, larger than in other European hotels I have visited. Everything is very clean and tidy, bathroom in marble with good water pressure. AC worked fine, which was nice since it was hot in Rome. Breakfast was OK, although nothing special and not exactly what I expect in a four star hotel. I was extremely satisfied with the hotel and would certainy recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaLo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Barocco for 3 nights in late June. We booked with lastminute and paid a bit extra for a classic room (vs standard room) in the Annex part of the hotel which is a group of rooms located in the fairly posh apartment block just next door to the hotel (<10 steps away). It's a nice old building with high ceilings - cooling in the very hot summer of Rome. As mention in previous review, entrance to the hotel is on the side street Via della Purificazione, not facing the Barberini Piaza. On arrival, we were greeted by the receptionist who sent a maid to lead us to our room and arrange a porter to deliver our suitcase very promptly. Our room was very clean and nicely decorated with touch of luxury - marble wall skirting, antique looking polished wooden furniture, mirror with golden frame, comfy bed (not to hard/soft), large marble bathroom with a hydro message tub. It has a view to the side street where the hotel entrance is on which I suppose is a bit more quite than those facing the square. Sound proofing is very adequate anyway. My only moan is that the aircon is a bit weak to my like but we left it on when we were out and it does the job to keep the room at a comfortable temperature. By the way, weak aircon seems to be a common issue in all the shops and restuarants. The staffs in the reception are always polite and helpful and certainly treat you like a welcomed guest. We were very impressed with the efficient housekeeping staffs as they meticulously clean and tidy up our room/bed every time we went out (once 3 times in a day during our stay). The good thing is that they keep a low profile and don't bother you when you are in the room, so you don't actually see them but the result of their work! Breakfast is served in a small but nicely decorated room on the first floor. A good continental affair with fruit, yoghurt, pastries, eggs, bacon, ham, cheese, juices. Tea/ coffee and cappuccino is always offered by the waitress and brought to your table. We cannot fault the hotel location. The metro stop Barberini (line A) is half a minute away. We used it very often as it's a too hot to walk to sights in this weather unless its early morning or later in the afternoon. But the distance to various sights would have been easily negotiable in cooler weather. Also the hotel is very well served by buses and the open top tourist buses stops right outside. The convenient location allow us to return to the hotel in the afternoon for a shower before heading out for dinner. Also a stroll to the Trevi fountain in the evening can be easily done. Another good aspect of the hotel is it's fairly small size. The service is personnel and there is no annoying tour groups/ students but independent travellers during our stay - Italian and foreigners alike. Overall, this is a very well run hotel with high standard that truely deserves its four star status. I would definately return on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 2blue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Barocco in May 2008 and were most impressed with the service and the breakfast. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a mini-suite with a full bath and another half bath. Both were wonderfully outfitted in marble. It turns out this brings up the only downside to our stay, our tub had a leak and would make a puddle on the floor. At first we just thought this was us not being careful with the shower curtain, so we didn't say anything until checkout. Other than this, the room and hotel were great. The location is good if you don't mind walking a bit or taking public transportation. There was also a taxi stand just across the piazza which was nice. The included breakfast had a wonderful variety of meats, cheeses, pastries, eggs, fresh blood orange juice, cereal and fruit. We always looked forward to starting our day here and all of this wonderful food would allow us to eat a light lunch on the go. Use the hotel to arrange their private car for your trip to the airport. We used this on our way out of town and we should have used it more. The car and driver were great.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favoite hotel stays”
Reviews.Author: lhcritter1974
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is right off Piazza Barberini. Also a short walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain and the Santa Maria della Vittoria (church where you can see Bernini Ecstasy of St. Teresa). The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful with directions or restaurants to go to. Our room was very nicely decorated, spacious and fully equiped with what we might need. Very clean, bathroom nicely stocked with shampoo, body wash etc. and I loved that it had a shower and a bath tub. It was also very quiet. The breakfast area was also very classy/elegant and the waitress was also very friendly and spoke different languages. The had juices, breads and an assortment of cheeses, meats and frest fruit. They also had yogurt and choices of cereal and also scrabbled eggs and bacon if you wanted something hot. They would bring you fresh coffee of your choice or hot tea. I would definitly come back and would recommend it to any one who is planning to go to Rome. Taxi's are also easily available near the Piazza in two places. This hotel truly made our trip more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again, but...”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid_Traveler13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, clean and in a good location. It's near a Metro stop and within walking distance of most of the good stuff. Also the tour buses stopped right outside. Be sure to visit the Cimitero Dei Cappuccini just around the corner. It's a church with an adjacent crypt FILLED with the ancient bones of former monks. In some cases the monks are mummified and stand, wearing their robes, in archways made of skulls and femurs. It's truly bizarre. The hotel might have been hard to find, had I not printed out a detailed description of how to find it. Plus, I asked someone. Breakfast was pretty good. The front desk people were very helpful in arranging tours and transportation to the airport for me. I would stay there again for all those reasons. But, the following are a few things that might play a part in *your* decision making: -I had a single room. In this case, it meant a single bed which I'm not used to. I felt like I was going to fall out if I rolled over. -no bath tub. TINY shower. -heated towel rack was not heated. -no robes -large fee for internet -housekeeping did NOT replenish toiletries and cups daily. I ran out of the cheap plastic cups and had to ask at the front desk for more. The front desk seemed hesitant to give me more, which I found strange. The cups are so cheap and brittle, that you need to be careful when unwrapping them from the plastic. They crack in half if they are squeezed. -I also ran out of shampoo. -There was another strange incident with housekeeping. The book I brought with me was missing one night. After much searching and accusations to the house keeping staff, and more searching, I found the book in the bedside table drawer. It was put there by the house keeping staff. I found that very strange. -The soap supplied by the hotel had a very unpleasant smell. It was the kind of smell that one might have if they never used soap at all. I could not use it. Bring your own soap! -the view was non existent. Most rooms will not have a good view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Barocco”
Reviews.Author: LLTTFNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Barocca apt. #10 next door, which faced the side street. Very quiet and clean. This place is in a great location. Look for the electro bus 116 around the corner to get around. The breakfast was good and the staff were great. I will stay here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “We Really Liked the Barocco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kypat
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel, also the staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room wasn't very large but it had all the room we needed. The bath amenities were very good and we loved the fruit, fresh flowers, robes & slippers that were there. We highly recommend this hotel. We also had a small refrigerator, no balcony or view but we only paid 260EU per night.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: TTBoy1789
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for my Honeymoon. The location was good, but the room was absolutely tiny for the rate of 330 Euros per night. I would recommend choosing a different hotel, "when in Rome". Troy

Reviews.Title: “The Barocco is Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Juantwo
Reviews.Content: Don't let the entrance fool you. This is a great little hotel in a perfect location. We were fortunate enough to get Room 43 which had a private terrace overlooking Piazza Barberini. Rooms are very well appointed and have a great amenities package. The staff is very helpful and the location around the corner from the Via Veneto is terrific. Easy walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. Have dinner at Ciao Bella around the corner. Expensive but excellent food and service. We would go back to Barocco and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lennythelion
Reviews.Content: Yes the location is excellent, ideal for walkers wanting to explore the streets of Rome or those who are happier to jump on the bus or the metro, but the hotel itself is certainly the business too. A good value 4 star hotel where the staff are very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are classical Italian (not modern minimalist) but clean and comfortable and adequate in size. Although there is a dining room for breakfast, there isn't a proper restaurant in the hotel - not a problem though as there are plenty of good eating places nearby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: camille7674
Reviews.Content: This hotel is has a great location, the rooms were nice, and the staff is extremely accommodating and helpful. Each night we asked for recommendations on eating out, and we always loved where they sent us. Also, we left some items behind in our room and the staff was able to locate what we lost and offered to send it to us back in the US for no cost. We will definitely stay at this hotel when we are back in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle206
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon in Hotel Barocco. in Rome. Hotel location is in Barberini Plaza which is the best for walking to all the touristic attractions in Rome place plus a very good location for the public transport ( subway station is 20 m away and busses too ) Our room was fabulous ( room nr. 43 ) with a great terrace and view to Barbertini statue. Services are incredible, very clean, everybody speaks English, excellent breakfast. We strongly recommend it . Bianca & Thomas

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic time”
Reviews.Author: LadyCockburn
Reviews.Content: A most fabulous experience at The Barocco Hotel, the staff were superb, the food wonderful and the suite was beatiful. the location was perfect for all the sites, plenty of buses and taxi but also easy walking distance to the wonderful places to visit. i loved the ice creams!!!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel=great stay”
Reviews.Author: jossuk
Reviews.Content: we took the mother and father in law here and our 5 year old there room could have been a little larger but the location was perfect we were no more then 10 minutes from the fountain, the spanish steps ,and the gardens the breakfast was ok kept the hunger pangs away till lunch (.the more reasonable priced restaurants turn left out of the hotel doors then left again theres so many small traditional ones to choose from )the staff could not have been more freindly and the hotel was spotlesly clean . we intend on going back to rome in september with our other children and no dought about it we would defenitly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooners5
Reviews.Content: From Liverpool England We stayed at the hotel from June 16th to 19th for our honeymoon. We have stayed in Rome before at a 3 star hotel and decided to go book a 4 star for our honeymoon. We looked at the reviews and decided that this would be the best hotel bearing in mind that it was alot more expensive that the other hotel we had stayed at. We were dissapointed mainly because of the noise and the lack of view from our room. We found it very difficult to sleep due to the traffic noise. The double glazing was totally inadequate. The staff were friendly and the room was clean but we did not feel that it was worth the extra costs. We would rather have stayed at the other hotel (Hotel Embassy) which was friendly, clean and very quiet. I was also disappointed because I booked well in advance of our stay as it was our honeymoon and asked for a room with a nice view but we could only see another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: geztek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barocco from 5th to 8th June 2007. The hotel is unprepossessing and its entrance is tucked away in a sidestreet. If you like big hotels with huge imposing lobbies and people in uniform, this isn't for you. However, if you like small, intimate, friendly hotels, read on. The staff on reception were very friendly when we arrived and made us feel most welcome and that friendliness and attentiveness remained throughout our stay. We were given Room 49, privately tucked away, and at first we thought it must be a mistake because it was a far better than average hotel room. Large, with a very big bed, balcony over oooking the sqaure and fountain, armchairs, flat screen TV, air conditioning and a jacuzzi in the bath. The room was attended to once during the day and again during the evening. It is not a large hotel with only 41 rooms and it was quiet both from inside and outside. The hotel overlooks Piazza Barberini, a busy square with a good deal of traffic, yet the double glazing kept traffic noise at bay. Breakfast was absolutely fine with a good array of bread, pastries and cakes, fresh fruit, yougurts, cold meats, cheese, cereal etc. Location was great - 5 minutes to the Spanish Steps, a few minutes more to Trevi and the Pantheon. In the three days we spent in Rome we did not use transport at all but walked absolutely everywhere and the Barocco is a good base for that. We recommend this hotel unreservedly and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mercboy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel largely because of good reviews in Tripadvisor. This time it let me down. This is a tiny old hotel. One smal and slow elevator, really small rooms. No desk or any kind of amenities. No desks, no gym, no restaurant. It is clean and the staff is helpful. The location is good as well. But this is 3 star max, and 200 euros a night is not justifiable for microrooms with a TV that can only be watched with a magnifying glass. I suggest you either pay more for something better or save money by going to a hotel of this level with more appropriate pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that good!”
Reviews.Author: BaxterG
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel we had read previous good reviews. Apparently, this is meant to be a 4 star hotel. It is definately not worthy of that rating. Bad points - small rooms - terrible breakfast - no toast, only sweet cerial, not much fruit - odour in room - aircon is placed underneath curtain and therefore not very effective - Bathroom tiles are mission brown - Decor is very old - Do not eat at the Trattoria the hotel staff recommend Good points - clean - staff mostly friendly - good location - close to spanish steps and shopping strip - close the a restuarant called - Olympia. Very nice. The other two restaurants in that street are also delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in Roe”
Reviews.Author: Taxideuontas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three day trip to Rome and I cannot say enough about the Barocco hotel. Excellent rooms, a very clean and comfortable hotel. So close to everything and the reception was very friendly and helpful. They helped me arrange a birthday surprise and had a birthday cake delivered in the room. Also made restaurant reservations for us before our arrival since I could not contact the hotel via email. The breakfast was very good and staff spoke english. Many thanks to everyone at Barocco hotel for a dream stay. Anna

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay again”
Reviews.Author: travelaid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Barocco Hotel during the weekend of 17 March when we were in Rome for the rugby.
