This was the second time we stayed in this hotel and once again we were not disappointed. Although somewhat unobstrusive, the Barocco is ideally situated at the Piazza Barberini, just round the corner from the Via Veneto and about 7 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps. The rooms are an adequate size and pleasantly furnished - and a great range of bathroom toiletries is supplied! Lovely breakfasts too! Everywhere is spotlessly clean. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this boutique hotel particularly for its location and the pleasant and helpful staff for whom nothing was too much trouble. It is best suited to couples or people travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Service, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: grace1908
Reviews.Content: Room #49, Junior Suite, large, super balcony, large bath. The room is the one feature on website with Green Stipe decor. Hotel is in a great location. We never heard a sound even through it is located on a busy street. The breakfast was superb. The staff is wonderful and friendly. The room is very large. We had a double for a few hours to shower upon arrival. This room was also nice, however much smaller with a small bath. Did have a small balcony overlooking the side street. My only complaint ,which is minor, terry robes need to be replace. I would definitely use this hotel again. I have pics of both rooms please email if you would like to see them.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Quest I
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay. The room we stayed in (#21) was really nice, comfortable, with a very large bathroom for European standards. The only thing I didn't like was the air conditioning didn't work very well. for some reason the room was hot. It was relatively cool out so i slept with the windows open, but, very noisy. I can see this could be a problem in the summertime, since it can get up to 90 degrees and high humidity. The front desk and other workers were wonderful, very helpful and friendly. They are especially friendly towards Americans because, under my observation, were the only ones who tipped the waiters. Breakfast was OK, not great, but, has a good variety of food and outstanding coffee. Location was amazing. you can walk almost anywhere. The one thing I was confused about before going, was the internet fees. It cost 8 euros per half hour, IF you rent their laptop. But, if you have your own laptop with wireless capability, you can purchase internet time through an outside company. 5 Euros for five hours, can't be beat and worked great. Overall, it was a wonderful experience, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “So lovely”
Reviews.Author: MommyinMA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in May 2006 with my Mother In-law and Sister In-law and 4 month old son. My 3 year old daughter stayed home with Daddy. I would definitely stay here again. We had two rooms in the "apartments" or annex building next door. We were picked up at the airport by a driver sent by the hotel. This was worth every penny! Entry is up a tiny alley so it's not well marked but, it was perfectly Italian! Check in was seamless in the typically small but, charming lobby. We then went next door into the apartment building where we had our own key to enter the building. Then we took the old elevator to our rooms. They were really just hotel rooms though I believe there are actual apartments in the same building lived in by locals. Both rooms were lovely. Roman, charming, clean. Bathroom was updated from others I've stayed in in Italy. Probably because this is the city and those were in the country. This is my second Italian vacation but not my last! My room had a portable crib set up for my baby without my asking for it. Breakfast was the usual faire found in Italy. Meats, cheeses, yogurts. The list is extensive. There were extras like eggs. Breakfast eggs are not the Italian thing. Not usually done well so I passed. But everything else was WONDERFUL!!! I could go on and on. Love it here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: ejs
Reviews.Content: We drove from Siena and were happy to find the drop for our Hertz rental was four blocks away off Via Veneto. I am glad I read reviews telling me the entrance is poorly marked off a side street that looks like an alley or I would have missed it, turn right where Via Veneto ends, next little alley turn right and 2nd door. We had room 49 and you have to walk up a separate staircase to get to the room so if walking is a problem get a different room. This was our choice as this is a big room with a balcony. You get some road noise but we were staying out late and counting on the noise to get us up for the great breakfast that is a real meal and a high point of this hotel. The internet was expensive, 8 euro for an hour on their laptop, so I went to the internet cafe across from the Hotel Bernini just up the side street on the far side, you can see it from the hotel. They also downloaded the photos of my digital camera to a CD. The cafe just past the internet cafe is a good deal and nice, much cheaper than the Via Veneto restaurants. Went to the top of the Hotel Bernini, walk thru lobby, go into bar on the left and there is an elevator at the back that takes you to the top to check out the view. Everyone said it was real expensive but they had dinner specials for 38 euro and if you liked the special, the view is worth it. Check it out. I didn't think the front desk tried hard enough, the map they gave me was lousy, got lost a lot the first two days. As you walk out to the front, go right and everyday walk the four blocks to the Trevi fountain, then Pantheon, then Piazza Novana, the Piazza di Fiori. The tomb of the unknown soldier gives you the landmark, figure out where Via del Corso intersects with Victor Emmuel. Walk and take a cab back. To go to Spanish steps, go out and take a right and a right at the first street and you run into it. As is said you can walk from here to most everywhere. We walked to the Colessum, Vatican, and when we got tired just took a cab back. If you take this street uphill away from the Spanish steps you will go to the Berbini museum and keep walking to get to the Presidents house and the back way to the forum. I liked the location, the breakfast, very nice hotel. The Piazza Berbini is crowded, I am glad I stayed here but next time I would stay in a quieter area (not Via Veneto) hopefully with a view of a monument. Now that I am thinking of everywhere I walked from this hotel, if you go up the block from the internet cafe you will be able to walk to the train station. Also walked back from the Borghese Gallery thru the park which was my favorite museum. Wife would not get on any subway or bus which you can access from this hotel, but the cab stand is by the Hotel Berbini on this Piazza. I used that hotel as a landmark to find my way home several nights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Ronmedo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barocco Hotel for three days and it was a lovely. The room was small but extremely clean, beds were turned down every night for that extra touch. The bathroom was a good size and also very clean. The staff at the hotel were very accommodating and helpful. They helped us book tours, arranged for us to get tickets for an opera and suggested good restaurants in the area. The breakfast was good. They offered an assortment of foods from eggs to cereals and a variety of fruits and yogurts, pastries etc. You had a choice of coffee, cappuchino or tea and a choice of various juices. I highly recommend the Barocco. It is conveniently located and within walking distance to all the sights, restaurants and shopping. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: BetsyMoir
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I had stayed in Rome. so we acepted what was said in the on line information. Thedescritptionm was accurate 1) Welcome. As we were tired the first might we opted for the simple bar meal plus a bottle of wine. Both very enjoyable 2) Room was clean and comfortable with plenty of wardrobe space even for 2 women who always take too many clothes 3) Soon found that we were within walking distance of all the main attractions 4) When we came back footsore and weary we were able to rest comfortably and go out for a meal in one of the excellent nearby restuarants 5) 2 days before we were due to leave I tripped up on my way to the Vatican. By the next morning it was fairly obvious that I had done more than strain my foot. The hotel staff were all very helpful in getting me an appropriate doctor and made life as easy as possible for me for the rest of the stay, contacting the airline to ensure that I had a wheelchair when I arrived at the airport. They did exactly what we needed in a calm and efficient manner 6) It is the first time in my life that the waitresses in the excelelnt breakfast room and the people who cleaned our room and for whom we had left a tip, actually came and thanked us and wished us well on our ongoing journey 7) Only thing left for me is to go back to Rome and see the things that I could not see in those last three days

Reviews.Title: “A delightful oasis in busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: LindaSF
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Barocco was a wonderful experience. It is warm, friendly, and inviting. My single room was small, but I've stayed in smaller rooms in New York, and I didn't spend much time in there. It was pleasantly decorated. I had asked for a quiet room, after reading reviews of noise in Rome. I got a room in the back, which was completely silent. When I travel by myself, I like to stay in smaller hotels. I find them more friendly and wlecoming. The Barocco was certainly all that. The public rooms were all cheery and inviting. Often, between my day's activities and dinner, I would sit with a book in the salon/bar and read. Other guests were very friendly. I always felt as though I was coming home when I reached the Piazza Barberini. The breakfast room was beautiful and the servers were all very friendly and accommodating. For people who choose their hotels based on the breakfast, it was all one could ask for. The staff members of the hotel were all warm, friendly, and helpful. For example, I had printed off the train schedule from Rome to Sorrento, but the concierge told me that it wasn't right. He checked the correct schedule and almost rook me by the elbow to show me the travel agency in an adjoining alley where I could buy a ticket without going to Termini. To be fair, I speak Italian, which I tried to do most of the time, and I think you are always treated better when you speak the language. The location was good: close enough to the major sights to walk to most of them but far enough away to get away from the chaos. There was a subway stop right near the hotel, although I never learned to use it. If I have one complaint, it was with the bathroom (isn't it always); The shower, toilet, and bidet were raised about three inches. On top of this there was a sliding glass door, which added another inch or so and was completely unnecessary since it was a single room. The opening through the door was narrower than my shoulders, which meant I had to enter sideways. It was much more fun exiting sideways, once the floor was wet from the showers. But this was a minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Barocco, Barberini, and Bernini”
Reviews.Author: Jackcatscal
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at Hotel Barocco last week. Very pleasant experience. Bedroom adequate size, bathroom unusually large. Windows opened on alley, which was probably a plus. Windows on Piazza Barberini would have been too noisy. Front desk personnel were very conversant in English, and very helpful. Breakfast was terrific. Plus, had the breakfast room staff make me up a tray every morning for me to take to my late-sleeping wife. No extra cost for any of this. Asked the hotel by prior email to arrange a driver for us from the airport. Highly recommended. Only about 10 Euros more than a cab. (However, cabs are metered, so traffic jams can boost the price). Was told the driver would wait for up to forty minutes in case of late arrival. This one waited a full hour, with no complaints. Plus, he provided us a mini guided tour on the way to the hotel. Only real complaint is the cost of the hotel. Ah, well. Final note: Rome was staggeringly crowded with tourists. Vatican museums were impossible; on-off tourist bus was like something out of Calcutta; and there were thousands of people at the Trevi fountain the couple of time we passed by.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HBVoyager
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 4 night first time in Rome, made all the more pleasant by our stay at the Hotel Barocco in a most convenient central location off Via Veneto. Very friendly, helpful and professional staff, and all details of the rooms and buffet obviously carefully thought out. All email questions beforehand were answered almost immediately. For those with carry on bags without liquids, they have toothpaste, shampoo, soap to get by in the rooms. Across the street next to the Internet Cafe there is the Beauty Point supply store where additional items can be purchased. The hotel has a wireless network where you can just purchase online tokens by hour increments, however, you must use it at time of login, so you could just get 1 or 2 hours ea night for checking email. The hotel booked VasTours bus tours to see the highlights of Rome during our short stay. In our case the guides were professional and knowledgeable. The guide for our walk-thru Ancient Rome and inside the Colosseum Tour B1 was an archaeologist, excellent. We had carry on bags on arrival, and the hotel booked a car to pick us up just outside Customs, and we booked the same car service back. Anyone will feel welcome, safe and comfortable in this delightful hotel with 5 star service. Travelers-Huntington Beach, California

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barocco Was Everything and More”
Reviews.Author: Linda Margaret
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience in Rome and I am grateful that we followed Trip Advisor's reviews and stayed at the Hotel Barocco. Reservations were comfirmed by email and check-in was efficiently smooth. All of the Staff was exceedingly cordial, arranging for shuttle service to the Airport, confirming our flight arrangements, etc. They even provided fresh towels in the evening ( a maid knocked on our door) if you used yours during the day. The air-conditioned rooms were sufficient. Extremely clean and neat. Ours had a cute semi circular staircase that led to a marble floored bath and carpeted dressing area on a level lower than the bedroom. Marble througout the halls, wel lit, chrome, mirrors...all added to give the illusion of an establishment larger when in fact it was quite compact and having homey appeal. The breakfast buffet was set with linen and lace tablecloths, silver cutlery, flowers...the works. The food provided ranged from eggs to pastery delights, cereals, cheeses, crusty rolls, fresh fruit and much, much more. After a day in Rome and discovering the price for a meal, we felt that the breakfast included with our room fee was well worth it! Polite waitresses attended to one's desire for coffee, tea and an assortment of beverages. Location, location, location...and this hotel had it. Five minutes walk (or less) up the Serpentine and we were at the Spanish Steps. Fifteen minutes and we were at the Colosseum. Also, the Hotel sits in a less conjested area, facing a narrow street with practically zero traffic. We kept the shutters ajar all evening without the disturbing honking horns or shouts of passers-by. Trust me...this is a BIG PLUS. While touring, we saw many hotels facing major avenues and tourist hot-spots where the sounds were constant and sometimes deafening. I checked Above Average, because there is without a doubt some hotel out there that surpasses this small Hotel, but my ABOVE average is on the high side of the scale. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to the Piazza Barberini and the splashing fountain mere steps from Hotel Barocco's front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wellesley82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barocco at the start of an eight day trip in Italy. My friend and I spent three nights here, each of us in our own single room. My room was very adequately sized, with two large windows in the bedroom and a very nice bathroom (no tub, but a large shower) with a window. My friend's room was a bit smaller (strange, since it was the same number room, just on the next floor up), with only one window in the bedroom. The bed was very comfortable and the maid service was excellent, with twice daily cleaning. Breakfast in the morning was the best of the whole trip, with really first class ham offered, along with the usual eggs and some excellent rolls. The hotel staff was very pleasant. The location of the hotel cannot be beat, with the Metro just across the piazza. There is an internet cafe right next to the metro stop, so it's easy to stay in touch with home. I would definitely stay here again. My only regret is that we didn't spend more time in Rome - a fantastic city with tons to see and do!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel does have some cons, but they are outweighed by the pros. The cons are principally the small-ish rooms and the proximity to Piazza Barberini and Via Veneto, which means there is a lot of traffic noise. Our sleep was also disturbed by the loud talking and squeaky trainers of some of our American co-guests (why can't American tourists talk quietly and wear ordinary shoes like everyone else?). But the pros are significant: excellent service (rooms immaculate, we were switched to a room with jacuzzi-bath without complaint, reliable restaurant recommendations etc etc), very well appointed furnishings, delicious breakfast spread and - the major plus - a location that could not be more central, close to the Centro Storico and right on top of the Barberini metro station. We were very pleased with our 3-night stay. And do visit Giardino restaurant round the corner (the receptionist will give you the directions) - they do a superb anti-pasto spread.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I have just spent 3 nights at the wonderful Hotel Barocco. Upon arriving from the airport our taxi driver pointed us to a little doorway facing the Piazza Barberini that had a buzzer and a small hotel sign above it, after a short, slightly confused conversation between myself and the hotel reception over an intercom on the wall we were told we had been sent to the wrong door as the proper hotel entrance is actually just off the piazza down a side street to the right of this doorway and that some one was coming to find us. I only mention this so that anyone in the future will realise and be able to find the reception desk first time, im sure if our taxi driver hadnt pointed us at this doorway we probably would have been less confused. Once inside we were very impressed with the hotel and its staff, most of the staff speak excellent english and they were always freindly and helpful. They provided us with a street map of the main centre of rome that became invaluable when getting around as we walked to all the sights. Our room (number 29) was large and spacious with a small 2 seater sofa, large double bed, two bathrooms (one large one and one smaller one) and air conditioning. The room has two large windows that look straight out onto the piazza bernini and the view of the fountain was excellent. The maids came twice a day and room was always kept spotlessly clean and tidy. The buffet breakfast was good with a decent range of cerals, meat, cakes, cheese, bacon, scrambled eggs and fruit juices. The Piazza Barberini is a great location as it is surrounded by restaurants and shops and is within easy walking distance of most of the sights, especially the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. Each evening we dined in a differant restaurant on the Via Vittorio Veneto which were all very classy looking places and the food was always good. Hotel reception arranged a car to take us to the airport on our last day and also looked after our suitcases while we went out for the day as we didnt need to be at the airport until the evening. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definatly stay there again should we return to Rome. The only problem we had was with the noise from the busy piazza at night, my girlfriend is a light sleeper and had some trouble sleeping amongst all the beeping of horns and revving of moped engines throughout the night but after a long days walking around this beautiful city she was tired enough to sleep through it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Romantic Visit at Barocco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of 12 friends, American couples, spent several nights at Hotel Barocco in Rome on route to Tuscany. Our rooms were generous sized, baths were marble and spotless, and the breakfast included was sumptuous each day. The staff was extremely accomodating and friendly and arranged for a tour for us of Hadrian's Villa. We would stay at the hotel again, any chance we had and would recommend it to friends. Room number 48 was especially nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed at the Barocco for a long weekend. Very clean comfortable hotel. Staff are very friendly and helpful and the service is excellent. Within easy reach of all the sights, we walked back from the Vatican on Sunday. If you don't fancy walking, there is a metro stop in the Piazza Barberini and the hotel can supply the 1 day tickets for metro and bus. Would definitely recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: cardiff010
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in room no. 49, which has a balcony overlooking the Piazza. The room is HUGE with one side engaged with floor length opening doors/windows to the long balcony overlooking the Piazza. Inlaid marble floors, toiletries, fluffy bathrobes & slippers all add to the ambiance of a quality hotel. The whole hotel was spotless with maid service twice a day. Standard rooms looked quite small, but well furnished and elegant. Although the hotel has a lift, there are still several levels to each floor, with numerous steps to navigate. Whilst the hotel does not have a restaurant, the breakfast room is elegant with good quality table cloths and cutlery. Breakfast choice is adequate, and it can be booked for room service without extra charge. Reception staff were very helpful and welcoming, with a vast knowledge of what to do and where to go. There are numerous bars and restuarants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. Accessing the whole of Rome is very easy from the Piazza directly outside via bus/taxi, although we walked most days, getting lost amongst the narrow streets and finding interesting shops and cafes. We thought it would be a fast placed dirty capitol city - but it is so different from any other city we've visted. It is clean, elegant, amazing, relaxing and welcoming. The coloseum is amazing, but make sure you go early to avoid the masses - the same with the Vatican. Have lunch on Piazza Navona and watch the world go by! We will definately be returning to Rome and this hotel. Ciao.

HotelInfo.Name: Barocco Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Barberini 9 | Entrance: Via della Purificazione, 4, 00187 Rome, Italy
